description:
Who are we?

A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.

We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?

Learn more about our unique culture and history .

Job Opportunity

Catastrophe Engineering and Analytics (CAT E&A) is an innovative and versatile technical team conducting catastrophe risk research and development and providing complex quantitative metrics that inform underwriting decisions. The Software Engineer within the CAT E&A team will play a crucial role in designing and developing end-to-end systems to deploy and run models. This role involves deep cross functional collaboration with business, product, and data science teams, while driving successful project outcomes. Not only will you focus on backend development, but another dimension to the role also demands some expertise with building data pipelines, data manipulation, and so forth.

Duties & Responsibilities

• Collaborate closely with application engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders in building and maintaining existing software to support existing platforms.
• Work with the team to help develop our technical platform to be more user-friendly and seamless, with an emphasis on bringing the various individual models together in a more uniform framework.
• Understand and assist with the development of AI and machine learning related projects that are underway.
• Contribute to the development, maintenance, and evolution of our platform.
• Help drive technology and architecture decisions along with mentoring teammates. 
• Contribute to the design and architecture of scalable, reliable systems.
• Write maintainable and well-tested code along with designing the system. 
• Build robust data pipelines, perform data analysis, and deploy models.


Qualifications, Skills And Experience

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is preferred.
• Minimum three years of relevant experience in software engineering, data engineering, or ML engineering.
• Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Proficiency in Python (Pandas, NumPy, or SciPy) or R is required. 
• Previous experience in building Batch or Streaming Data and ML pipelines is preferred.
• Proficiency in building and working with APIs is preferred. 
• Exposure to GIS libraries, PostGIS, GDAL is preferred. 
• Experience with both streaming and batch processing of data is preferred.
• Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes is preferred.


BHSI Offers

• A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammates
• A dynamic, action oriented, and thoughtful environment centered on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates and our other stakeholders
• A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasizes individual excellence in a team framework


NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

The base salary range for this position in California is from $115,000 – $155,000 along with annual bonus eligibility; a candidate’s salary is determined by their relevant skills and experience. We value our teammates – both their capabilities and character – as demonstrated by our amazing culture.

Job summary
At Integrity, we are redefining the future of work. We believe that our people are our greatest asset, and we are committed to creating a workplace where they can thrive. As we continue to grow and innovate, we are looking for a dynamic and strategic Senior Manager, People Analytics & Insights to join our team. This role is critical in leveraging data to drive decisions and shape the employee experience.


As the Senior Manager, People Analytics & Insights you will lead our efforts to harness the power of data to optimize our people/talent strategies and enhance organizational performance. You will be at the forefront of transforming how we use Workday to gather insights, influence decision-making, and drive business outcomes. This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact by translating data into actionable intelligence that supports our strategic goals.


Let’s talk job responsibilities:
• Lead People Analytics and Workday Adoption Initiatives: Design and implement people analytics strategies that align with organizational objectives, using Workday as the primary platform. Additionally, oversee the product management lifecycle of Workday adoption, including planning, execution, and continuous improvement.
• Data-Driven Decision Making: Provide insights and recommendations to senior leadership on talent management, workforce planning, employee engagement, and other People & Culture initiatives, ensuring data-driven decisions.
• Advanced Analytics & Reporting: Develop and maintain advanced analytics models, dashboards, and reports in Workday, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Utilize these tools to monitor and report on Workday adoption and effectiveness.
• Workday Optimization: Identify opportunities to enhance Workday functionality and user experience, collaborating with HR and IT teams to implement improvements and ensure seamless integration with existing processes.
• Presentation Creation: Create compelling presentations and reports for leadership, effectively communicating key findings, strategic recommendations, and progress on Workday adoption.
• Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with HRLT, P&C Partners, and other business leaders to understand their needs and deliver tailored analytics solutions that drive informed decisions. Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful Workday implementation and utilization.
• Employee Insights: Conduct in-depth analyses of employee data, terminations, pulse checks, etc., to identify trends, predict future outcomes, and recommend proactive measures to enhance the employee experience.
• Workforce Gap Analysis: Evaluate market and company data to make hiring recommendations, ensuring alignment with business needs.
• Continuous Improvement: Stay current with the latest trends and best practices in people analytics and Workday, continuously improving our processes and tools. Lead initiatives to increase Workday adoption and user satisfaction.


Your experience and skills:
• Bachelor’s Degree In Data Science, Statistics, Human Resources, Business, or a related field.
• Minimum of 5+ years of experience in people analytics, HR analytics, HR product management, or a related field.
• Proficient in Workday HCM, including reporting, dashboards, advanced analytics, and product management.
• Experience with other data analytics tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python) is a plus. Experience with predictive modeling is a plus.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights.
• Experience in managing product lifecycles, including planning, execution, and continuous improvement, preferably with HR technology or Workday.

Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies, Workers Compensation Division, has an immediate need for an Operations Command Center Engineer 2 (OCCE2). The OCCE2 will be responsible for handling escalated incidents as referred by OCCE1, performing deeper troubleshooting, incident management, and root cause analysis. This individual will provide technical expertise to ensure uptime and efficiency in the operations of IT systems, applications, and infrastructure, and will be involved in maintaining and updating monitoring tools, processes, and cloud-based solutions to enhance operational efficiency. Contributes to key areas such as network management, system administration, and automation.

Key Responsibilities

• Manages escalated tickets from OCCE1 for advanced troubleshooting and problem resolution across network, system, and cloud platforms. 
• Proactively monitors system health, performance, and uptime, ensuring continuous service availability using advanced monitoring and observability tools.
• Identifies recurring incidents and initiates root cause analysis for long-term resolution.
• Collaborates with cross-functional teams, including Applications, Infrastructure, Security, and Cloud teams, to resolve incidents.
• Configures, troubleshoots, and maintains network devices (e.g., routers, switches, firewalls) and ensures secure remote access (VPN, remote desktop solutions). 
• Manages and maintains cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP), including virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V) and automation (Terraform, Ansible). 
• Develops and refines operational runbooks, playbooks, and response procedures, focusing on improving cloud governance and security. 
• Participates in on-call rotations to support incident handling outside of normal business hours. 
• Contributes to the continuous improvement of monitoring tools, cloud services, and incident management processes. 
• Prepares and delivers post-incident reports, root cause analysis, and lessons learned to Senior Management. 
• Ensures that SLAs related to response times, escalation, and ticket handling are met consistently. 
• Coordinates shift handovers with detailed incident reporting and supporting documentation.
• Leads efforts on system administration (Windows, Linux, Mac OS), backup and disaster recovery procedures, and server management. 
• Participates in project management efforts, capacity planning and risk management for ongoing operations.


Education/Experience

• Education: Minimum of High School diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related discipline preferred. 
• Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in IT operations, HelpDesk, or similar roles, with a minimum of 1 year of experience with VPN, remote access technologies, and network monitoring required. Experience with Windows, Linux, and/or Mac OS administration.


Preferred Certifications

• Comp TIA Network+
• Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
• Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
• AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
• Google Professional Cloud Architect
• Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)
• Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)
• CompTIA CySA+ (Cybersecurity Analyst)
• Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) - ISACA
• GIAC Security Essentials (GSEC)
• PRINCE2 Practitioner
• Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) - PMI
• Certified ScrumMaster (CSM)
• ITIL Practice Manager (PM)


SKILLS NEEDED: Network & Infrastructure Management

• Network configuration and troubleshooting
• VPN and remote access technologies
• Cloud networking (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
• Virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V, KVM)
• Storage solutions (SAN, NAS, DAS)
• Server management and configuration (Windows, Linux)
• DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP protocols


SKILLS NEEDED: System Administration

• Windows, Linux, and Mac OS administration 
• User and group management (AD, LDAP) 
• Patch management and system updates 
• Backup and disaster recovery procedures 
• Server health monitoring and performance tuning


SKILLS NEEDED: Cloud & Virtualization

• Cloud platform management (AWS, Azure, GCP) 
• Cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) 
• Cloud security and governance 
• Cloud automation tools (Terraform, CloudFormation)


SKILLS NEEDED: DevOps & CI/CD

• Monitoring and observability (Prometheus, Grafana) 
• Incident and change management 
• Scripting and automation (Python, Bash, PowerShell)


SKILLS NEEDED: Security & Compliance

• Firewalls, IDS/IPS, and VPNs 
• Endpoint security and antivirus solutions 
• SIEM platforms (Chronicle, Splunk, QRadar) 
• Vulnerability management (Nessus, Qualys) 
• Identity and Access Management (IAM) 
• Compliance standards (ISO, NIST, GDPR, HIPAA) 
• Data loss prevention (DLP) 
• Network security protocols (SSL/TLS, IPsec)


SKILLS NEEDED: Database Management

• Database administration (SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle) 
• Data backup and recovery 
• NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis)


SKILLS NEEDED: Monitoring & Observability

• System and application monitoring (Nagios, Zabbix, SolarWinds)
• Log management and analysis (ELK Stack, Splunk)
• Cloud monitoring (CloudWatch, Azure Monitor)
• Event correlation and root cause analysis


SKILLS NEEDED: End-User Support & Troubleshooting

• Desktop support (Windows, Mac OS)
• Ticketing and help desk systems (JIRA, ServiceNow) 
• Hardware and software troubleshooting 
• SLA management and tracking


SKILLS NEEDED: Automation & Scripting

• Scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell, Python) 
• Automation tools (Ansible, Puppet, Chef) 
• Workflow automation


SKILLS NEEDED: Project Management & Documentation

• Project management frameworks (Agile, Scrum, ITIL) 
• Change management processes 
• Documentation standards (SOPs, runbooks) 
• Risk management and mitigation


SKILLS NEEDED: Data Analytics & Reporting

• Data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
• Basic data analytics and query skills
• KPI monitoring and reporting


What We Offer

• Work-Life Balance
• Modern Office Setting
• Free On-Site Fitness Facility
• Free On-Site Garage Parking


Benefits

• Paid Time Off
• Paid Holidays
• Retirements Savings Match
• Group Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
• Life and AD&D Insurance
• Long Term Disability Insurance
• Accident and Critical Illness Insurance
• Flexible Savings Accounts
• Paid Community Volunteer Day
• Employee Assistance Program
• Tuition Reimbursement Program
• Employee Referral Program
• Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Program


$73,040 - $111,020 a year

This pay scale is an estimate of the salary range the employer reasonably expects to pay for the position based on potential employee qualifications, operational needs and other considerations consistent with applicable law. The actual salary may be above or below the range. The pay scale applies only to this position and only if it is filled in San Diego, California. The pay scale may be different for other positions or in other locations.

About Us

With more than 50 years in business, BHHC has grown from a regional organization to a national insurance group, offering insurance products from coast to coast. Relationships are the cornerstone of our culture, and we believe in doing the right thing. That means we invest in our business in every way possible to deliver on our mission and demonstrate that people are what powers our success. Our commitment to financial strength and integrity means our customers can rest assured that we will be there when it counts.

At BHHC we embrace diversity and foster an environment where our people can be their authentic selves. Our differences make us stronger and better together, which fosters a harmonious workplace—something we truly value. We’ve created an approachable and collaborative atmosphere. Here you’ll find a welcoming workplace where everyone can feel valued, supported, and inspired to do great work. Together, we raise the bar by being curious, remaining customer-focused, and operating with integrity.

description:
| 100% Remote opportunity (must work and live in the U.S without sponsorship)

General Summary

Serving under EMPLOYERS Chief Information Officer, the VP, Data & Analytics will lead a comprehensive team of Business Intelligence, Data Platform Operations, and Data Governance/Quality professionals. This role will be a senior member of the Technology organization. The VP is responsible for working with all functional areas across the business to develop advanced data, analytics, and reporting capabilities for the enterprise, delivering on time, with a high degree of accuracy. They are a key enabler in achieving business strategies through predictive analytics and insights and are a critical component in creating a competitive advantage for the company.

The VP, Data & Analytics is an experienced leader with strong technical and business acumen and is an enabler of the organization’s transformation in its use of data.This person is a high-impact leader with the experience and understanding of the breadth of our business, as well as a great problem solver that is detail oriented and has strong execution and leadership skills. The VP, Data & Analytics will partner with business leadership to understand the full breadth of needs & capabilities, and will direct his/her teams, in conjunction with driving data maturity goals, to deliver prioritized data and analytical capabilities which will serve as a differentiator in how EMPLOYERS operates.The VP will align key capabilities, platforms, and improvements into a comprehensive roadmap that aligns with product management which drives clarity for the organization and provides a clear vision of how EMPLOYERS will leverage data to drive business outcomes.

This is a leadership position that requires exceptional communication and collaboration skills as well as deep data knowledge and experience. The position works with key stakeholders to understand their needs and enhance processes to support reporting deliverables, that are completed on time, with a high degree of accuracy. This person is also accountable for the performance of their organization and must hire, manage, provide timely feedback, develop, and empower employees while holding them accountable.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

• Key member of the Technology leadership team that will actively participate and provide insights into leadership discussions, create value by measuring and interpreting business strategies, provide actionable recommendations to capitalize on those insights, standardize common metrics and reporting, and define and mature data capabilities and tools
• Lead and mentor team, promote growth and development; and define paths for upskilling the organization where needed
• Champion for a self-service data-driven culture, data competencies and data literacy across the enterprise.
• Partner with business stakeholders and executive leadership to define and execute against a roadmap for capability improvement, associated investment strategy, and planned business insights and how they will achieve business objectives while maximizing the value derived from data assets
• Bring thought leadership, project management oversight, and insurance expertise to complex business challenges.Ensure team priorities are aligned with those of the business segments they support, and that they provide partnership on leveraging data and analytics capabilities
• Contribute to, maintain, and enhance a robust, enterprise-wide measurement framework which enables executive leadership to clearly understand business trajectory, operational readiness, and other key functional KPIs critical to the successful measurement & improvement of the organization
• Align with leaders across the organization to prioritize and execute on BI/Analytics technology enhancements with business deliverables and to implement a robust information architecture and data governance model
• Create, execute and actively deliver against a shared vision, strategy and deployment plan to create best-in-class meta data warehousing infrastructure, and analytical and reporting tools
• Own and oversee enterprise-wide data governance & quality, putting in place systems to understand information readiness and jointly working with the business to identify improvement opportunities in systems, processes and policies
• Represent Data & Analytics needs (e.g., data capture, data reference, data curation, analytical model integration) in initial planning and requirement specification of core system and architecture design throughout development and product lifecycle, then supporting direct reports in executing against those plans
• Work with Privacy and Security constituents across the organization to ensure that EMPLOYERS is managing/maintaining information in a compliant way.Strategize and communicate with the same teams to ensure there is clarity around information requirements and how data needs to be enabled in order to move the business forward
• Understand and drive a pragmatic data infrastructure strategy which can expand as the business grows but enables rapid development/testing/deployment capability in alignment with IT and security standards
• Ensure that data infrastructure, including technology platform, reporting tools and the data itself, is sufficiently robust to support the current and emerging needs of the functions. Entails staying abreast of relevant data projects, best practices across the industry, and relevant new technical innovations
• Partner with all functions to leverage and disseminate reporting and analytics best practices. Establish management dashboards to provide actionable and timely business insights for each operating area of the company
• Own Enterprise KPIs, Executive Scorecards, and associated benchmarks.Oversee Quarterly Performance Reviews of metrics with shared insights on performance improvement opportunities
• Own process, tools, and implementation of cross-functional Test & Learn Strategies and Services, leveraging metrics to identify areas of improvement across different applications & channels
• Provide strategic partnership to business stakeholders and their organizations, helping guide decision making on recommended process/application changes and/or strategic initiatives to enable the organization to reach their goals
• Communications with senior management designed to present relevant information in an impactful manner.Communicate the state of the business to senior audiences in the organization with a strategic lens leveraging key data and reporting insights


Job Requirements

• 10+ years experience leading a data, analytics, and business intelligence function within a significant business that has delivered strong value to the business with demonstrated continuous improvement in business intelligence capabilities and processes; overall 10+ years of increasing responsibility within a data, analytics, and business intelligence function
• 8+ years experience in the insurance industry with an understanding of BI and Data Science needs across key group product lines and functional areas
• Previous organizational leadership, growth, and oversight of a distributed team of 10+ individuals required
• Demonstrated knowledge of Data Science approaches including analytical models, statistical tools, machine learning, AI and how these can be leveraged within insurance
• Demonstrated successful execution and oversight of analytics, reporting, dashboarding, and data-quality improvement initiatives
• Experience in data governance, oversight, cross-organizational alignment, and data quality assessment
• Articulated experience in data privacy GDPR/data regulations, and emerging trends
• Strong experience in data & analytics platforms, uses & alternatives including key Data Sciences and BI Tools
• Experience in third-party data usage in the insurance industry and how this can be leveraged for operational and/or growth improvements
• Background in data integration, warehousing, current implementation methodologies
• Undergraduate degree required; graduate degree preferred
• Ability to interact with colleagues at all levels, especially senior executives, work through influence across functional boundaries to achieve goals without direct control over resources. Deliver results while coaching and mentoring other team members
• An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted for the requirements listed above.


 Base Salary  : $150,000 - $225,000 and a comprehensive benefits package and bonus opportunity, please follow the link to our benefits page for details! https://www.employers.com/careers/our-benefits-and-perks/

About EMPLOYERS Digital Transformation

EMPLOYERS is currently transforming its operations into a next-generation digital company – leveraging data and insights across all functions and enabling seamless interactions between our customers and partners in a next-gen digital ecosystem.This transformation is core to improving our interactions with our customers and creating a platform/environment where we can expand into new markets and opportunities.The organization of the Chief Transformation Officer, where this team sits, is key to leading/guiding this conversion – and is hiring breakthrough-leaders who can help drive this change.

Work Environment/Physical Demands

This role is REMOTE, but only open to candidates currently located in the United States.

• It requires a suitable space that provides a private and quiet workplace.


EXPECTED WORK HOURS: Schedules are set to accommodate the requirements of the position and the needs of the organization and may be adjusted as needed.

TRAVEL: May be required to travel to off-site location(s) to attend meetings, as necessary

• This role potentially and will routinely use office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, and web conferencing technology as examples.
• This is largely a sedentary role; however, some mobility is required.
• May work early, late, or occasional weekend hours to accommodate business needs.
• Occasional lifting of a maximum of 30lbs.
• Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


About EMPLOYERS

EMPLOYERS is a dynamic, fast-growing provider of workers' compensation insurance and services, we are seeking a goal-oriented individual willing to put their ideas to work!

We offer a positive, challenging work environment, combined with an opportunity to build your career as you help us grow our business, in innovative and imaginative ways that are uniquely EMPLOYERS®!

Headquartered in Nevada, EMPLOYERS attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our employees across the United States.EMPLOYERS is known for the quality service and expertise we provide to our clients, and the exemplary work environment we provide for our employees.

We live and breathe our core values: Integrity, Customer Focus, Collaboration, Initiative, Accountability, Innovation, and Personal Fulfillment.These are the pillars that support how we do business with our clients as well as how we treat each other!

At EMPLOYERS, you’ll discover an energetic environment that inspires top achievement.As “America’s small business insurance specialist”, we have the resources, a solid reputation and an expanding nationwide identity to enrich your work/life and enhance your career.

We’re looking for a passionate Insurance Product Operations Manager to help our car Insurance product squads excel. Are you a highly collaborative, creative thinker who’s passionate about craftsmanship and excellence? Are you a force of nature when it comes to end-to-end execution? If so, this could be the opportunity for you.


As we expand our car product, you’ll help the car Insurance teams to scale and improve and enhance the alignment between the insurance and product teams. Your ultimate goal: Push forward innovations that will enable the car Insurance teams to scale and improve.


In this role you’ll:
• Develop and implement operational processes to streamline insurance product initiatives
• Identify and resolve bottlenecks to guide efficient delivery of products
• Manage product launch timelines, ensuring all deliverables are met on schedule
• Facilitate communication and collaboration across teams to drive product success
• Implement best practices and tools for project management, collaboration, and communication
• Empower our car insurance product teams to optimize for scale and efficiency, while consistently holding stakeholders accountable for their deliverables, and with minimal friction
• Support various squads in their planning processes, making sure future plans align with organizational goals
• Help choose and support relevant tools and processes for automation and best practices


What you’ll need:
• At least 5 years of experience in tech operations
• Exceptional people skills and a surplus of empathy
• Proven experience creating and enforcing processes to achieve deliverable outcomes with speed and excellence
• Stellar verbal and written communication skills
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong project management skills with experience using task and project management tools
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, while managing multiple priorities
• Ability to travel to our US offices once a quarter
• Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
• Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture

Digital Product Manager

When, Millennial Specialty Insurance (“MSI”) partnered with Baldwin Risk Partners in 2019, we were a single-product tech-enabled renters insurance platform with [18] colleagues. Today, MSI has grown to over 700 colleagues with more than 10 insurance products thru a combination of rapid organic growth and strategic, tech-enabled partnerships. We believe that through our scalable, tech-enabled, proprietary platform and products, we will fundamentally change the insurance industry. We are dedicated to a culture that has innovation at its core and one that provides a world class colleague experience. Since 2021, we have tripled our colleague headcount to support the growth of the business. MSI is looking for top talent to help us realize our full potential. Come join us at Millennial Specialty Insurance, the MGA of the Future!

Our Technology team is seeking a highly motivated Digital Product Manager to lead our Commercial segments. This role is pivotal in defining the segment’s product strategy & roadmap as well as managing the overall delivery process with the assigned technology teams. The Digital Product Manager will oversee development projects from concept to delivery, ensuring products meet customer needs and drive business value.

Key Responsibilities

• Drive Product Development: Work together and lead design and engineering teams to translate or generate user persona needs into innovative product features and designs supporting commercial application intake, underwriting, rating, policy administration and claim management. Lead the development process of technology solutions, from initial concept to delivery. Champion the development process to ensure high-quality outcomes.
• Identify and Prioritize User Needs: Develop, present, and implement the product strategy and roadmap for the Commercial segments. Conduct comprehensive internal and market research for design and to uncover user pain points, desires, and needs. Translate these insights into a prioritized product backlog, with detailed design requirements including acceptance testing criteria ensuring that the most critical features and enhancements are addressed first
• Facilitate Product Strategy: Collaborate closely with internal and external commercial insurance and technical leaders, as well as other cross-functional teams, to define, refine, document, and implement a digital product vision and roadmap that aligns with overall business objectives. Foster strong partnerships across departments to ensure operational readiness and maximize the value realization of the digital product(s).
• Execute Product Roadmap: Define and execute a comprehensive commercial digital product roadmap, prioritizing features and enhancements. Ensure that portfolio of products is aligned and meets business and technology goals. Collaborate with the business and technical teams to manage the product backlog and prioritize features. Become a servant leader as a member of the scrum delivery team focused on setting and meeting the objectives of each sprint.
• Team Building and Development: Identify and recruit individuals who align with the company’s values and mission, ensuring a diverse and skilled team composition. Develop and implement effective onboarding processes to integrate new team members smoothly and efficiently. Facilitate continuous learning and development opportunities, including training programs, workshops, and mentorship initiatives. Promote a culture of collaboration, trust, and inclusivity, encouraging open communication and diverse perspectives.



Digital Product Manager Requirements

• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
• Proven experience as a Product Manager, preferably in a digital or technology-focused role. 
• Experience in the Commercial or Management Liability sector of the Insurance industry is preferred.
• In-depth knowledge of Agile, Waterfall, and Kanban methodologies and practices.
• Successful track record of developing digital products within deadlines.
• Deep knowledge of insurance policy & claims lifecycle is preferred.
• Strong understanding of product management principles and best practices is required.
• Excellent communication, negotiation and leadership skills.
• Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
• Excellent attention to detail
• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), development frameworks (React, Angular, Node.js), and data management (SQL, NoSQL databases).
• Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Azure DevOps.



Click here for some insight into our culture!

GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Data Analyst, you will be working on a team providing the design and implementation of a new cloud-based data platform to support firmwide digital transformation. The Data Analyst empowers the firm to make data-driven decisions and provides critical business insights that help us deliver a world-class client experience. We are seeking a talented and motivated technical expert to accelerate our efforts to drive trust, adoption, and democratization of insights externally to our clients as well as internally to our advisors, leadership, and other stakeholders.

The Data Analyst works closely with our technical teams to deliver well-defined, transformed, tested, documented, and code-reviewed analytical datasets that are the single source of truth for reliable and consistent results. The ideal candidate will love working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment to explore data and create analytics to support decision making. This position is hybrid in Independence, OH.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

• Database development, writing complex SQL queries in Azure Data Environments (Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL MI, Azure Purview, Azure Data Factory)
• Develop and implement data collection strategies that optimize data quality and increase efficiency.
• Acquire data from various data sources, filter and clean the data and implement automation for the maintenance of data integrity.
• Identify, analyze, summarize, and interpret tends or patterns in complex data sets.
• Work closely with varied business and technical teams to develop mastery of the business domains.
• Ability to identify and document the business requirement and translate them into
• data requirements
• Research, identify and implement new tools and methods to improve efficiency, performance, and cost-effectiveness.


Experience/Credentials

• Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Engineering, Statistics, or related discipline
• 5+ years working as a Data Analyst
• Experience with Azure; Data Lake, SQL Managed Instance, Data Factory, Purview
• Expert with SQL queries and writing highly complex queries to extract and analyze large data sets.


COMPETENCIES

• Ability to analyze data.
• Sound technical skills, good judgment, and strong operational focus
• Strong organizational and interpersonal skills with a demonstrated commitment to teamwork and partnerships; works effectively as part of a team and as an individual contributor.
• Capability to efficiently complete tasks in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
• Ability to exercise considerable judgment, maintain confidentiality, and act in a diplomatic manner.
• A decisive individual who possesses a detail-oriented perspective
• Maintains absolute confidentiality of all client information and safeguards client and firm data; maintains high ethical standard in all practices.
• Professional and positive demeanor, superb work ethic, high level of personal ethics and integrity


FEATURED BENEFITS:

• Discretionary Bonus
• Medical Insurance
• Dental Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• 401(k)
• Health Savings Account
• Paid Maternity Leave
• Paid Parental Leave
• Tuition Reimbursement

Description

About Reserv

Reserv is an insurtech creating and incubating cutting-edge AI and automation technology to bring efficiency and simplicity to claims. Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims, Reserv is venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures and began operations in May 2022. We are focused on automating highly manual tasks to tackle long-standing problems in claims and set a new standard for TPAs, insurance technology providers, and adjusters alike.

About the role

As the Senior Product Manager, Data at Reserv, you will be at the forefront of driving the development and innovation of our data-centric products. Working at the intersection of business, technology, and customer experience, you will be responsible for managing data products that support our insurance services and operations. You will lead the strategy, execution, and delivery of data solutions, leveraging insights to improve decision-making, enhance operational efficiency, and provide value to our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with engineering, data science, operations, and business teams to ensure our data products align with the company's goals. You will oversee the product lifecycle, from gathering requirements to launching new features, and continuously optimize product performance to meet evolving market needs.

Who you are

• Data-Driven: You possess strong data analytics skills, using data to inform product decisions and measure success, with experience in business intelligence tools and performance metrics.
• Technically Proficient: You understand data architecture, analytics platforms, and are comfortable working with engineering teams to build robust data solutions.
• Customer-Focused: You have a customer-centric approach, gathering insights and transforming them into product features that enhance customer experience and drive value.
• Strategic Thinker: You have the ability to align product strategy with business objectives, identifying opportunities for innovation and growth within the data landscape.
• Agile Practitioner: You are experienced in Agile methodologies, able to manage backlogs, lead sprint planning, and work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
• Collaborative Leader: You work well with cross-functional teams, influencing stakeholders at all levels and fostering a collaborative environment to achieve product goals.
• Excellent Communicator: You have strong communication skills, able to articulate complex concepts and product visions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Problem Solver: You are skilled at analyzing problems, identifying solutions, and making data-informed decisions to drive product success.
• Adaptable & Innovative: You thrive in an evolving environment, staying up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to keep products competitive.


What we need

We need you to do all the things typical to the role:

• Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth
• Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
• Develop product pricing and positioning strategies
• Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes
• Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact
• Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources
• Drive product launches including working with public relations team, executives, and other product management team members
• Evaluate promotional plans to ensure that they are consistent with product line strategy and that the message is effectively conveyed
• Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding
• Represent the company by visiting customers to solicit feedback on company products and services
• Support the product function globally


Requirements

• Minimum of 5 years of experience in product management, with a focus on data-driven products, ideally in the insurance or financial services industry.
• Familiarity with data architecture, data management, and analytics platforms, with a proven ability to work closely with engineering teams.
• Experience managing products in an Agile environment, including writing user stories, managing backlogs, and facilitating sprint planning sessions.
• Experience in managing end-to-end product life cycles, including developing and prioritizing product roadmaps and ensuring alignment with business goals.
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to make data-informed decisions in fast-paced environments.


Benefits

• Generous health-insurance package with nationwide coverage, vision, & dental
• 401(k) retirement plan with employer matching
• Competitive PTO policy – we want our employees fresh, healthy, happy, and energized!
• Generous family leave policy
• Work from anywhere to facilitate your work life balance
• Apple laptop, large second monitor, and other quality-of-life equipment you may want. Technology is something that should make your life easier, not harder!


Additionally, we will

• Work toward reducing and eliminating all the administrative work
• Foster a culture of empathy, transparency, and empowerment in a remote-first environment


At Reserv, we value diversity in backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences and believe that diversity in viewpoints and critical thinking drives innovation, first-principles thinking, and success. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and encourage those from all walks of life to apply. If you believe you are a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you!

You spend at least a third of your day at your job. You might as well spend it doing something you really love while working with a team you really enjoy being with, right? That’s the kind of atmosphere we offer at Pekin Insurance—fun, fast-paced, gratifying, supportive, and collaborative.

Of course, it’s not all fun and games. Insurance is a serious business, and we pride ourselves on making people’s lives whole again after a major disaster or even a fender bender. It’s that sense of helping people that makes our team want to do our best every day.

If you want to be excited about starting your workday and are ready to make a real difference in people’s lives, this could be the right spot for you.

See what Pekin Insurance has to offer by viewing a short video here.

Position Overview

The Technology Manager works with business and IT to solve customer and business problems using technology. The Technology Manager will partner closely with the business to set the vision and prioritize product functionality and enhancements. The Technology Manager will also lead and empower product team members to design the best solutions with the user experience in mind. Technology Managers need to be able to influence and hold the team accountable, as well as colleagues, stakeholders, and key executives, using data and logic.

This specific opportunity is to oversee the Agent and Customer Digital Experience product teams, responsible for the product roadmap, delivery, and production support of our flagship portals: Agent Portal for independent agents and MyPI portal for insureds. The manager will lead the strategic direction of Pekin’s user journeys as it relates to service capabilities for those who sell our insurance products, as well as self-service capabilities on pekininsurance.com for our policyholders.

The Technology Manager will apply proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to guide their teams on issues related to mission-critical information and software systems.

Essential Job Functions

• Responsibilities will include leading industry, market, and customer research, building product strategy and roadmap, acting as a change leader and championing change initiatives, establishing fast feedback loops to learn and accelerate outcomes, aligning and communicating with stakeholders, establish time schedules with engineering, and facilitating cross-team collaboration
• Work with designers and developers to build an understanding of end-user needs, develop a product roadmap and feature requirements, and execute on that roadmap. You should be well-versed in the product development cycle from ideation all the way through exploration, execution, and impact
• Partners with Business leaders to drive product vision, strategy, and prioritization of work
• Holds teams accountable for delivering results in alignment with department and business strategy. Coaches team members on a continuous basis, documents performance evaluations, and performs management duties of staff. 
• Implement and hold teams accountable to functional policies, procedures, enterprise security, IT risk & compliance, and quality assurance best practices
• Review and analyze existing applications and system effectiveness and then develop and present strategies for leveraging or improving these systems
• Responsible for preparing, establishing, and monitoring budgets
• Partners with business groups, product teams, and other internal teams in their area of responsibility, and external service providers to establish and manage service level agreements (SLAs) that support business objectives
• Partners with Vendor Managers to provide recommendations throughout the vendor negotiations and contract development processes and reviews and reports on vendor performance
• Executes appropriate communication, process, and educational plans for mitigating the disruption of change
• Manage communications and working relationships between IT and other departments within the organization as well as multiple outside IT service providers


Required

Education & Experience

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
• At least 3-5 years of direct or indirect leadership experience
• 2 years working on technology-powered products as either a technology manager, product manager, product owner, engineer, data analyst, data scientist or relative business experience.


Preferred

• Agile and Product Management Experience
• Guidewire and Insurance experience preferred
• DevOps experience preferred


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Demonstrated knowledge of:

• Understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery
• Multiple functional areas of business – engineering, design, finance, sales, or marketing
• Have or develop a deep knowledge of the customer and their needs
• Agile and product management methodologies
• The domains of any core technologies that the product requires to deliver capabilities


Demonstrated Ability To

• Display a strong passion and enthusiasm for the success of the product and team
• Partner and collaborate across the organization to optimize outcomes
• Assess solutions for current and future needs
• Work across multiple groups within IT to ensure end-to-end performance
• Be adaptable and embrace change needed to deliver value to the customer
• Be accountable for your product by taking ownership and having a willingness to do what it takes to deliver on product requirements
• Engage stakeholders to support important business decisions
• Translate technical language into meaningful, outcome-centric language for customers
• Work with business areas to understand needs/requirements with an ability provide innovative solutions
• Present to all levels of management & executive leadership
• Empower employees by promoting trust between team members and stakeholders needed to deliver business outcomes
• Manage a team of IT professionals including coaching, development, and performance evaluations
• Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications and content, and participating in professional societies

Location: Hybrid Work Model – Van Wert, Ohio or Dublin, Ohio

We are looking for a Software Engineering Manager that can lead, coach, and empower a team of software engineers to deliver world-class solutions. You will partner with product management on roadmap development, with tech leads on design and architecture, and be responsible for a delivery process that pushes features into production consistently and with high quality. We expect our leaders to be coaches and people development is a critical focus for this role.

What You Will Do

• Must be able to drive software delivery on the Insurance Product roadmap. 
• Leads engineers on one product-facing teams. Plays a critical role in building of various software engineering projects while aligning them with business and following security strategies and engineering org standards. 
• Establishes operational objectives, procedures and work plans and delegates assignments to the team(s). 
• Makes final decisions on implementation and ensures operational effectiveness. 
• Guides the product manager on design and implementation trade-offs against economic and time costs. 
• Translates problems into designs that guide software engineering teams through implementation of the product. 
• Has the detailed technical knowledge necessary to explain feature requirements to developers and work with them to deliver these product improvements to end users. 
• Engages with Tech Leads and broader Central Insurance technology excellence communities to provide technical vision and strategy for the teams; design and lead a technical roadmap, balancing short- and long-term technology investments. 
• Executes on technology strategy and engineering roadmaps created by Director or Senior Managers. 
• Provides engineers with specific coaching on how to be scale their effectiveness through technical, professional or business growth 
• Conduct managerial interviews for candidates. 
• Participates in the Incident Management on-call rotation to help ensure the availability goals for CMI are met, by working with Devops engineers and development team members.



What You Will Bring

• 4 years related experience in PL 
• Preferred Qualifications: 
• Prior experience on teams that supported software for Finance & Accounting teams in the Insurance industry. 
• Technical credibility: Experience as an engineer or senior engineer 
• General understanding of leadership skills, including coaching, team building, and conflict resolution 
• Advanced project management skills including time and risk management, resource prioritization, and project structuring. 
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
• Ability to manage teams across geographies to drive workforce development and achieve desired results 
• Strong verbal and written communication skills, including negotiation, presentation, and influence skills 
• Advanced business acumen, technical knowledge, and extensive knowledge in applications and technologies 
• Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills 
• Ability to understand Central Insurance’s policies and processes


Work Authorization

Central will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Central that all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, job classification and assignment, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment and all other terms and conditions of employment shall be maintained in a manner which will not discriminate against any person because of race, color, age, sex, national origin, ancestry, religion, marital status, military status, or disability. The applicant should respond to questions on this application in a way that will not divulge such information.

description:
CURRENT ROOT EMPLOYEES - Please apply using the career page in Workday. This career site is for external applicants only.

The Opportunity

We believe that a disruptive insurance company must have a principled quantitative framework at its foundation. At Root, we are committed to the rigorous development and effective deployment of modern statistical machine learning methods to problems in the insurance industry.

At Root, the Quantitative Science team is responsible for the majority of all marketing capital allocation, using quantitative methods to test, maintain, and enhance our marketing strategies across numerous distribution channels. As a Lead Data Scientist II on the Growth Data Science team, you will spearhead R&D initiatives ranging from optimizing media mix to launching experimental campaigns in new channels, particularly those in the mid and upper funnel.

With deep experience in full funnel marketing, you will provide domain-wide thought leadership on experimentation, targeting, measurement, and best practices. You will proactively identify new opportunities for expansion and optimization, shepherding solutions from R&D into production. You will influence your leader to help shape and prioritize the team’s experimentation roadmap.

Root is a “work where it works best” company. This means we will support you working in whatever location that works best for you across the US.

 Salary Range: $151,200 - $189,000 (Bonus and LTI eligible)

How You Will Make An Impact

• Spearhead the research and development of media mix models to drive demonstrably profitable growth
• Perform rapid testing and rigorous measurement of novel marketing strategies
• Provide domain-wide thought leadership on mid-upper funnel experimentation, targeting, measurement, and best practices based on industry experience
• Proactively identify and frame greenfield opportunities for expansion and optimization of direct marketing at Root
• Build data science pipelines to quickly iterate on research ideas and put them into production
• Influence tactical and strategic planning for the team, including sprint planning, 6-week reviews, and quarterly OKR setting
• Take end-to-end ownership of problem domains and continuously improve upon quantitative solutions


What You Will Need To Succeed

• Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (PhD preferred) and 6+ years of applying advanced quantitative techniques to problems in industry
• Full funnel marketing experience:
• Developing, executing, and measuring the impact of targeted, data-driven marketing strategies
• Targeting Models: building and deploying ML targeting models for video, display, and/or email campaigns
• Measurement: designing and implementing A/B tests to measure the incremental lift of a new campaign
• Media Mix Models: building and operationalizing media mix models, with rigorous post-deployment analysis of their efficacy


• Technical skills:
• Advanced programming skills with experience using modern packages in Python or R; expertise in databases and SQL; familiarity with version control (e.g. Git)
• Experience with AWS (or analogous) utilities, e.g., EC2, SageMaker, S3, Athena
• Excellent business intelligence and visualization skills, with the ability to speak to many different audiences
• Ownership mentality: takes the initiative to identify, champion, and execute on the highest impact work
• Ability to consider problems from first principles, with the instinct to use expertise and prior experience to guide but not dictate the solution


• Preferred but not required:
• Experience working with DSPs such as The Trade Desk and Meta
• Experience using identity graphs to enhance targeting and measurement of marketing campaigns
• MLOps: experience with automation and building scalable and efficient ML solutions, familiarity with software engineering best practices
• Insurance industry experience

Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Root, Inc., we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Join us

At Root, we judge people based on the merit of their work, not who they are. If you are passionate about what this role entails and solving real problems, we encourage you to apply. We want to learn about you and what you can add to our team.

Who We Are

We’re harnessing the power of technology to revolutionize insurance. Using machine learning and mobile telematic platforms, we’ve built one of the most innovative FinTech companies in the world. And we’re just getting started.

What Draws People To Root

Our success is in large part due to our unwavering standards in hiring. We recognize that our products are only as good as the people building and promoting them. We want individuals who find solutions by going through the cycle of ideation to implementation with curiosity, rigor, and an analytical lens. Ask anyone who works here and you’ll hear similar reasons for why they joined:

Autonomy—for assertive self-starters, the opportunities to contribute are limitless.

Impact—by challenging the way it’s always been done, we solve problems that have a big impact on our business.

Collaboration—we encourage rich discussion and civil debate at every turn.

People—we are inspired by the collection of crazy-smart people around us.

Job Summary


Accelerant is building a new platform that will serve as the backbone of how risk is exchanged in the future. As a DevOps Engineer at Accelerant, you will be instrumental in helping us design, build, and run a highly reliable and scalable platform. This position is open to remote candidates across the U.S. and Canada.


If you join our team, these are some of the things you’ll be doing:


• Implement and drive adoption of site reliability engineering best practices for observability, scalability, availability, compliance and resilience.
• Focus on continuous improvement and technical standards – drive improvements in productivity, monitoring, tooling and set industry best practices.
• Act as the go-to-person for any production issue. Troubleshoot and monitor until successful mitigation, communicate effectively, create postmortems, document and implement learnings.
• Build, deploy and manage CI/CD workflows which leverage GitOps practices.
• Build, manage, and deploy architectures using Terraform (AWS) and Helm (EKS).
• Design and build the tools, frameworks, systems, and processes that engineers use to build, integrate, deploy, scale, and manage their software.
• Automate tasks across the full CI/CD lifecycle to create an efficient developer experience and reduce manual toil.
• Participate in on-call rotations. When on-call, you are expected to drive the troubleshooting and mitigation activities.


What you bring to the table:


• Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
• Experience building and scaling web applications.
• Experience with running a production environment in AWS, other cloud providers are nice to have.
• Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with experience developing and instilling a culture of operational maturity.
• Strong coding ability.
• Passionate problem-solving mindset.
• The ability and desire to mentor and coach engineers.
• Reputation for getting things done.
• Strong sense of ownership.
• Desire to learn and grow.


Desired qualifications:


• Experience with AWS (other cloud providers are nice to have)
• Experience with orchestration and serverless technologies like Kubernetes and Lambda.
• Experience with event-driven architectures on Apache Kafka.
• Experience with IaC tools like Terraform
• Experience building microservice CI/CD pipelines
• Experience with deployment tools such as Helm, GitHub Actions and ArgoCD.
• Experience with observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemtry, and Splunk.
• Experience with SQL-Like databases and data caching strategies such as Postgres, Snowflake, and Redis and data transformation technologies such as DBT.
• Experience with solving and driving implementations for compliance controls.
• Bonus: Experience with orchestrating ML models and running models in production environments.


Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:


• Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That’s why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.
• Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.


About Accelerant:


Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged – so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai

Job Summary


Accelerant is building a new platform that will serve as the backbone of how risk is exchanged in the future. As a DevOps Engineer at Accelerant, you will be instrumental in helping us design, build, and run a highly reliable and scalable platform. This position is open to remote candidates across the U.S. and Canada.


If you join our team, these are some of the things you’ll be doing:


• Implement and drive adoption of site reliability engineering best practices for observability, scalability, availability, compliance and resilience.
• Focus on continuous improvement and technical standards – drive improvements in productivity, monitoring, tooling and set industry best practices.

The base salary range for a Director-Competitive Intelligence & Analysis role is $104,700.00 to $193,700.00.  Actual salaries will vary by geographic location and are based on factors such as candidate’s qualifications, experience, skills, competencies, and company equity. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan based on company performance and individual performance. 
Director, Competitive Intelligence & Analysis Overview 
Ensures leaders remain consistently appraised of current environmental, industry, and competitive actions and trends which have the potential to impact the organization’s ability to sustain its competitiveness, and to pursue its strategic growth objectives. The Director will direct all company market research and industry benchmarking efforts, liaise with internal and external industry specialists, and provide insightful analysis of relevant issues to leaders. The position requires strong working knowledge of healthcare and employee benefits programs and products, excellent communication, and relationship management skills.
Essential Duties
• Directs all company market research and industry benchmarking efforts demonstrating exceptional business knowledge across all areas of the company
• Liaison with internal and external industry specialists to source, dissect, and distill relevant data and trends regarding competitor products and service capabilities, financial performance, and market positions versus the business and its partners. Provides insightful analysis of relevant issues to leaders, accompanied by recommendations to consider for possible strategic action
• Applies broad industry knowledge and deep business acumen to inform department leads of competitor capabilities, positions, and trends to advise on internal projects and strategic objectives, leveraging deep knowledge of our products and services to identify and quantify competitive risks or advantages
• Contracts and consults with experts at multiple industry benchmarking entities (e.g.: LIMRA, Eastbridge, Milliman, Smith Group, etc.), to direct our participation in over 65 benchmarking studies per year including, sourcing, synthesizing, and highlighting relevant market intelligence and competitive threats to inform business units about competitor financials and products, as well as overall industry trends
• Plans, develops, and executes custom research projects for company leaders across a broad range of topics such as vendor identification and selection, book of business financials, market size and share and penetration studies to facilitate strategic scorecard initiatives and projects, delivering insightful read-outs to senior leaders on the research findings and implications for our business
• Compiles, dissects, evaluates, and assesses industry studies and news items to identify and highlight relevant competitive intelligence issues of import, developing collected research into succinct executive summaries of salient details for business leaders with an emphasis on potential impacts to our business and with actionable recommendations for proactive solutions
• Advises and supports business across the organization on industry trends and competitive positions to inform strategic departmental projects
• Designs and conducts target-specific financial and market share research to inform leadership, supporting scorecard and other strategic priorities for business development objectives
• Oversees data collection, filtering, vetting and correction, sorting, and combining of appropriate data elements as differently specified by each independent study
• Collaborates with multiple business areas to manage deadline adherence and data verification prior to study submission
• Leads the study completion, tracking and evaluation process using broad industry expertise and deep familiarity with business practices to analyze and summarize relevant implications to the business from the final study reports
• Develops, implements, and maintains strategic tools to capture and share relevant competitive information and artifacts for the organization including “KLUE,” Competitive Intelligence Sharepoint site, INSight newsletter, COVID-19 updates, and a searchable library of news items for competitive trend analysis
• Represents the business at formal and informal industry Competitive Intelligence Workgroup conferences, forums, and discussion panels to gather unpublished market intelligence of potential strategic value to the company
• Lead the Legislative Action Sub-Committee of the Risk Management Committee, ensuring that we are tracking, mitigating, and capitalizing on legislative action and decisions impacting our products and markets
• Performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned 
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
• Strong working knowledge of healthcare and employee benefits programs and products
• Strong product knowledge
• Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communications skills
• Excellent relationship management skills
• Advanced level skills in MS Office Word, Excel, and Power Point
• Strong database and professional industry software programs skills
• Excellent teamwork, leadership, and coaching skills
• Ability to maintain currency knowledge of state insurance laws, rules, and regulations for multiple geographical locations
• Ability to project a professional image in dealing with senior management and external contacts   
• Ability to build relationships, credibility, and trust 
• Ability to prioritize multiple, conflicting priorities in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a professional approach to problem resolution 
Required Education and Experience
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Preferred Education and Experience

Who are we?

A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.

We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?

Learn more about our unique culture and history .

Job Opportunity

Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our globally focused Actuarial team. We are looking for an individual with excellent problem-solving skills, strong attention to detail, and the technical know-how to design, develop, and implement the necessary data storage, automation, and integration solutions to support actuarial and underwriting analysis. This position will be the perfect fit for an individual who is intellectually curious, self-motivated and a collaborative team member.

The Senior Data Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, maintaining, monitoring, and extending our actuarial data warehouse and analytics architecture to meet the team’s business analysis and reporting needs. The design and development focus includes but is not limited to Extraction Transformation Layer (ETL) frameworks, metadata management, data integration, master data definition and data quality, data auditing and profiling, and business intelligence reporting solutions. Additionally, this role will serve as both the architect and administrator of our actuarial data infrastructure, inclusive of all actuarial servers and database developments.

We are focused on enabling self-service data analysis for ease of reporting and analytics visualization while focusing on data accessibility, efficiency, governance, performance, and integrity. This team member will work with various business partners to map the technical vision for data in the actuarial data warehouse employing Azure, APIs, and SQL server. Additionally, they will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, modifying, and creating ETLs, utilizing SQL, CD/CI pipelines, DevOps, testing, debugging, integration, and implementation processes.

Duties & Responsibilities

• In-depth analysis of existing data load, analytics, and visualization code to ensure accuracy of data flow and resolution of anomalies
• Provisioning workflows, data pipelines, extracts, ETL and integrations using API’s, JSON, XLS and other sources to integrate with internal data stores and systems.
• Coordinate and implement the integration of various data sources to a central repository through sound testing, documentation, and execution of strategy  
• Perform data validations and reconciliations between various sources and reports with precision and attention to detail to ensure deliverables are accurate and effective  
• Debug and troubleshoot data quality problems using SQL tools.
• Provide technical support to actuaries and underwriters using the combination of tools needed to best complete each task (e.g. SQL, Excel, VBA)  
• Oversight and administration of actuarial data infrastructure including server performance and database monitoring
• The role will play a significant part in augmenting the data platform as we transition to an Azure based data platform leveraging all the latest tools available anchoring on Azure resources


Qualifications, Skills And Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Computer Science or related field  
• 5+ years of demonstrated professional data engineering experience with specialization in data modeling and business intelligence, insurance industry preferred
• Advanced proficiency of SQL required, SQL database management preferred
• Experience with Microsoft Azure with a concentration in ETL processing via Data Factory required
• Experience with PowerBI, Python, R programming preferred  
• Proficient in TSQL procedural coding, analysis, DML and DDL scripting
• Proficient in data transformation, ETL methodology, and data warehousing
• Demonstrated understanding of API development as it pertains to data integration efforts
• Familiarity with data modelling and experience working within complex data environments 
• Experience defining and implementing a global data catalog / data dictionary for end user reference
• Proven track record of collaboration across functions delivering quality results in an efficient manner 
• Solid oral and written communication skills  
• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work both independently and on teams  
• Strong desire to learn from and share knowledge with teammates.  
• Effective time management, with the ability to juggle multiple projects at the same time


BHSI Offers

• A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammates
• A dynamic, action oriented, and thoughtful environment centered on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates and our other stakeholders
• A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasizes individual excellence in a team framework


NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization
