description:
Network Health is seeking a human resource generalist to join the team. This individual serves as a business partner to management on human resources related issues in some or all of the following functional areas: workforce planning, employee relations, training, leadership development, employment, labor law, affirmative action, change management, compensation and recruitment. 


The generalist assesses and anticipates human resource-related needs and formulates options for business review and decision making. The generalist seeks to foster and develop integrated solutions across the organization and formulates partnerships across all HR functions to deliver value added service to management and employees which reflect the business objectives, strategy and overall culture of the organization.


*This position is eligible for working remote 1 day a week with 4 days working in our Menasha office. 


Job Responsibilities:
• Act as a business partner for leaders to improve their HR process skills, team effectiveness, strategic insight and business performance
• Partner with leaders on culture and performance management; provide guidance to leadership related to policies, coaching, counseling, career development, and performance management
• Policy development, review and revision for executive approval
• .Build long term employer brand via community based activities and social media management
• Identify workforce trends and use data analytics to make organizational and business unit recommendations
• Facilitate 9 Box conversations with leaders
• Represent and coordinate business needs and interests proactively across the organization to develop integrated solutions
• Analyze and make recommendations to resolve complex employee relations issues in collaboration with leadership
• Conduct effective, thorough and objective employee relation-based investigations
• Partner with leadership and/or recruitment on compensation recommendations
• Partner with leadership to create and review job descriptions Lead and manage the recruitment and onboarding process to include job posting, recruitment of candidates, initial screening of resumes and candidates, offer negotiations, etc
• Partner with leadership to align and execute the HR strategy based on the organizations business objectives and corporate strategy
• With or without vendor support may provide backup responsibility for HRIS manager as required
• Complete job and market evaluations aligning compensation with internal equity and external market
• Partner with leadership on talent planning, employee training and development, employee relations and individual coaching and mediating
• Maintain an in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance
• Other duties as assigned


Job Requirement
• Bachelor degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related field
• 4 years of broadly based consultative human resources responsibilities
• PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP or SHRM SCP required or attained within one year of hire.


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer who values and maintains an environment that attracts, recruits, engages and retains a diverse workforce.

At American Equity Investment Life Holding Company®we offer leading annuity products that help empower our clients to fulfill their needs and wants in retirement. Our success comes from hiring high-energy individuals who embody the beliefs that drive our unique culture. We currently fund over half a million retirements nationwide, and have been headquartered in West Des Moines, Iowa, for over twenty-five years with satellite offices in Charlotte, NC and New York, NY.

General Purpose Of The Job

The Application Developer II codes, tests and debugs programs, maintains and documents program code and procedures, and assists in the review and analysis of defined systems specifications, under moderate supervision.

• This position will be required to be onsite in West Des Moines, Iowa at least 2-3 days/week***


Essential Duties And Responsibilities

• Prepares, codes, debugs, and tests programs.
• Evaluates, creates and modifies existing programs while gaining an understanding of system interfaces.
• Documents code changes and assists users in the development of procedures.
• Analyzes system solutions.
• Performs on-call responsibilities.
• Performs other duties as assigned.


Supervisory Responsibilities

None required for this position.

Education And/Or Experience

Associate’s degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; and two (2) or more years of related experience in a coding, testing and debugging environment; or equivalent combination of education and/or experience A minimum of one (1) year in an application development role required.

Certificates, Licenses, Professional Designations

None required for this position.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

• Intermediate knowledge and skills in the use of specific computer software and programming languages (C#, .net, .net core, Angular, Angular JS, React, SQL, VB6, Visual Studio, HTML, CSS, Javascript, REST API, XML, JSON).
• Ability to develop in an event driven microservices ecosystem, leveraging various cloud native platforms (AWS Event platforms, AWS App Runner, API Gateway, AWS Lamda)
• Knowledge of maintaining and creating API documentation, leveraging the Open API Specification
• Knowledge of insurance industry practices, policies, and procedures. 
• Knowledge of the principles, practices, methods, and techniques associated with programming of computers and networking equipment.
• Strong attention to detail.
• Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner.
• Effective verbal and written communication, ability to effectively present information and interact in group situations.
• Initiative and innovation for improving work processes.
• Collaborate with others to exchange knowledge to teach and learn new skills and business domains.
• Adaptable to change, delays and unexpected events.
• Ability to read, analyze, and interpret documents, manuals, and instructions.
• Ability to perform accurate mathematical calculations and apply mathematical concepts to practical situations.
• Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

Are you an experienced recruiter who is motivated to get our firm the best talent in the industry? If so, we are looking for you! Our firm is expanding, and we are looking for a seasoned hiring expert to expand our team with top talent. You’ll have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our firm by identifying and attracting up-and-coming professionals that will take us to the next level. Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!

Compensation: $45,000 - $50,000

Why MSI? We thrive on solving challenges. As a leading MGA, MSI combines deep underwriting expertise with insurer risk capacity to create specialized insurance solutions that empower distribution partners to meet customers’ unique needs. We have a passion for crafting solutions for the important risks facing individuals and businesses. We offer an expanding suite of products – from fully-digital embedded renters coverage to high-value homeowners insurance to sophisticated commercial coverages, such as cyber liability and habitational property – delivered through agents, brokers, wholesalers and other brand partners.

Our partners and customers count on us to deliver exceptional service through a dedicated team that makes rapid resolutions a priority. We simplify the insurance experience through our advanced technology platform that supports every phase of the policy lifecycle. Bring on your challenges and let us show you how we build insurance better.

What you’ll do:

State Management plays an invaluable role in MSI’s success, with responsibilities including setting product strategy, managing P&L, and executing d2d operations. In support of these goals is a high-powered group of product managers and analysts. As the Enablement & Analytics Manager, you will manage our team of analysts, each of whom directly supports a P&L Leader. You’ll support the analysts in their development journeys and partner with P&L Leaders to ensure our capacity planning adequately covers their critical objectives.

Additionally, as MSI continues to grow and expand the product suite, scalability and efficiency are critical. With line-of-sight into the operations of each product, you’re uniquely positioned to surface and champion initiatives driving stepwise improvements in productivity. You’ll have a strong leadership voice in the product org and interface with each growth services team to effect change.

Responsibilities:

• Manage :10 product analysts spanning the portfolio of personal lines offerings
• Provide coaching & development support for each analyst
• Collaborate with P&L Leaders to ensure analyst objectives are calibrated to program goals and that LOB action plans contemplate team capacity planning
• Champion the analyst voice at the product leadership table
• Drive further consistency in standard team deliverables to facilitate ease & replicability
• Identify areas to improve the delivery model to promote better scale and efficiencies
• Partner with Process & Solutions team to build new processes & ensure consistent application in d2d delivery
• Champion operational initiatives, especially where cross-product uniformity is critical
• Create onboarding and training to support new colleague development, and help non-product colleagues to quickly orient to our product environment



Qualifications:

• 7+ years P&C insurance expertise, strong familiarity in personal lines property product preferred
• Servant leadership- experience managing others and desire to stay laser focused on enabling our analysts to grow
• Technical proficiency- knowledge of or desire to learn the technical ins and outs of our analysts’ tooling. Roll-up-the-sleeves mentality to really understand how things work
• Curiosity & energy- willing to challenge the status quo in search of more efficient processes
• Clear communication & interpersonal skills- ability to communicate effectively and succinctly, at all levels of an organization. Builds inclusive & engaging environments
• Structured, analytic thinking- comfortable breaking down bigger concepts into component parts; assess problems quantitatively and quickly translate findings into actions
• Adaptability- comfortable in a fast-past, remote-first environment and culture



Location:

• Remote, with access to local Baldwin Group offices as desired
• Travel occasionally for internal and external meetings



Click here for some insight into our culture!

Get your career started at eHealth

eHealthInsurance has many exciting career opportunities in a number of locations, across various functions. Come join us today!

eHealth connects people with quality, affordable health insurance through a proprietary marketplace offering Medicare Advantage, Medicare Supplement, Medicare Part D prescription drug, individual, family, small business, and ancillary plans from 200 health insurance carriers nationwide. As part of eHealth’s transformation, we are seeking a Digital Marketing Manager to support a variety of products and audiences. Our ideal candidate will possess knowledge of SEM techniques in the direct-to-consumer space, and have experience working in close collaboration with strategy, SEO and product teams. Reporting to the Director of Paid and Organic Search, this person will have experience in all facets of creating SEM campaigns including setting up campaigns and ad group, implementing ad copy, optimizing keywords, ensuring campaign tracking is working and monitoring campaign performance. The Digital Marketing Manager should bring an analytical skill set, audience-obsession for creating motivating and relevant messages, intellectual curiosity to challenge status quo with new marketing practices and a track record of delivering superior results.

The Digital Marketing Manager can be based anywhere in the US.

Responsibilities

• Manage complex, large-scale SEM campaigns including keyword research and expansion, ad copy creation, campaign performance tracking, testing and landing page optimization, in coordination with broader marketing team.
• In coordination with audience strategy teams, develop SEM strategies and consumer journeys to acquire audiences in our growth businesses for Medicare Advantage, Medicare Supplemental, Individual & Family, Small Business and Multicultural.
• Lead all stages of copy creation including partnering with the agency to write copy, maintain ad copy decks and manage filings with legal/compliance.
• Drive creative excellence on a/b creative testing, ad rotations, ad rank improvements and lead the internal ad copy approval process.
• Partner with marketing audience strategy and product teams on landing page improvements and testing for paid search across each stage of the journey.
• Conduct deep dive analysis on SEM opportunities to drive efficiencies and growth. 
• Set, track, monitor and optimize against annual and quarterly budget
• Analyze and assess the performance of online advertising campaigns and translate quantitative and qualitative data into recommendations and plans for revising the campaign strategy. 
• Define and monitor KPIs to react to changes quickly and decisively.
• Gather customer data from internal data teams to better segment and target personalized messaging to our audiences.


Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree. 
• 5+ years of experience managing large scale, multi-million-dollar SEM campaigns with a demonstrable track record of success.
• Hands on experience with Google Ads and Microsoft Ads.
• Experience with SQL and data feeds a plus. 
• Experience working collaboratively with cross functional partners at all levels and ability to clearly communicating technical messages to non-technical audiences.
• Strong analytical acumen.
• Strong organization and project management. 
• Experience and comfort working in an entrepreneurial environment, operating at a fast pace and fluid nature to adapt the changing needs of the consumer, the regulatory environment, and the business.
• Great communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Comfortable giving short presentations and reporting data analysis to different audiences.


Who You Are

• Consumer Obsessed. You have strong audience empathy, with a passion for delivering compelling value that drives behavior change.
• Critical, Strategic Thinker. You sort through the clutter to define the best path forward. You’re a creative problem solver, who uses excellent judgment.
• Achiever. You’re motivated to drive results. You are highly accountable, anticipating future needs and willing to adapt to changing priorities.
• Analytical. You use data to uncover new insights, opportunities and make decisions.
• Doer. You roll up your sleeves, dig in and chart the course to advance solutions.
• Clear Communicator. You are clear, concise, candid and authentic. You lead and influence by crafting stories with a vision supported by rationale and data insights.
• Relationship Builder. You listen, partner and influence across decision makers with a high degree of professionalism.
• Detail-oriented. You give undivided attention to your campaigns to catch any errors or mistakes before deployment.


The base pay range reflects the anticipated pay range for this position. The actual base pay offered will depend on various factors including individual skills, experience, performance, qualifications, the department budget, and the location where work is performed. Base pay is one component of eHealth’s total rewards package, which also includes an annual performance bonus, plus an array of benefits designed to support employees’ personal and professional wellness. For more information on our total rewards offerings, please visit our career site.

Base Pay Range -$105,000 - $131,300

eHealth is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity to all employees and applicants and to prohibit any discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. The foundation of these policies is our commitment to treat everyone fairly and equally and to have a bias-free work environment.

Job Details

Job Location

Corporate - Dallas, TX

Job Category

Business Development

Description

Data Product Owner

Achieve your Max potential at A-MAX! A - MAX Insurance has been growing exponentially for the last 20 years. Our fast-growing and innovative company is looking for a Data Product Owner to join our Corporate Family, located in Dallas, Texas. At A-MAX, we value the strong individual competencies that everyone brings to the table and are committed to your individual growth and advancement. We are looking for candidates that have drive, ambition, and want to build a rewarding career. We want A-MAX Insurance to be your employer of choice!!! We have a culture that values diversity, growth, respect, and integrity.

This is a hybrid role

Responsibilities :

• Work with business to solicit and document reporting / analytical requirement specifications and write design documents including process flows to support A-Max operational needs. 
• Strong understanding of data architecture, modeling, and the ability to work closely with data engineers to oversee the development of data solutions preferably in AWS cloud infrastructure. AWS certification is preferable. 
• Proficiency in managing complex projects, prioritizing tasks, and meeting deadlines. Experience with agile methodologies and tools like Jira is essential. 
• Work with business and data platform teams to envision art of possible that can improve business outcomes with measurable value. 
• Identify opportunities to improve existing data sets and analyze data to improve Data Quality 
• Help users understand our data eco-system and bring more data awareness within business and IT. 
• Ability to communicate requirements to the technical & non-technical audience. 
• Work with IT, data, vendor partners and business to ensure the accuracy of requirements. 
• Become an expert in business processes and application usage to identify potential solutions for business problems. 
• Familiarity with data governance principles and practices to ensure that the data strategies align with legal and business standards. 
• Hands-on experience with Data Science / AI solutions, SQL, data warehousing solutions, ETL processes, and PySpark 
• Understanding of the industry and how data-driven insights can drive business strategies and decisions. 
• These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed rather than give an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities. Performs other special projects as assigned by supervisor.


Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, computer science, statistics, science and engineering, or other similar quantitative disciplines. 
• Proven working experience of 3 to 5 years as a technical Data Product Owner. 
• Proven working experience of 3 to 5 years as a Data Architect with modern data storage, messaging, and processing tools (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, Kafka, Redis), and cloud services (e.g., Azure, AWS). 
• Proven experience enabling ML Ops and deploying Data Science solutions 
• AWS certification is preferable. 
• Advanced skills using data querying tools and dashboards including excel, Tableau, or other analysis tools.


For information on  A-MAX Auto Insurance & Affiliates  , including more information on employee benefits and our company culture, visit our website at https://www.amaxinsurance.com/careers

 A-MAX Auto Insurance & Affiliates  is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Why MSI? We thrive on solving challenges. As a leading MGA, MSI combines deep underwriting expertise with insurer risk capacity to create specialized insurance solutions that empower distribution partners to meet customers’ unique needs. We have a passion for crafting solutions for the important risks facing individuals and businesses. We offer an expanding suite of products – from fully-digital embedded renters coverage to high-value homeowners insurance to sophisticated commercial coverages, such as cyber liability and habitational property – delivered through agents, brokers, wholesalers and other brand partners.

Our partners and customers count on us to deliver exceptional service through a dedicated team that makes rapid resolutions a priority. We simplify the insurance experience through our advanced technology platform that supports every phase of the policy lifecycle. Bring on your challenges and let us show you how we build insurance better.

What You'll Do:

MSI continues to rapidly grow and expand the product suite. As such, we’re looking for a Director of Program Strategy and Management, to help guide our product team through the journey of building new programs and scaling current programs.

With a curious mindset and drive to build for the future, you will partner with our Segment and P&L Leaders to build product strategies, while working with delivery/IT to turn ideas into reality. In addition, as a consensus-builder, you will champion cross-program initiatives that require strong alignment and coordinated action planning across functions.

Though this is an individual contributor role, it is high visibility- you’ll have significant agency to influence MSI’s future, provide guidance to senior leadership, and build consensus across the entirety of the MGA.

Responsibilities:

• Partner with Segment Leaders to define & evaluate new go-to-market strategies; including external assessment of the marketplace & internal assessment of capabilities required to win
• In collaboration with P&L Leaders, identify & prioritize levers to increase product sophistication
• Turn ideas into actionable plans by ensuring all operational teams have a voice in development
• Establish P&L objectives for new initiatives, in consultation with P&L Managers
• Champion our new program governance process to create organizational clarity on priorities, surface and facilitate healthy discussions, and improve alignment where action is required
• Provide the “product voice” as our representative during reinsurance processes and other carrier relationship cadences
• As a member of the personal lines leadership team, provide mentorship and coaching to help build others up & grow



Qualifications:

• 10+ years P&C insurance expertise, with strong familiarity in personal lines property product management. Prefer experiences specifically in product design or state management
• Entrepreneurial mindset- act as a thought-partner across the org to design new product entry strategies and work with agile IT teams to develop & launch solutions
• Clear communication & interpersonal skills- ability to communicate effectively and succinctly, at all levels of an organization. Builds inclusive & engaging environments
• Structured, analytic thinking- comfortable breaking down bigger concepts into component parts; ability to assess problems quantitatively, while quickly translating findings into actions
• Adaptability- comfortable in a fast-past, remote-first environment and culture



Location:

• Remote, with access to local Baldwin Group offices as desired
• Travel occasionally for internal and external meetings



Click here for some insight into our culture!

 Job Title

IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II

 Exemption Status

Exempt

 Management Level

n/a

 Direct Reports

n/a

 Manager Title

IS Systems Engineering Manager

 Department

Infrastructure

 Requisition

24604

Pay & Benefits

Estimated hiring range $121,770 - $148,830 / year, 5% bonus target, full benefits.

 Posting Notes

This is a fully remote position, but you must reside in one of the listed 9 states.

Summary

  Job Summary 

The IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II will take on increased responsibility for managing, deploying, and maintaining secure cloud infrastructure solutions that align with the organization's business strategies. This mid-level role will be expected to collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for optimization and automation while maintaining a strong focus on security. Additionally, the IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II will implement cloud infrastructure with Terraform and Ansible code following corporate policies and best practices in DevOps. The responsibilities will include troubleshooting complex issues, leading projects, mentoring junior team members, and ensuring compliance with security policies.

Responsibilities

  Essential Responsibilities 

Security Design and Development

• Design, deploy and maintain Terraform code to create and support complete cloud infrastructure systems and advanced Azure services. 
• Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement complex infrastructure solutions that meet business needs. 
• Design and maintain DevOps pipelines to automate the deployment and testing of infrastructure as code. 
• Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on infrastructure projects. 
• Develop and maintain infrastructure-as-code modules and libraries to promote code reuse and standardization. 
• Lead and mentor junior team members in Terraform coding and DevOps pipeline development. 
• Provide advanced cloud technology knowledge to the company. Participate in and consult on complex projects. 
• Advise other IS teams on best practices for compute design.


Systems Administration and Operations

• Investigate and diagnose moderately advanced issues with cloud infrastructure resources and services, including application and network performance issues, Web Application Firewalls, and cloud network resources. 
• Collaborate with other teams, such as Developers, Analysts and ServiceDesk, to troubleshoot and resolve issues. 
• Configure and maintain virtual machines, databases, storage, and networking resources in the cloud. 
• Implement solutions to monitor the health and performance of cloud infrastructure resources, including availability and capacity, and proactively identify and resolve any issues. 
• Implement backup and disaster recovery solutions to ensure business continuity. 
• Maintain security controls and policies to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data in the cloud. 
• Monitor and report on compliance with security and regulatory requirements and proactively remediate issues. 
• Lead team activities for security incident response and remediation. 
• Participate in the selection and design of automation and scripting tools to improve efficiency and consistency of system administration tasks. 
• Produce and maintain documentation for cloud infrastructure resources, configurations, and procedures. 
• Peer review of documentation created by junior engineering staff.


Standards and Policy Administration

• Continuously improve infrastructure processes and tools to increase efficiency and minimize errors. 
• Conduct peer reviews and testing to ensure the quality and consistency of infrastructure code and deployments. 
• Ensure compliance with industry regulations, as well as internal security policies, standards, and guidelines by implementing advanced security controls and practices, such as Azure Firewall and Azure Key Vault. 
• Collaborate with others to determine requirements and standards for compute technology selection and deployment. 
• Regularly review existing systems to ensure they comply with established standards and support business operations. 
• Develop and maintain compute policies to ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies, standards, and guidelines.


Vendor Coordination and Relations

• Conduct product and vendor research, and present recommendations to senior engineer and/or management. 
• Establish and maintain effective working relationships with vendors and related equipment suppliers, including installation and repair of services. 
• Maintain service contracts and licensing; monitor adherence to SLAs with outside parties; escalate issues as needed.


Other

• Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.


  Organizational Responsibilities 

• Perform work in alignment with the organization’s mission, vision and values. 
• Support the organization’s commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion by fostering a culture of open mindedness, cultural awareness, compassion and respect for all individuals. 
• Strive to meet annual business goals in support of the organization’s strategic goals. 
• Adhere to the organization’s policies, procedures and other relevant compliance needs. 
• Perform other duties as needed.


Required

 Experience and/or Education

• Minimum 8 years’ experience delivering systems solutions and related services, with at least 2 years supporting mission critical cloud infrastructure


Experience Should Include Most Of The Following

• Infrastructure as code (IaC) tools and methodologies (preferred: Terraform) 
• Cloud orchestration platforms for automation and management of IS operations and resources in private and public cloud infrastructure. (preferred: RedHat Ansible) 
• Source code management tools and methodologies 
• Coding or scripting (preferred: PowerShell, Bash, Azure CLI). 
• DevOps pipelines including CI/CD cycles 
• DevOps tools (Preferred: Visual Studio, VSCode) 
• Cloud storage services and options 
• Delivering virtualized applications 
• Data protection and retention 
• Microsoft and Linux operating systems, core services, and management tools 
• Compute infrastructure development, including a balance of performance, management, and cost objectives 
• ITIL concepts and practices


Preferred

• Experience w/ both On-prem and Cloud. 
• Experience migrating On-prem infrastructure to the Cloud. 
• Experience as a System Administrator or System Engineer or similar. 
• Experience managing 100+ servers in the Cloud. 
• Additional experience in related technology support and/or operational positions


 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required

Knowledge

• Advanced knowledge in some or all of the following areas: 
• Strong understanding of common system architecture, provisioning, and administration 
• Microsoft server and desktop operating systems, including installation, tuning, and management 
• Microsoft core services, such as Active Directory and Exchange 
• Cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services 
• Backup and data protection solutions for cloud services 
• Troubleshooting of system performance issues and root cause 
• Monitoring systems and best practices 
• Principles of system design and best practices 
• Author and maintain system documentation 
• Awareness or knowledge of ITIL and ITSM governance concepts


Skills And Abilities

• Effective communication skills, including listening, verbal, written, and customer service 
• Ability to clearly articulate policies and instructions 
• Demonstrated progress in conveying appropriate level of detail effectively to all levels of the organization including non-technical staff 
• Demonstrated progress in simplify and present complex concepts in an easily understood way 
• Proactively and appropriately communicates status and needs 
• Ability to see, read, and perform repetitive finger and wrist movement for at least 6 hours/day 
• Ability to hear and speak clearly for at least 3-6 hours/day 
• Ability to recommend policies, document risks, and propose solutions to information technology management and senior leadership 
• Possess a high degree of initiative and motivation 
• Ability to effectively collaborate with coworkers, staff, and leaders across all departments 
• Demonstrated progress in leading teams of people without oversight 
• Demonstrated progress in seeing the big picture beyond a request and takes appropriate holistic action, employing “systems thinking” 
• Effective project management skills 
• Effective vendor management skills 
• Effective organizational skills 
• Ability to prioritize work based on business need and direction 
• Effective analytical and research skills. Demonstrated progress in being able to see patterns in data and draw appropriate conclusions 
• Demonstrated progress in proposing solutions and communicating business value 
• Ability to maintain a positive attitude 
• Understands and adheres to governance and process


 Working Conditions

Work Enviornment(s): ☒ Indoor/Office ☐ Community ☐ Facilities/Security ☐ Outdoor Exposure

Environment: Can include cramped spaces, loud noises, cold temperatures and lifting heavy objects.

Member/Patient Facing: ☒ No ☐ Telephonic ☐ In Person

Hazards: May include, but not limited, to physical and ergonomic hazards.

Equipment: General office equipment and ladders.

Travel: May include occasional required or optional travel outside of the workplace; the employee’s personal vehicle, local transit or other means of transportation may be used.

#MULTI

Candidates of color are strongly encouraged to apply. CareOregon is committed to building a linguistically and culturally diverse and inclusive work environment.

Veterans are strongly encouraged to apply.

 We are an equal opportunity employer. CareOregon considers all candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

Visa sponsorship is not available at this time.

Candidates hired for remote positions must reside in Oregon, Washington, Utah, Idaho, Arizona, Nevada, Texas, Montana, or Wisconsin.

 Job Title

IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II

 Exemption Status

Exempt

 Management Level

n/a

 Direct Reports

n/a

 Manager Title

IS Systems Engineering Manager

 Department

Infrastructure

 Requisition

24604

Pay & Benefits

Estimated hiring range $121,770 - $148,830 / year, 5% bonus target, full benefits.

 Posting Notes

This is a fully remote position, but you must reside in one of the listed 9 states.

Summary

  Job Summary 

The IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II will take on increased responsibility for managing, deploying, and maintaining secure cloud infrastructure solutions that align with the organization's business strategies. This mid-level role will be expected to collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for optimization and automation while maintaining a strong focus on security. Additionally, the IS Cloud Infrastructure Engineer II will implement cloud infrastructure with Terraform and Ansible code following corporate policies and best practices in DevOps. The responsibilities will include troubleshooting complex issues, leading projects, mentoring junior team members, and ensuring compliance with security policies.

Responsibilities

  Essential Responsibilities 

Security Design and Development

• Design, deploy and maintain Terraform code to create and support complete cloud infrastructure systems and advanced Azure services. 
• Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement complex infrastructure solutions that meet business needs. 
• Design and maintain DevOps pipelines to automate the deployment and testing of infrastructure as code. 
• Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on infrastructure projects. 
• Develop and maintain infrastructure-as-code modules and libraries to promote code reuse and standardization. 
• Lead and mentor junior team members in Terraform coding and DevOps pipeline development. 
• Provide advanced cloud technology knowledge to the company. Participate in and consult on complex projects. 
• Advise other IS teams on best practices for compute design.


Systems Administration and Operations

• Investigate and diagnose moderately advanced issues with cloud infrastructure resources and services, including application and network performance issues, Web Application Firewalls, and cloud network resources. 
• Collaborate with other teams, such as Developers, Analysts and ServiceDesk, to troubleshoot and resolve issues. 
• Configure and maintain virtual machines, databases, storage, and networking resources in the cloud. 
• Implement solutions to monitor the health and performance of cloud infrastructure resources, including availability and capacity, and proactively identify and resolve any issues. 
• Implement backup and disaster recovery solutions to ensure business continuity. 
• Maintain security controls and policies to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data in the cloud. 
• Monitor and report on compliance with security and regulatory requirements and proactively remediate issues. 
• Lead team activities for security incident response and remediation. 
• Participate in the selection and design of automation and scripting tools to improve efficiency and consistency of system administration tasks. 
• Produce and maintain documentation for cloud infrastructure resources, configurations, and procedures. 
• Peer review of documentation created by junior engineering staff.


Standards and Policy Administration

• Continuously improve infrastructure processes and tools to increase efficiency and minimize errors. 
• Conduct peer reviews and testing to ensure the quality and consistency of infrastructure code and deployments. 
• Ensure compliance with industry regulations, as well as internal security policies, standards, and guidelines by implementing advanced security controls and practices, such as Azure Firewall and Azure Key Vault. 
• Collaborate with others to determine requirements and standards for compute technology selection and deployment. 
• Regularly review existing systems to ensure they comply with established standards and support business operations. 
• Develop and maintain compute policies to ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies, standards, and guidelines.


Vendor Coordination and Relations

• Conduct product and vendor research, and present recommendations to senior engineer and/or management. 
• Establish and maintain effective working relationships with vendors and related equipment suppliers, including installation and repair of services. 
• Maintain service contracts and licensing; monitor adherence to SLAs with outside parties; escalate issues as needed.


Other

• Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.


  Organizational Responsibilities 

• Perform work in alignment with the organization’s mission, vision and values. 
• Support the organization’s commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion by fostering a culture of open mindedness, cultural awareness, compassion and respect for all individuals. 
• Strive to meet annual business goals in support of the organization’s strategic goals. 
• Adhere to the organization’s policies, procedures and other relevant compliance needs. 
• Perform other duties as needed.


Required

 Experience and/or Education

• Minimum 8 years’ experience delivering systems solutions and related services, with at least 2 years supporting mission critical cloud infrastructure


Experience Should Include Most Of The Following

• Infrastructure as code (IaC) tools and methodologies (preferred: Terraform) 
• Cloud orchestration platforms for automation and management of IS operations and resources in private and public cloud infrastructure. (preferred: RedHat Ansible) 
• Source code management tools and methodologies 
• Coding or scripting (preferred: PowerShell, Bash, Azure CLI). 
• DevOps pipelines including CI/CD cycles 
• DevOps tools (Preferred: Visual Studio, VSCode) 
• Cloud storage services and options 
• Delivering virtualized applications 
• Data protection and retention 
• Microsoft and Linux operating systems, core services, and management tools 
• Compute infrastructure development, including a balance of performance, management, and cost objectives 
• ITIL concepts and practices


Preferred

• Experience w/ both On-prem and Cloud. 
• Experience migrating On-prem infrastructure to the Cloud. 
• Experience as a System Administrator or System Engineer or similar. 
• Experience managing 100+ servers in the Cloud. 
• Additional experience in related technology support and/or operational positions


 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required

Knowledge

• Advanced knowledge in some or all of the following areas: 
• Strong understanding of common system architecture, provisioning, and administration 
• Microsoft server and desktop operating systems, including installation, tuning, and management 
• Microsoft core services, such as Active Directory and Exchange 
• Cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services 
• Backup and data protection solutions for cloud services 
• Troubleshooting of system performance issues and root cause 
• Monitoring systems and best practices 
• Principles of system design and best practices 
• Author and maintain system documentation 
• Awareness or knowledge of ITIL and ITSM governance concepts


Skills And Abilities

• Effective communication skills, including listening, verbal, written, and customer service 
• Ability to clearly articulate policies and instructions 
• Demonstrated progress in conveying appropriate level of detail effectively to all levels of the organization including non-technical staff 
• Demonstrated progress in simplify and present complex concepts in an easily understood way 
• Proactively and appropriately communicates status and needs 
• Ability to see, read, and perform repetitive finger and wrist movement for at least 6 hours/day 
• Ability to hear and speak clearly for at least 3-6 hours/day 
• Ability to recommend policies, document risks, and propose solutions to information technology management and senior leadership 
• Possess a high degree of initiative and motivation 
• Ability to effectively collaborate with coworkers, staff, and leaders across all departments 
• Demonstrated progress in leading teams of people without oversight 
• Demonstrated progress in seeing the big picture beyond a request and takes appropriate holistic action, employing “systems thinking” 
• Effective project management skills 
• Effective vendor management skills 
• Effective organizational skills 
• Ability to prioritize work based on business need and direction 
• Effective analytical and research skills. Demonstrated progress in being able to see patterns in data and draw appropriate conclusions 
• Demonstrated progress in proposing solutions and communicating business value 
• Ability to maintain a positive attitude 
• Understands and adheres to governance and process


 Working Conditions

Work Enviornment(s): ☒ Indoor/Office ☐ Community ☐ Facilities/Security ☐ Outdoor Exposure

Environment: Can include cramped spaces, loud noises, cold temperatures and lifting heavy objects.

Member/Patient Facing: ☒ No ☐ Telephonic ☐ In Person

Hazards: May include, but not limited, to physical and ergonomic hazards.

Equipment: General office equipment and ladders.

Travel: May include occasional required or optional travel outside of the workplace; the employee’s personal vehicle, local transit or other means of transportation may be used.

Role Description:

In the role of Client Engagement Technical Analyst, you will be part of a dynamic team that lives by Safety National’s five core values: Relationships, Integrity, Teamwork, Balance, and Stability. Our Core Values serve as the fundamental foundation of our corporate culture and drive our interactions, both internally and externally. You will work closely with our entire Client Engagement team along with our leaders across the company. Your contributions of executing Client Engagement technical initiatives will be felt throughout Safety National.

Your day-to-day responsibilities as a Client Engagement Technical Analyst will include being responsible for support and executing Client Engagement technical initiatives. This role will support all efforts to develop the enterprise Client Engagement processes, using technical tools, systems and data. You will assist in technical analytical tasks necessary to support the overall system strategy for Client Engagement. Additionally, you will coordinate overall CRM user testing, maintenance and enhancements as well as act as the technical liaison for support departmental users and IT partners. Lastly, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, documenting, communicating and training end users of all support departmental systems and technical projects while continually aiding in the assessment and improvement of system support.

While working with other teams and leaders, you will be asked to conduct sessions to refine the complexities of the systems and subsequent business needs in relation to overall functionality and process/workflow. In conjunction, you will monitor and track outstanding items while continually assess areas for potential efficiencies to ensure meeting user and department needs as volume increases and business needs change. Finally, assess trends and repeated problem areas to develop functionality that is more efficient and initiate discussions with the appropriate departments.

You may also be assigned various projects like, staying abreast of tactical initiatives, systems and business/legislative changes. You may be asked to gather technical requirements, create specifications, and work with business and I.T. architects to implement new features in applications.

The ideal candidate is someone who has a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience pertaining to this job. This position requires an individual who is detail-oriented, analytical, organized, and self-motivated with excellent technical and communication skills. Someone who has strong business technical skills to manage and assess supporting system requirements and user needs. Some of the essential skills required of you in this role are, strong analytical, technical and problem-solving skills, self-starter who can work with minimal direct supervision and the ability to balance priorities, complex situations and tight deadlines. Prior experience with Microsoft Office, Outlook applications, Knowledge of Salesforce, and Microsoft BI is preferred

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Founded in 1989, United Automobile Insurance Company is an innovative and established organization looking for a Senior Predictive Analyst to join our team. Family-owned, UAIC, is one of the largest privately held property and casualty insurance companies in the United States. The key to our growth and success is a commitment to providing quality service to our agents and customers, by providing disciplined underwriting, and strategic claims handling. Our ongoing efforts to invest substantial resources in personnel and technology are the foundation of our promise of assuring maximum efficiency and specialized operations in the industry. We are proud that our independent agents and customers have recognized our dedication by making UAIC the market leader in every state where we conduct business.

SCOPE:

As a Senior Predictive Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving data-driven decision-making within the organization. Leveraging advanced analytical techniques, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining predictive models to support underwriting, pricing, claims management, and overall business strategy. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract insights from data and provide recommendations for optimizing business processes. This position offers a primarilyremotework arrangement, allowing the ideal candidate to work from their preferred location.

DUTIES:

• Develop and maintain advanced predictive models using statistical and machine learning techniques to support underwriting, pricing, and claims management decisions
• Perform in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in insurance data
• Validate and document the accuracy, reliability, and robustness of predictive models to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations
• Maintain comprehensive documentation of modeling methodologies, assumptions, and outcomes
• Work closely with data engineers to ensure data quality, completeness, and consistency for use in predictive modeling
• Utilize data cleansing techniques to address missing or erroneous data
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including actuaries, underwriters, claims professionals, and IT, to gather requirements and translate business needs into actionable analytics solutions
• Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, providing clear and concise recommendations
• Implement processes for monitoring model performance and provide recommendations for model recalibration or enhancement as needed
• Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging trends in predictive modeling
• Ensure compliance with industry regulations, including state insurance department guidelines, and assist in the preparation of necessary documentation for regulatory filings
• Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to increase efficiency and accuracy in predictive modeling
• Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts in the team, fostering their professional growth and development


EDUCATION:

• Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Data Science, or related field
• Master’s degree preferred


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

• Minimum 4-6 years of progressively responsible experience in predictive modeling, data analysis, or a related field in the insurance industry, demonstrating a history of leadership and complex problem-solving
• Exceptional proficiency in advanced statistical software (e.g., R, Python, SAS) and data manipulation tools (e.g., SQL)
• Extensive experience with complex predictive modeling techniques (e.g., regression analysis, machine learning algorithms) and a track record of applying innovative methodologies
• In-depth knowledge of property and casualty insurance principles, products, and industry trends
• Outstanding analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills
• Exceptional communication skills to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders


BENEFITS:

• 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with employer match
• Comprehensive Medical, Prescription Drug, Vision, and Dental Insurance
• Paid Time Off, Holidays, and Leave programs
• Flexible spending accounts
• Basic Life Insurance and Voluntary Life/ADD
• Voluntary Short Term and Long-Term Disability

The Solutions Architect is a key technical leader responsible for designing, guiding, and implementing enterprise-level software architecture strategies that support the company’s long-term vision. This role is responsible for setting the technical direction for complex projects, evaluating new technologies, and defining best practices for software development, security, and integration. This person will partner with senior leadership to create and maintain a comprehensive architecture roadmap, ensuring that all software solutions are scalable, secure, and aligned with business priorities. A key component of the role involves understanding the organization’s complex application ecosystem, identifying interdependencies, and architecting solutions that optimize the entire software landscape.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Develops and maintains a comprehensive software architecture roadmap that aligns with business strategy and technology goals.
• Defines and documents high-level solution designs, ensuring compatibility and integration with existing systems and platforms.
• Partners with IT and business leaders to establish technology strategies, making recommendations on the adoption of new frameworks, tools, and methodologies.
• Provides technical leadership and guidance throughout the software development lifecycle, ensuring adherence to architectural standards and principles.
• Evaluates and implements new technologies to support business needs, focusing on scalability, security, and maintainability.
• Establishes and enforces technical standards, design patterns, and best practices for software development, security, and infrastructure.
• Leads architecture reviews and provides technical oversight to ensure projects are delivered on time and in compliance with the defined architecture.
• Analyzes the organization’s software ecosystem to identify opportunities for optimization and to streamline interdependencies between applications.
• Serves as a point of escalation for complex technical issues, providing expert-level guidance to software engineers and developers.
• Works closely with DevOps to design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines and automated testing strategies.
• Collaborates with external partners and vendors to integrate third-party solutions, ensuring interoperability and alignment with internal systems.
• Supports Information Technology team and/or other departments on an as needed basis.
• Willingly takes on additional responsibilities as requested in order to accomplish department and Company objectives.
• Actively participates and contributes to the goals and objectives of the Company by working collaboratively and fostering a positive and inclusive work environment. 


Skills and Abilities:
• Expert knowledge of data handling methods, development techniques, and at least three development programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, Python, JavaScript, etc.) and frameworks (e.g., Spring, .NET, Node.js).
• Solid understanding of the full software development Lifecycle (SDLC).
• Expert familiarity with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and experience in writing and optimizing database queries.
• Advanced understanding of cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP) and experience in deploying applications to cloud environments.
• Expert proficiency in code versioning tools and understanding of branching strategies.
• Ability to proactively identify and solve problems and issues of all types; must identify situations that fall outside the parameters of normal or routine activity.
• Demonstrates expert competency in the following areas: Analytical thinking, conceptual thinking, customer service orientation, effective communication skills, industry awareness, initiative, integrity, and relationship management.
• Intuitive, problem-solver, and analytical.
• Relies on professional knowledge and discretion to achieve goals. Must be able to use good judgment regarding decisions concerning problem resolution and upgrading tasks regarding priority, user impact, risk mitigation, and management approval.
• Ability to work effectively with all departments and affiliates to ensure integration of strategic goals and principles.
• Expert oral, written, listening, and presentation skills, including the ability to clearly articulate complex information to others; must communicate well with other departments and external clients and customers. 


Training or Work Experience:

• Understanding of OO development concepts required.

Education:

Working Conditions:

About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper-connected world.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real - and happening daily.
About the role
We are looking for a Solution Architect to join our team and help us expand the Coalition security business through a deep understanding of the needs of clients and prospective clients. In this role you will leverage our technical capabilities to help our clients solve business problems and help them overcome daunting challenges. It is an opportunity to act as a trusted advisor and lead designer of creative solutions.
Responsibilities

• Dive headfirst into complicated challenges balancing organizational politics, security fundamentals, and business impact all with the end goal of making the client successful

• Set clear expectations around what we can and can’t do, then craft a strategy for the delivery teams to ensure the prospect’s success

• Go deep on the delivery side of the business. Scope and project manage PoCs, which includes working with the delivery organization to make sure we’re showing prospects what they need to see in order to make a buying decision

• Build relationships and work alongside specialists in their fields, including SOC analysts, field sales professionals, and clients of all shapes and sizes

• Deeply understand prospect challenges that lead them to Coalition and set clear expectations around which of these challenges we can help them.

• Ensure we’re selling with empathy and integrity with each prospect conversation

• Support sales by collaborating on sales strategy, providing service demos to prospects, and acting as a technical and overall Coalition SME

• Prepare delivery teams for inbound prospects by providing details associated with prospect expectations, opportunities to show value, things to look out for, and technical details regarding their specific environment


Skills and Qualifications

• Excellent oral and written communication

• Analytical and problem-solving skills

• High attention to detail regarding financial modeling skills

• Ability to work under indirect supervision

• Broad understanding of information security topics

• Effective interpersonal skills and collaborative management style to include teamwork and team building ability

• Comfortable with ambiguity and time spent outside of comfort zone acquiring new knowledge and skills

• Flexible in a fast-paced dynamic environment with shifting roles and responsibilities

• Technically creative and open-minded


Bonus Points

• Business case expertise relating to managed security services

• Technical marketing content generation

• Familiarity with a wide variety of cybersecurity software 

• Deep understanding of security operations centers and analyst roles 

• High comfort level with public speaking and thought leadership


Compensation
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The US base salary for this position ranges from $150,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $200,000/year in our highest geographic market. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors, which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process. Coalition, Inc. reserves the right to modify this range as needed.

Perks

• 100% medical, dental and vision coverage

• Flexible PTO policy

• Annual home office stipend and WeWork access

• Mental & physical health wellness programs (One Medical, Headspace, Wellhub, and more)!

• Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

 Why Coalition? 
We’re a remote-first, mission-driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk.

Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion.

Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy. We want you to understand what personal information we collect and how we use it. We also want you to understand your options regarding our collection, use, and disclosure of such information and your ability to access and correct such information. As the leading provider of active insurance, Coalition is required to adhere to certain local regulations, including U.S. federal and state laws that protect your information and our use and disclosure of it.

Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy.

Anti-Discrimination Notice
Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity to all individuals seeking employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, medical condition, genetic information, or any other protected category under federal, state, or local law. We also prohibit harassment or discrimination of applicants based on the above-protected categories. Accommodations
Coalition complies with US federal and state disability laws. Our policy is to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees unless the accommodation imposes an undue hardship. Contact us by emailing candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com if you require reasonable accommodation to complete this application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participating in the employee selection process.

We consider qualified applicants, regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Overview

Skyward Specialty is a property and casualty insurance holding company formed in 2007. Based in Houston, Texas, and with staff throughout the country, Skyward Specialty provides admitted and non-admitted solutions to retail and wholesale distributors, managing general agents and captive markets. We have built highly respected businesses in specialty lines including management liability, professional liability, medical stop loss, surety, E&S property and liability, and large commercial property, as well as multi-line solutions for the energy, trucking, and construction industries.

At Skyward Specialty, we approach this business differently. In fact, we’re different from most others in our industry in just about every way. We have the spirit of a start-up with the security of over $1.7 billion in Written Premium. We put immense brain power and energy into finding greater insights to uncover better opportunities for our clients, partners, and people. We think at a higher level, so they can succeed at a higher level.

We are committed to a Diverse Workforce

Skyward Specialty is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nativity, neurodiversity, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. For more information about us please visit www.skywardinsurance.com

Responsibilities

 Summary

The Technical Business Analyst is a highly skilled and innovative role. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. This role is responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technology to drive scalability and deliver innovative solutions. This role is to understand the technical steps but also ensure the solution was aligned with business goals and provided tangible benefits to the organization. This role involves approaching problems with a holistic perspective, focusing not just on resolving the immediate issue but also on identifying sustainable and innovative ways to achieve long-term success.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities

• Work closely with business stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements. Develop deep relationships across teams to identify opportunities where technology can be leveraged effectively. 
• Translate business requirements into technical specifications and user stories, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives. 
• The key integrity of this role is to comprehensive requirements gathering, cross-functional collaboration, and leveraging cutting-edge technologies. 
• Promote a proactive environment by researching and recommending process and technology solutions for continuous improvement opportunities. 
• Conduct feasibility studies and impact assessments to evaluate proposed technical solutions. When applicable, conduct solution research and manage vendor relationships. 
• Responsible for articulating value proposition in support of recommendations along with metrics to capture and measure business value derived. 
• Collaborate with software developers, architects, and other technical teams to design and implement solutions that meet business needs. 
• Facilitate meetings and workshops with stakeholders to elicit requirements, discuss technical solutions, and gather feedback. 
• Create and maintain detailed documentation, including requirements documents, process flows, and technical design documents. 
• Demonstrate experience with projects, working with internal and external stakeholders, and the execution of project deliverables to achieve successful project delivery. 
• Ensure that technical solutions align with industry best practices, standards, and regulatory requirements. 
• Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in the industry, making recommendations for innovation and improvement. 
• Ability to perform support/tasks/projects in various stages of completion while multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment. 
• Other duties as defined by the supervisor


Qualifications

 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

• Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills. 
• Excellent customer service skills and a positive attitude 
• Strong technical background with experience in business analysis. 
• Proven ability to assess business needs and leverage technology to deliver innovative solutions 
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to professionally interact with all levels in the company 
• Ability to translate highly technical specifications into clear non-technical requirements and functional design documents 
• Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications, specifically SharePoint, Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. 
• Exposure to Azure DevOps, Power Automate and Power Apps a plus.


Qualifications, Education And Experience Preferred

• 4-year college degree or equivalent experience in a technology role 
• 3+ years of work experience as a Business Analyst in P&C Insurance preferred 
• High level understanding of emerging technologies, LLM's, AI, etc. is strongly preferred 
• Experience in data analysis and modeling 
• Experience working in collaborative environments with multiple stakeholders 
• Familiarity with software development methodologies and lifecycle 
• Experience with software configurations


Compensation & Benefits

The applicable base salary for this opportunity is $100,00.00 - $125,000.00. The base pay offered will be determined by factors such as experience, skills, training, location, certifications, education, and any applicable minimum wage requirements. In addition to the base salary, this opportunity may be eligible for performance-based incentives.

We are excited to offer a competitive total rewards package which includes health and welfare benefits, tuition and professional certification assistance, 401k savings, elective participation in the Employee Stock Purchase Program, paid time off, paid holidays, and child bonding leave, as well as other employee assistance programs.

Kin is on a mission to change home insurance from what it is to what it should be. Whether we’re leveraging data to create customizable coverage or providing claims service that goes above and beyond expectations, our members are at the heart of everything we do. In the face of ever-growing climate risk, they deserve an insurance company that cares about them. We aim to stick with our members through thick and thin.

We Use Efficient Technology That Lets Homeowners Buy Directly From Us To Keep Costs Down. This Is The Essence Of Kin. Our Approach Has Fostered Amazing Growth, Attracted Marquee Investors, And Earned Us Accolades, Including Being Named To

• Built In Chicago's Best Places to Work, Midsize Companies (2021-2024).
• Forbes' America's Best Startup Employers (2021- 2023).
• Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies.
• Forbes’ Fintech 50.


Simply put, our people are what make us great – we need forward-thinking, inspired game-changers like you to join us in our mission.

So, what’s the role?

We are looking for an Insurance Operations System Analyst to join Kin’s Insurance Operations team. In this role, you will be the primary system administrator for our Claims Management System. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with other cross-functional teams that support our Claims Organization, making our operations more efficient. This includes mapping out procedures to identify areas of improvement, building reports for leadership, and responding to ad hoc research requests. You’ll advocate for end-users by effectively communicating system needs and gaps with vendors to drive prioritized feature enhancements.

Here, you will get to be part of a dynamic, data-driven team while bringing your problem-solving skills to the table. Additionally, you will have the chance to collaborate with internal stakeholders to help improve our processes moving forward and be a crucial part of the team. To be successful in this role, it is crucial that you are a fast learner willing to work hard to understand a variety of systems and departments.

A Day In The Life Could Include

• Assist the Insurance Operations Leads with strategic initiatives
• Administer the Claims Management System-build workflows and create business rules to align with claims best practices and regulatory requirements
• System monitoring and troubleshooting by identifying, diagnosing, and resolving technical issues
• Manage and escalate system issues with internal and external partners
• Map out a current process to see what needs to change when we enter a new market
• Dig into data to investigate a worrying or exciting trend in adjuster performance
• Build and maintain reports used by management
• Write, interpret, and translate business requirements into actionable system specifications, ensuring alignment between technical solutions and business objectives
• Complete discovery and provide analysis on new tooling 
• Regularly assess and adjust system configurations to align with and support the evolving needs of the business
• Write recommendations on process improvements and change management and present to senior leadership
• Lead and perform testing of system configurations, updates, and enhancements, ensuring seamless functionality and identifying any issues before implementation


I’ve got the skills… but do I have the necessary ones?

• In-depth knowledge of maintaining and administering core business systems (CRM, CMS, ERP)
• 1-3 years of experience in a related field such as operations, data analysis, or business administration. Experience in insurance or other highly regulated industries is a plus.
• Able to solve basic small business problems on their own, and solve large problems with guidance.
• Participates and initiates strategic planning and documentation with more senior team members.
• Demonstrated ability to understand business processes, analyze data, and identify areas for improvement.
• Proven track record of collaborating across multiple teams and departments to drive business outcomes.
• Ability to manage relationships with various stakeholders (e.g., claims, data, leadership) and balance conflicting priorities.
• Experience leading or participating in cross-functional projects, ensuring clear communication, role alignment, and timely execution.
• Advanced analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with high attention to detail and accuracy.
• Experience using data to identify trends, make recommendations, and influence strategic decisions.
• Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems, develop efficient processes, and create actionable insights from data.
• Proficiency with data tools such as Excel, SQL, or business intelligence software is highly desirable.
• Highly organized and motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Bonus Points

• SQL proficiency 
• Insurance experience


Oh, and don’t worry, we’ve got you covered.

• Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance
• Flexible PTO policy 
• Remote work
• Generous equity package
• 401K with 4% company match
• Parental leave
• Continuing education and professional development
• The excitement of joining a high-growth Insurtech company and seeing your work make an impact

About Kin

Kin is the only pure-play, direct-to-consumer digital insurer focused on the growing home insurance market. We make policies convenient and affordable through a technology platform that delivers a seamless user experience, customized options for coverage, and fast, high-quality claims service. Kin is a fully licensed carrier that offers coverage through its reciprocal exchanges which are owned by its policyholders. To learn more, visit www.kin.com.
