Overview:

At SageSure, we’re not just in the insurance business—we’re in the business of protecting what matters most to our customers. As a leader in providing innovative insurance solutions for America’s most challenging markets, we’re always pushing boundaries to offer exceptional service and products that stand the test of time. Now, we’re looking for a Salesforce Loyalty Technical Lead to help us elevate our customer engagement to new heights. As our Salesforce Loyalty Technical Lead, you’ll play a critical role in the integration and standup of SageSure’s Salesforce Loyalty Management (SFLM) platform. From day one, you’ll be instrumental in bringing this powerful system to life, ensuring it’s tailored to our unique needs and ready to deliver an exceptional customer experience. Post integration and deployment, you’ll manage and optimize SFLM and work closely with the Loyalty Marketing Manager to design, develop, and deploy loyalty solutions. If you’re passionate about Salesforce and its power to create meaningful connections, this role is for you.

What you’d be doing:

Salesforce Loyalty Platform Integration & Standup

• Work with the implementation developer team and help lead the integration and standup of the SFLM system, ensuring a smooth and successful implementation.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and configure the platform to meet SageSure’s customer loyalty objectives.
• Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the platform is integrated seamlessly with existing systems, including Salesforce Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud.



Platform Administration and Management

• Take ownership of the SFLM as the primary contact and operational expert. Maintain and support the system, ensuring it delivers an exceptional customer engagement.
• Manage the day-to-day operations and administration of the SFLM, including maintaining loyalty member data, management of users, groups, and permissions to ensure system functionality.
• Work with IT, Software, Data Management and Finance to ensure seamless integration with SageSure systems, monitoring data flow and troubleshooting any issues that arise.
• Tune system for optimal performance, managing system resources, and troubleshooting bottlenecks
• Monitor for and update system per latest software releases.
• Implement patches/fixes as necessary.
• Implement system backup and disaster recovery best practices.
• Document system processes, configurations, and troubleshooting steps clearly and effectively.



SFLM Development and Enhancement

• Work with loyalty marketing manager to design, configure, and implement system functionality to meet the needs of user groups and customers. Identify and implement new features, processes, integrations and workflows.
• Conduct regular audits of the loyalty program and system integrations to ensure they meet business goals and customer expectations.



Data Management, Reporting & Security

• Maintain the highest standards of data security and integrity while keeping our loyalty programs running smoothly through regular updates and optimizations. 
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date customer records within the platform, ensuring data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations, such as GDPR.
• Utilize Analytics for Loyalty app to monitor the effectiveness of loyalty initiatives and support data-driven decision-making.
• Generate regular reports on program performance, including customer engagement metrics and campaign ROI.
• Knowledge of SSL/TLS, encryption standards, and security protocols.



Broader Salesforce Core Support

• Lend your expertise to Salesforce Sales Cloud and Marketing Cloud, supporting our sales and marketing teams with the tools they need to succeed.
• Build and refine workflows, reports, and dashboards that inform strategy and enhance performance across the board.
• Be the go-to resource for Salesforce technical support, ensuring our teams are empowered to use the platform effectively. 
• Lead training sessions that bring new users up to speed and help existing users get the most out of Salesforce.



We’re Looking For Someone Who Has

• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. 
• Minimum of 3+ years of experience as a systems administrator or related position.
• Experience with the integration and implementation of Salesforce systems, particularly Loyalty Management.
• Proven experience administering and managing Salesforce platforms.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and translate it into actionable insights and solutions using system capabilities.
• Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit, with the ability to work effectively across teams. 
• Detail-oriented with strong organizational and project management abilities.
• Salesforce Administrator certification is required



Skills

• Automation Tools: Skilled in using marketing automation tools to create workflows, triggers, and customer journeys.
• Scripting and Customization: skilled knowledge of scripting languages like JavaScript, SQL, or Apex to customize workflows and reports.
• Basic skills in HTML/CSS for customizing email templates and landing pages.
• Systems configuration
• Data Management
• Security Protocols: Knowledge of SSL/TLS, encryption standards, and security protocols.
• GDPR and CANSPAM Compliance Standards
• Root Cause Analysis: Skills in identifying and resolving system issues efficiently.
• Log Analysis: Ability to analyze system logs and performance data to diagnose problems. Ability to build and lead a team and work cross-functionally to achieve goals and drive collaborative efforts.
• Technical Writing
• A/B testing



Personal Attributes

• A proactive approach to problem-solving: an eye for detail and a passion for excellence.
• Analytical Thinking: Capable of breaking down complex issues into manageable parts and finding effective solutions.
• Resourcefulness: Ability to troubleshoot problems using available resources and find creative solutions.
• Attention to Detail:
• Precision: Careful and methodical approach to tasks, ensuring configurations, settings, and data are accurate.
• Thoroughness: Double-checking work to prevent errors and ensure all aspects of a task are covered.
• Dependability: A track record of being reliable and consistently delivering on tasks, even under pressure.
• Accountability: Willingness to take ownership of tasks and outcomes, accepting responsibility for successes and failures.
• Clear Communication: Ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms to non-technical colleagues or clients.
• Calm Under Pressure: Maintaining composure in stressful situations, such as system outages or emergencies.
• Persistence: Willingness to continue working on a problem until it is fully resolved.
• Collaborative: works well with others



Highly preferred candidates also have:

• Certifications in Salesforce Loyalty Management, Sales Cloud, or Marketing Cloud are a plus. 
• Salesforce Platform Developer I certification
• Experience working with customer loyalty and rewards systems
• Experience in the insurance industry



About the Marketing Team at SageSure:

A dynamic team of creative, strategic, and specialized professionals collaborate to handle every aspect of the marketing function at SageSure, from campaign strategy and market analysis to brand marketing and communications. Marketing at SageSure drives the business forward, helping us meet our ambitious business objectives and produce measurable results. In other words: your work directly contributes to the success of the organization. This is your opportunity to enhance your skills, leverage your subject matter expertise, collaborate cross-functionally, learn from service-oriented leaders across the business, and make your mark. Join us, and let’s grow together.

About SageSure:

As a Best Places to Work in Insurance Recipient for four years in a row (2020-2023), SageSure, one of the largest residential property insurance managing general underwriter (MGU) in the United States, is pioneering ways people protect their American Dream.

A leader in catastrophe-exposed property insurance, SageSure was founded in 2009 to deliver reliable products, exceptional customer experiences, and strong underwriting results in challenging insurance markets. SageSure currently operates in 14 states and provides home, flood, and commercial coverage on behalf of its highly rated carrier partners.

We have more than 600 employees working remotely or hybrid in one of our eight offices—Jersey City, NJ; Mountain View, CA; Chicago, IL; Tallahassee, FL; Cincinnati, OH; Houston, TX; Mt. Laurel, NJ; and Cheshire, CT—who are tackling the industry’s toughest challenges.

We provide generous health benefits and perks, including tuition reimbursement, wellness allowance, paid volunteer time off, a matching 401K plan, and more.

SageSure is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building a workforce that reflects the spectrum of perspectives, experiences, and abilities of the world we live in. We recognize that our differences make us strong, and we actively seek out diverse candidates through partnerships with organizations, institutions and communities that represent various backgrounds. We champion belonging and inclusion for all identities, including, but not limited to, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, ability status, gender, and country of origin, striving to create a culture where all individuals feel valued, respected, and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work.

Our nimble, highly responsive culture nurtures critical thinkers who run toward problems and engineer solutions. We relentlessly pursue better outcomes by investing in the technology, talent, and tools that position us to succeed in demanding markets. Come join our team! Visit sagesure.com/careers to find a position for you.

We are a team of employees who are passionate to deliver best in-class customer service and innovation in the industry. It’s because we put Integrity, Relationships and Excellence in all aspects of our work.

Our employees have the opportunity to fully utilize their talents and bring their best self. We believe that who you are is just as important as what you do!

As an Insurance Product Manager – Commercial Lines, you will build and communicate your long-term strategy for your product area within Central’s Commercial Lines product suite s . You will work closely with cross-functional teams and will focus on evaluating the market and competitive landscape, defining the value and viability of opportunities and making prioritized decisions regarding your product area. Join the Insurance Product team in this exciting role to help drive innovation of our CL product!

How You’ll Make An Impact

• Conduct market discovery through research relating to the competitive landscape, industry trends, and emerging technology in assigned states affecting your product area. 
• Work closely with business intelligence, pricing, data science and design research to understand the internal book profile of your product area and define your target customer. 
• Partner with underwriting operations, legal, and the security and compliance team to understand the legal and regulatory requirements of your product in assigned states. 
• Own the P&L performance of your product and drive its profitability. Establish, communicate and execute product strategies aligned with corporate objectives that drive profitable growth in your assigned states. 
• Identify, research, evaluate, and prioritize product development and enhancement opportunities. 
• Create and manage a product roadmap and coordinate with cross-functional team including pricing, data science, underwriting operations, ITDS, compliance, underwriting, marketing, claims, customer service, and digital product to understand delivery plans and be able to answer questions on roadmap timing. 
• Ensure underwriting operations, ITDS, and digital product have the necessary information to execute insurance product changes. Set stakeholder expectations on roadmap and explain prioritization decisions. Work with marketing, regional offices, and digital product to rollout insurance product changes. 
• Track progress towards business outcomes. Identify and communicate any objections, delays or potential blockers and adjust roadmap as necessary. 
• Participate as a key member of the durable product team. 
• Track financial and performance metrics to understand progress towards product and business outcomes. Actively monitor KPI metrics and share results with durable team members.



What You’ll Bring

• Master’s degree in business management and 4 years direct Insurance Product Management experience
• Or bachelor’s degree in business management and 6 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Or 8 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Strong research skills to conduct primary and secondary market research 
• Ability to gather and synthesize large quantities of information to find unmet needs and opportunities 
• Strategic thinking skills to translate research and market insights into an actionable product roadmap 
• Basic financial accounting skills to understand product P&L, populate predefined business case templates, and make recommendations based on the results 
• Ability to collaborate and co-lead groups of people in innovation workshops 
• Clear communication style to explain prioritization decisions and articulate product strategy and roadmaps 
• Public speaking and presentation skills 
• Ability to lead through subject matter expertise and influence rather than direct reporting relationships 
• Preferred:
• Experience working in an agile environment 
• Commercial Lines Package expertise 
• Commercial Lines Property expertise 
• Commercial Lines Liability expertise



Work Authorization

Central will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

The applicant should respond to questions on this application in a way that will not divulge such information.

We are a team of employees who are passionate to deliver best in-class customer service and innovation in the industry. It’s because we put Integrity, Relationships and Excellence in all aspects of our work.

Our employees have the opportunity to fully utilize their talents and bring their best self. We believe that who you are is just as important as what you do!

As an Insurance Product Manager – Commercial Lines, you will build and communicate your long-term strategy for your product area within Central’s Commercial Lines product suite s . You will work closely with cross-functional teams and will focus on evaluating the market and competitive landscape, defining the value and viability of opportunities and making prioritized decisions regarding your product area. Join the Insurance Product team in this exciting role to help drive innovation of our CL product!

How You’ll Make An Impact

• Conduct market discovery through research relating to the competitive landscape, industry trends, and emerging technology in assigned states affecting your product area. 
• Work closely with business intelligence, pricing, data science and design research to understand the internal book profile of your product area and define your target customer. 
• Partner with underwriting operations, legal, and the security and compliance team to understand the legal and regulatory requirements of your product in assigned states. 
• Own the P&L performance of your product and drive its profitability. Establish, communicate and execute product strategies aligned with corporate objectives that drive profitable growth in your assigned states. 
• Identify, research, evaluate, and prioritize product development and enhancement opportunities. 
• Create and manage a product roadmap and coordinate with cross-functional team including pricing, data science, underwriting operations, ITDS, compliance, underwriting, marketing, claims, customer service, and digital product to understand delivery plans and be able to answer questions on roadmap timing. 
• Ensure underwriting operations, ITDS, and digital product have the necessary information to execute insurance product changes. Set stakeholder expectations on roadmap and explain prioritization decisions. Work with marketing, regional offices, and digital product to rollout insurance product changes. 
• Track progress towards business outcomes. Identify and communicate any objections, delays or potential blockers and adjust roadmap as necessary. 
• Participate as a key member of the durable product team. 
• Track financial and performance metrics to understand progress towards product and business outcomes. Actively monitor KPI metrics and share results with durable team members.



What You’ll Bring

• Master’s degree in business management and 4 years direct Insurance Product Management experience
• Or bachelor’s degree in business management and 6 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Or 8 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Strong research skills to conduct primary and secondary market research 
• Ability to gather and synthesize large quantities of information to find unmet needs and opportunities 
• Strategic thinking skills to translate research and market insights into an actionable product roadmap 
• Basic financial accounting skills to understand product P&L, populate predefined business case templates, and make recommendations based on the results 
• Ability to collaborate and co-lead groups of people in innovation workshops 
• Clear communication style to explain prioritization decisions and articulate product strategy and roadmaps 
• Public speaking and presentation skills 
• Ability to lead through subject matter expertise and influence rather than direct reporting relationships 
• Preferred:
• Experience working in an agile environment 
• Commercial Lines Package expertise 
• Commercial Lines Property expertise 
• Commercial Lines Liability expertise

Your Purpose And Function In Our Company

The Data Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst II is responsible for leading medium to large Agile functional test projects, including the hands-on design, build, and execution of comprehensive functional and automation test strategies, test plans, test cases, and test data for Enterprise data solutions.

This role requires a self-driven individual who is proactive, demonstrates a clear initiative and desire to lead IT and Business team members through key project test efforts (Dev, QA, UAT, Prod) utilizing various techniques and technologies, and sharing this knowledge with others.

You will work closely with data engineers (ETL developers), database administrators, data scientists, and other stakeholders to develop and execute comprehensive testing strategies that guarantee the integrity, accuracy, availability, reliability, and performance of our data solutions.

Key Capabilities For Success

• 4 - 6 years’ experience leading and executing Data Quality Assurance testing which includes hands-on experience in manual and automated testing and test data generation for Data Lakes; Data Warehouse models (Star Schemas); ETL; tables; views; cubes; reports; dashboards and inbound/outbound feeds and integrations; applications, and inter-connected systems.
• Ability to self-lead, guide, and direct other team members and coworkers through testing and testing related activities with minimal supervision.
• Strong analytical skills and the demonstrated ability to translate a set of project requirements (for associated and disparate systems) into a cohesive test plan; test strategy; test suite; end to end test; user acceptance test; and/or other similar holistic quality solution for a suite of data lake; data warehouse and business intelligence developed systems; applications, and workflow changes.


KEY Responsibilities

• Data Validation and Testing:
• Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and scripts to validate data pipelines, BI reports, dashboards, ETL processes, schemas, tables, stored procedures, queries, jobs and ETL in support of all data lake, data warehouse feeds, functions, data layers and integrations for on-premises and cloud environments. 
• Perform through data quality checks, including data completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness.
• Identify, document, and track data defects, and work with data engineers (ETL developers) to resolve issues.
• Automation and Continuous Integration:
• Develop automated test scripts using tools like Python, SQL, or cloud-native testing frameworks.
• Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous testing and monitoring of data quality in real-time. 
• Maintain and enhance the automation framework, ensuring it is scalable and adaptable to changing data requirements. 
• Reporting and Analytics:
• Generate reports on data quality metrics, test coverage, and defect rates, providing insights to drive continuous improvement.
• Develop dashboards and visualizations to track data quality trends over time.

Qualifications

Education

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
• Relevant experience will be considered in-lieu of a college degree or advanced certification
• Certifications in cloud platforms preferred


Experience

• 5+ years’ experience as a Data QA Analyst, with a focus on cloud environments.
• Proven experience with cloud platforms (preferably Azure) and cloud-native services.
• Strong background in data testing, including ETL, data lakes, data warehousing, and data pipeline validation.
• Predictive analytics experience.


Technical Skills

• 5+ years’ proficiency in complex SQL, Python, or any other scripting languages used for data testing/data test automation.
• Direct experience with cloud-based data services such as Azure DevOps, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Data Factory, Cloud PowerBI, etc.
• Familiarity with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab, etc.) and integrating testing into deployment pipelines.
• Knowledge of data quality frameworks and tools.


Other Skills

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with keen attention to detail.
• Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
• Experience in the Property and Casualty Insurance or Finance industry is a plus.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

As the IT Infrastructure Director, you will lead a team responsible for the ongoing maintenance of our Desktop/Server/Networking environment as well developing strategies and new solutions to deliver a world-class IT infrastructure.

How You Will Make An Impact

 Data Center & Operations

• Responsible for the strategy and day-to-day operation of our on-premises & cloud technology infrastructure which includes enterprise storage & compute, networking, telephony, and enterprise software solutions including O365. 
• Responsible for our Disaster Recovery program, ensuring that we meet our RPO and RTO objectives; this includes at minimum annual testing of the solution. 
• Responsible for execution of our patch management program, working closely with IT Security & Compliance, to ensure risk is mitigated 
• Ensures all hardware and software are appropriately upgraded, supported, and in compliance with licensing 
• Responsible for release management, ultimately enabling our engineering teams to bring solutions to market securely, efficiently, and confidently. 
• Champions automation throughout infrastructure to achieve maximum efficiency and minimize manual intervention 
• Ensures all systems are appropriately monitored and that incidents are addressed in a timely manner; champions system metrics that reduce incident frequency and duration 
• Ensures that IT Infrastructure can scale on demand to meet the needs of product and engineering.



 Services

• Responsible for our tier 1 Help Desk and the service experience of our policyholders, agents, and internal stakeholders. 
• Responsible for the acquisition, deployment, and maintenance of all desktop, audio/visual, and print/copy equipment used throughout our offices.



 Management & Leadership

• Ownership of the IT Infrastructure budget; develops strategies to effectively manage expense and maximize our returns on investments. 
• Effectively develops and manages vendor relationships to achieve optimal outcomes 
• Design, deploy, and report out on metrics that effectively measure HW & SW deployment efficiency, services & equipment experience, systems reliability, and cost to serve to drive continuous improvement of the IT infrastructure team. 
• Champions modern IT infrastructure practices and coaches the team to drive continuous improvement 
• Develop staffing models and lead a team of professionals that execute on your strategy for IT infrastructure



What You Will Bring

• Master’s degree in Computer Science and 6 years of related experience including 2 years management experience
• Or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 8 years related experience including 2 years management experience 
• Or 10 years related experience including 2 years of management experience 
• Mastery of computer science, infrastructure, and release management concepts 
• Strong communication skills in explaining and championing IT infrastructure concepts 
• Demonstrated leadership and cross-functional agility

Position Purpose

Under general management, the Sr. Data Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and integrating data pipelines and assets within our enterprise data platform. Your work will ensure data accessibility, reliability, and security to support analytics and reporting across the organization. In this role, you will work with both on-premises and cloud technologies while adhering to best practices in data governance and quality. If you're passionate about data, adaptable to new challenges, and thrive in an agile, fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you!

Principal Duties & Responsibilities


• Create, maintain, and optimize data workflows from development to production, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
• Maintain data availability and ensure compliance with RLI’s security standards and best practices.
• Perform root-cause analysis and resolve issues related to technology, processes, or resources.
• Develop and enforce data integration and data quality practices to maintain consistency across data sources.
• Automate the integration, testing, and deployment of code to support continuous delivery of high-quality solutions.
• Work closely with data architects, product managers, data analysts, and developers in an agile team environment, delivering iterative improvements.



Education & Experience


• Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, or a related field
• 4+ years of relevant experience
• [OR] equivalent level of education and experience
• Experience in Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance is preferred
• Not considering visa sponsorship for this role



Knowledge, Skills, & Competencies


• Strong ability to write and optimize complex SQL queries to ensure efficient data processing, integration, and analytics.
• Experience designing, deploying, and managing scalable data infrastructure on Microsoft Azure, including services like Azure Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Blob Storage.
• Expertise in automating data workflows using Informatica Data Management Cloud (IDMC) or similar tools for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
• Hands-on experience building and maintaining data warehouses using Snowflake or similar platforms, ensuring optimized data storage and retrieval for analytics.
• In-depth understanding of data integration, quality practices, and ensuring consistency across data sources through well-defined workflows.
• Proficiency in Python or similar languages (e.g., Java, Scala) for developing and optimizing data processing tasks to support scalable data solutions is preferred.
• Experience in designing and implementing data models and schemas that ensure efficient storage, integrity, and accessibility for analytical needs is preferred.
• Familiarity with CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps), and version control systems (e.g., Git) to automate deployments and manage code changes is preferred.
• Basic knowledge of implementing data governance practices and securing data pipelines in production.
• Exposure to MongoDB, AWS, API data formats (e.g., XML, JSON), Kafka, and an understanding of AI/ML algorithms is preferred.
• Proactively seeks out new trends and learning opportunities.
• Effective communicator who works well with both technical and non-technical team members across distributed teams.
• Strong ability to troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve complex issues.
• Comfortable handling changing data sources, tools, and business requirements in a fast paced environment.

We make a commitment to employees to provide educational opportunities that help them enhance their skills and further their career advancement. Description

SUMMARY:

The Enterprise Application Systems Manager is responsible for the effective management and functionality of Operations-related systems and project management. The Enterprise Application Systems Manager is also responsible for the supervision of assigned support staff, ensuring effective use and function of applicable systems, as well as excellent customer service.

Essential Functions

• Advanced understanding of agency operations with emphasis on front office day-to-day key processes, quality standards in reporting and processes, and how that impacts the back office (accounting, data & IT, production, etc.) 
• Database and Server Management, including, but not limited to, coordination of server activities, restoring back-ups, replication monitoring, updates/installations/imports, job monitoring, and coordination of support for the following systems:
• Epic Server Management 
• Management of Epic Sandbox Environments 
• Epic BDE 
• SDK Tools: Journal Entry import, Client Import, Transactions Import tools, third-party integrations 
• CSR24/7 
• Responsible for Applied Epic System Administration including, but not limited to, the following areas: 
• Downloads – ensure accurate operations and guide on difficult issues 
• Accounting Support - Maintain user security for bank accounts, design check layouts, user issues with general ledger, and contacting Applied Support if needed 
• Applied Mobile – Maintain licensing and provide user support such as issues with logging on or unable to locate clients 
• Configurations – Develop and implement non-routine configurations 
• Internal Audit – Work with internal auditors, providing reports and responding to security/access and policy and client inquiries 
• Reporting – Designing, implementing, and scheduling ad hoc reporting 
• Support – Provide user support for difficult or escalated issues 
• Template management, creation, implementation 
• Provide data response for Operations-related programs including, but not limited to, Power BI, Agency KPI, Assurex, carrier loss data, benchmarking obligations, and projects 
• Provide system integration support as needed

CURRENT ROOT EMPLOYEES - Please apply using the career page in Workday. This career site is for external applicants only.

The Opportunity

At Root, we’re on a mission to improve the lives of our customers by offering better insurance solutions. We challenge ourselves to think differently in order to reimagine insurance to make it smarter, more equitable, and a better experience for all.

We strive to “unbreak” the archaic insurance industry by using data and technology in innovative new ways. We believe we must be steadfast in our commitment to research, experimentation, and disciplined data-driven decision making in order to build products our customers love. Analytics sits at the center of our vision.

Our Growth team is responsible for ensuring that we meet potential customers at their time of need and provide an exceptional experience. This group includes Direct-to-Consumer Marketing, Customer Experience, and our Partnerships distribution channel.

As a Director of Analytics, you’ll lead a team of analytics managers and analysts to conduct exploratory research, design experiments to unlock new learnings, study the impacts of new features and business strategies, forecast future business performance, and introduce new metrics and reporting to shape how we measure our business. You’ll work closely with leaders in Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Business Development to achieve operational excellence and to craft longer term business strategies for your functional domains.

Root is a “work where it works best” company. Meaning we will support you working in whatever location that works best for you across the US.

Salary Range:  $159,256 - $199,070 (Bonus and LTI eligible)

How You Will Make An Impact

• Directly manage a team of three Analytics Managers and one Lead Analyst spanning Marketing, Partnerships, and Customer Onboarding
• Facilitate near term project planning and lead longer term strategic planning (annual plans, quarterly OKR setting, weekly sprint planning)
• Identify process inefficiencies and/or organizational bottlenecks and leverage these opportunities to improve outcomes
• Work with direct reports and cross functional partners to identify, prioritize, and execute on research and experimentation opportunities
• Lead our business forecasting process; work closely with direct reports and leaders in Finance, Product, Marketing, and State Management
• Identify opportunities to improve analytical methodologies to increase business outcomes
• Build strong relationships with other leaders at the Director, VP, and C-Suite level to coordinate across leadership and proactively ensure alignment and awareness
• Coach and mentor individuals on the team to increase talent density and foster professional development and growth
• Responsible for all activities related to hiring, onboarding, and terminations


What You Will Need To Succeed

• 8+ years of work experience in analytics (prior marketing, customer experience, or insurance experience preferred)
• 4+ years directly managing analytics teams
• Proficiency with SQL and BI software (Tableau, Mode, Power BI, etc.)
• Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
• Superior problem-solving skills with ability to think strategically and innovatively
• Exceptional written and oral communication; able to effectively collaborate with and present materials to VP and C-Suite levels
• Detail oriented; able to effectively multitask across multiple domains; consistently maintains rigorous documentation
• Exceptional leadership skills; able to effectively manage a team and influence cross functional partners
• Roll-up-the sleeves work ethic and “do-what-it takes” attitude to efficiently execute and drive results in a fast-paced work environment


Don’t meet every single requirement?

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Root, Inc., we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway!

Join us

At Root, we judge people based on the merit of their work, not who they are. If you are passionate about what this role entails and solving real problems, we encourage you to apply. We want to learn about you and what you can add to our team.

Who We Are

We’re harnessing the power of technology to revolutionize insurance. Using machine learning and mobile telematic platforms, we’ve built one of the most innovative FinTech companies in the world. And we’re just getting started.

What Draws People To Root

Our success is in large part due to our unwavering standards in hiring. We recognize that our products are only as good as the people building and promoting them. We want individuals who find solutions by going through the cycle of ideation to implementation with curiosity, rigor, and an analytical lens. Ask anyone who works here and you’ll hear similar reasons for why they joined:

Autonomy—for assertive self-starters, the opportunities to contribute are limitless.

Impact—by challenging the way it’s always been done, we solve problems that have a big impact on our business.

Collaboration—we encourage rich discussion and civil debate at every turn.

People—we are inspired by the collection of crazy-smart people around us.

Join SmartFinancial: Empowering Insurance Agents with Cutting-Edge Technology

Welcome to SmartFinancial, where our mission is clear: to drive growth and success for insurance agencies through our industry-leading technology! Voted one of the Best Places to Work for four consecutive years, we are one of the fastest-growing tech companies.

We are a leading insurance marketplace, connecting millions of shoppers to our network of insurance partners.

We are looking for an experienced media buyer who thrives in a results-driven environment and lives and breathes digital marketing channels like Vertical, and Paid Search. If this sounds like you and you have demonstrated success scaling profitable lead generation campaigns meeting KPI's in the process, then you might be our next Media Buyer!

The compensation for this position is $60-$90k annually.

What You'll Do

• Develop, manage, and optimize successful/profitable marketing campaigns targeting CPA goals
• Uncover campaign scale and profit drivers
• Work with our analytics team to structure data to make optimizations against those drivers
• Manage communications between technical and creative teams
• Analyze reporting, as well as partner insights, to recommend strategic improvements
• Research and test new marketing channels for the company



What We're Looking For

• Demonstrated success launching and managing at-scale and profitable lead generation campaigns
• Strong negotiation ability to achieve efficient results for campaigns
• Highly analytical with the ability to structure data and analytics to uncover critical insights
• Deep hands-on experience across various marketing channels
• Familiarity with 3rd party CPC, CPL, and CPM platforms and networks is a plus
• Excellent communication and organizational skills
• Currently managing at-scale financial services lead generation campaigns



What We Offer

• Comprehensive Health Coverage: Health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents
• Retirement Plans: 401(k) retirement plan with company matching contributions
• Paid Time Off: Generous PTO, holidays, and extensive paid product training
• Professional Development: Opportunities for career growth and advancement within a supportive environment that values employee development
• Flexible Work Options: Hybrid work arrangements, combining in-office and remote work opportunities



Why You'll Love It Here

We'd especially like to highlight our World Class Culture, which our employees say is the best thing about working at SmartFinancial. We have great SLACK channels for work and play, which keep you connected with your fellow employees throughout the day. Not to mention our top notch company events (like our Summer Beach Party with open bar, chili cook-off, annual holiday yacht party, fun office potlucks and more) that will keep you asking when the next event is.

We also have Penny, our company mascot. Like swag themed after a pink pig wearing glasses? Just. You. Wait.

Join SmartFinancial and become a key player in driving growth for insurance agencies. Apply now, and let's achieve success together!

SmartFinancial is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To learn more about our results-focused culture and employee-focused perks, read more on our careers page.

Who are we? 
A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.


We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?


Learn more about our unique culture and history.


Job Opportunity: 
Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Technology PI & Cyber Underwriter to join our Executive and Professional, UK team in London.


The primary focus of this role will be to lead our contributions to the growth and build out of the Technology PI and Cyber lines of business from the UK. Day to day responsibilities of this role include working with the Head of PI and Cyber and Chief Underwriting Officer on medium and long-term strategy, launching new products and offerings, underwriting new and renewal business, utilising underwriting acumen to select risks within the company’s risk appetite and expanding and developing new business opportunities with brokers and customers.


We are seeking an individual who is energised, passionate and who is always striving towards excellence. You should be comfortable working closely with actuaries, the claims team, and underwriters from across the broader team. In addition, necessary character, relationship building and negotiating skills to help lead and further build a profitable book of business are of the upmost importance. The successful candidate will be focused on a positive customer experience, while maintaining sound underwriting discipline. This position is a great fit for a Senior Technology and Cyber Underwriter looking to expand their responsibilities and underwriting knowledge with an experienced and well-regarded unit within a top global insurance company.


Duties & Responsibilities:
• Support the development and build-out of Technology PI and Cyber lines of business within London with the teams focus on profitable growth
• Establish, develop, and expand broker and customer relationships
• Engage with key stakeholders within the business to help the continual development of policy forms and benchmark rating models
• Underwrite Primary and Excess accounts while ensuring appropriate analysis and documentation without sacrificing discipline, diligence, and quality service
• Maintain a profitable renewal book
• Effectively communicate BHSI value proposition
• Be a positive reflection on the company by demonstrating integrity and leadership in the marketplace


Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
• 5+ years of Technology and / or Cyber Underwriting experience
• Strong underwriting acumen
• Existing broker and customer relationships, or the experience and ability to develop strong broker and customer relationships quickly
• Experience and understanding of policy forms
• Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a team environment
• Strong communication skills including negotiation and presentation experience


BHSI Offers:
• A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammates
• A dynamic, action oriented, and thoughtful environment centred on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates and our other stakeholders
• A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasises individual excellence in a team framework


To apply, please submit your CV with a cover letter outlining why this would be the perfect role for you to hr.europe@bhspecialty.com.


NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization


Visit our website at www.bhspecialty.com

Hastings Insurance is looking for an Associate Integration Developer to join its Data & Architectural Services team! The Associate Integration Developer’s primary responsibilities are to support deployed integration solutions between internal and external system platforms, applications, and services. After learning the installed solutions, the Associate will assist with day-to-day production support for these solutions and begin acquiring the skills necessary to develop solution enhancements through the instruction and guidance of senior members of the Integration and Architectural teams. In addition to assisting in supporting and developing these solution interfaces, the Associate Integration Developer will become familiar with the business data and business processes supported by these solutions.

Position Location & Work Format

This role is flexible in its location. Hastings will entertain candidates who reside within our five-state territory (Michigan, Indiana, Illinois, Wisconsin, or Illinois) to work in a remote capacity. Candidates who reside within the greater Hastings, MI area can work either a full-time onsite or hybrid work arrangement. Regardless of the location, this role will generally work within our standard office hours of Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

Hastings may consider candidates who reside in states outside of our five-state territory if other elements of their application are strong.

Position Duties & Responsibilities

• Learn and support microservices and APIs supporting application and system integration.
• Review technical integration design documentation to understand better the solution and the business functions it supports.
• Assist more senior team members in the preparation of delivery recommendations with estimates.
• Develop an understanding of the integration architecture and develop solutions to help maintain the integrity and smooth functioning of the company's integration solution suite.
• Follow the company's software development lifecycle to design, code, configure, test, debug, deploy, and document system and application integrations.
• Actively promote and utilize development standards and best practices and propose solutions to improve team productivity and business results.
• Actively participate in professional development, i.e., continuing education or self-improvement.
• Other duties as assigned by leadership, either verbally or in writing.


Candidate Requirements & Qualifications

• A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Software Engineering is required.
• Some knowledge of:.NET Microservice Development
• API Development
• Database Concepts
• Front-End/Back-End/Full Stack Design Concepts and Patterns.
• General knowledge of Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) tools and related utilities.
• Demonstrated experience in analytical reasoning, logical problem solving, strong attention to detail, and establishing priorities.
• Demonstrated excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
• An intellectual curiosity to continuously learn and improve.
• The ability to operate in a fast-paced environment.

Hastings Insurance is not currently looking to partner with any third-party staffing agencies for recruitment regarding this role or any other open positions.

About Us

At Hastings Insurance, our balanced corporate strategy focuses on implementing emerging technologies, cultivating strong independent agency relationships, and providing the right products to our policyholders.

We seek to strategically grow our product lines and continue to expand geographically while maintaining our financial stability and innovative nature.

Our talented employees are dedicated to providing excellent customer service to our agent partners and policyholders. Many of our employees have been identified as industry experts, and we value the knowledge and skill that they contribute to our success.

For more than 135 years, Hastings has helped our customers protect their valued assets and rebuild after devastating losses. We are proud to be rated an A (Excellent) insurance carrier by A.M. Best Company.

Our Commitment as an Employer

We value the strength of a diverse and inclusive workforce. Hastings Insurance is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and candidates in a work environment that does not tolerate discrimination or harassment. Decisions related to employment are based on business needs, position requirements, and individual characteristics without regard to appearance, nationality, origin, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, body, disability, veteran, family, marital status, or any legally protected class.

Hastings Insurance seeks to provide reasonable accommodation to disabled individuals in the hiring process in compliance with federal, state, and local law. Candidates requiring accommodation to complete their job application or participate in the interviewing process are asked to notify the Talent Acquisition Specialist or contact us at 800-442-8277.

Overview

You will work closely with the decision science team, marketing, marketing operations, legal, IT, and contact center to develop plans to drive customer success. To be successful in this role, you must have exceptional communication and presentation skills, be comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-energy environment, and have a passion for partner led growth with a focus on customer win. You must have experience working in cross- sell, up-sell, and creating internal and external partnerships using customer insights, segmentation, and dashboards.
You must have a minimum of 7 years of experience in partner marketing or co-marketing, and/or a B.A. in Marketing or a related field. You will have the opportunity to work with a talented, team and have a real impact on Gerber Life DTC marketing team success. If you have the necessary qualifications and you're excited to contribute to this mission, we would love to hear from you.
The position will collaborate with Leadership to develop strategies, tactics and initiatives to help W&S and Gerber Life to successfully grow its sales in an economically viable manner. While promoting efficient growth, the person will oversee the allocation of the Marketing budget across a variety of products, campaigns and audiences. Key metrics include: DTC led contact center cross-sell; bottom of the funnel metrics such as Incremental Applications, Issues, Incremental Policies, Issue Rates, Conversion Rates, Retention Rates, Premium, Life Time Revenue, and Return on Ad spend. The person must love numbers.




What you will do

• Conduct in-depth audience analysis with decision science team to understand customer behavior, preferences, and trends, and provide actionable insights to enhance targeting and segmentation strategies
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including marketing, data science, and business intelligence, to ensure alignment on analytics objectives and strategies
• Partner with decision science team on key performance indicators (KPIs) and dashboards to monitor marketing effectiveness and communicate insights to stakeholders
• Stay up-to-date with industry and consumer trends, bringing innovative ideas and best practices to the team
• Performs other duties as assigned
• Complies with all policies and standards




Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree Marketing or related field. (Required)
• Master's Degree MBA (Preferred)
• 7-9 years Proven experience working in marketing or a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. (Require
• 1-3 years Experience within Insurance or Financial Services industry or within Marketing (Required)

• Proficiency in Microsoft suite and Tableau/Power BI, demonstrated experience working with marketing analytics platforms, web analytics tools, and data visualization too

• A passion for staying ahead of industry trends and leveraging new technologies and methodologies to drive marketing success

Work Setting/Position Demands

Visual acuity is required to determine accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of work assignments

description:
Established in 2021, Independence Pet Holdings (IPH) is a corporate holding company that manages a diverse and broad portfolio of modern pet health brands and services, including insurance, pet education, lost recovery services, and more throughout North America.


We believe pet insurance is more than a financial product and build solutions to simplify the pet parenting journey and help improve the well-being of pets. As a leading authority in the pet category, we operate with a full stack of resources, capital, and services to support pet parents. Our multi-brand and omni-channel approach include our own insurance carrier, insurance brands and partner brands.


Pets Best, a subsidiary of IPH, offers pet insurance and wellness plans for dogs and cats in every state. Founded in 2005 with a mission to provide access to comprehensive animal healthcare at an affordable price, Pets Best delivers flexible coverage, an easy claims process, and excellent customer service.


Job Summary:
Pets Best is seeking an AVP, Insurance Analytics to help support product profitability efforts, business development, partner management, claims processing and servicing, and financial reporting. This role will formulate and present analysis and insights and will help support the design, development, and delivery of reports and analytic datasets using SQL, Python, and TABLEAU and other reporting visualization tools. In addition, this role will assemble data, analyze business/product performance, identify problems, and develop recommendations. This role will also contribute to the creation of compliant and auditable business processes to support ongoing reporting and analytic requirements and will provide input to leadership on how to improve data architecture.


Job Location: Remote - Remote work is not available in AK, MT, HI (US)


Main Responsibilities:
• Conduct extensive analysis of performance trends and leverage analytics to examine product profitability.
• Partner with Pets Best leadership team to deliver complex analytical projects from beginning to end, including ideation, data mining, strategic decision support, and presentation of results and recommendations.
• Utilize SQL and/or Python to pull data from source systems and accurately assemble data sets; Use a variety of quantitative methods to understand and analyze data (e.g., regression, histograms, etc.).
• Lead and maintain routine reporting processes (e.g., monthly, partner and prospective client) and automate processes while implementing Quality Control measures to ensure accuracy.
• Lead efforts to enhance the dissemination of information via reporting tools (e.g., Tableau)
• Support efforts to integrate Pets Best data into Synchrony’s data architecture.
• Present complex analytical information to all levels of management in a clear and concise manner.
• Integrate internal and external data into analysis for complete view of the business to drive strategic decision support and uncover new opportunities for growth.
• Produce management level dashboards, ad hoc reporting, and analysis.
• Work closely with Pets Best leadership team to improve business analytic and data gathering processes.
• Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned.


Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in STEM or related quantitative field. In lieu of degree, a high school diploma and 7+ years of analytics work experience in the financial services, insurance, credit card and/or payment industries.
• 3+ years of progressive work experience including 3+ years of insurance industry experience in analytics or operations, 2+ years of experience in analytics, and 1+ years of experience with statistical tools such as Python, SQL, and Tableau
• Demonstrated coding ability in SQL, Python and Tableau


Preferred Qualifications:
• Demonstrated ability to navigate complex data tables/structures
• Demonstrated proficiency in MS Excel (e.g., pivot tables, filters, database functions, VBA, etc.)
• Exposure to R is a plus
• Advanced degree with emphasis in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Decision Science, Operation Research, Engineering or another quantitative field preferred
• Experience managing, moving, and manipulating data from multiple sources
• Experience with segmentation techniques such as decision trees or k-means clustering
• Experience with model development techniques such as logistic regression, random forest, or gradient boosting is a plus
• Excellent organization skills and strong attention to detail
• Strong leadership, analytic, and problem-solving skills and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
• Familiarity with consumer and commercial lending products and practices
• Ability to provide analytic support including pulling data, preparing analysis, interpreting data, making strategic recommendations, and presenting to client/product teams
• Experience measuring marketing campaigns and interpreting results
• Ability to clearly explain technical and analytical information (verbally, written, and in presentation form) and summarize for key stakeholders
• Outstanding communications, relationship building, influencing, and collaboration skills

Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

The A Player Data Collections Specialist does the following:

• Collect building permit data: Contact building departments across the U.S. to obtain electronic copies of building permit data. Hone requests to be as concise as possible to facilitate a quick turnaround. Responsible for developing long-term relationships that allow data to be obtained in a reliable, cost-effective manner. 
• Analyze building permit data: Conduct a preliminary audit of data to ensure that it meets specific quality requirements (electronic data covers the maximum number of years, includes all available fields and is in an optimal format). Address identified problems proactively. 
• Practice exceptional organizational techniques: Record every pertinent piece of information using customer relationship management software. This includes details about email and phone interactions, as well as keeping track of contact information. 
• Strategize about tactics: Brainstorm with coworkers to find solutions to overcome obstacles. Flexes their research and critical thinking muscles to find creative new approaches to get the job done. 
• Continually improve: Identify steps in the process that could be improved. Share ideas with team members and management in a continuous effort to optimize our performance. 
• Adept with technology: Able to successfully navigate office tools like our internal CRM (Honey), E-mail, Word, Excel; good internet searching and research skills; knowledgeable about various file formats.


Qualifications

The qualified candidate will have both the attitude and the experience to successfully fill this role, including:

Cultural Fit

• Environment: Comfortable in a hard-working, fast paced, team environment with the ability to have fun and maintain professionalism with fellow employees (virtually). 
• Commitment to Quality: Strong desire to meet and exceed expectations through attention to detail, technical knowledge, and willingness to provide assistance to other team members.


Other Qualifications

• Education: 4 years of a college degree or similar preferred
• Full-Time Employment: Ability to work as a full-time (40 hrs) employee
• Work Environment: Ability to work a hybrid schedule – 3 days WFH, 2 days in our Asheville, NC office


Qualifications

The A Player Data Collections Specialist is the following:

• Clear, concise and professional: The successful Data Collections Specialist interacts with building departments in a professional manner that reflects our core values at BuildFax. 
• Relentless: This individual lives and breathes to collect building permit data. They persevere and do not take no for an answer. They are always pushing to acquire the highest quality data available. 
• Resourceful negotiator: Passionately finds ways over, around or through barriers. Can think on their feet to overcome objections. Shows bias for action. A results-oriented "doer."
• Self-motivated: Arrives on time and feels a deep sense of personal satisfaction when the job is done. Gets a jump on priority tasks and consistently shows initiative. 
• Relationship owner: The Data Collections Specialist takes ownership of each jurisdiction they are collecting data from. They have a personal interest in every step of the process and take pride in the quality of the outcome. 
• Talented multi-tasker: This individual will maintain dozens of collection efforts simultaneously. They will prioritize tasks effectively and manage their time efficiently. 
• Maintains Positive Attitude: This person keeps a smile on their face despite challenging interactions with building departments and is able to bounce back and focus on the next task.


Additional Information

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companiesand by Forbesas a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions— provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions— supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions— offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions— provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions— provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions— delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions– offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft— provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper-connected world.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real - and happening daily.
About the role

As part of the Security Engineering Backend team, you will work on APIs that serve Coalition Control, our user-facing product enabling business owners to detect and mitigate cyber risk.  You will be working across multiple software development projects that can range from APIs serving the frontend and internal tools, to scraping and ETL workflows.

Our core platform is written mostly in Python with some services in Go, running in AWS. We prefer to use the right tool for the job and make pragmatic judgments about how to scale and decouple systems as we continue to grow.


Responsibilities

• Be part of a remote team

• Design, develop and test backend implementations of new and existing product features, including features powered by AI

• Improve the reliability and scalability of our backend APIs

• Collaborate with the product team and other engineering teams as we define behavior for new features targeting security professionals.


Skills and Qualifications

• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science or a related field.

• Experienced writing code in modern programming languages, preferably in Python.

• Effective written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey engineering-related topics to team members.

• Effective problem-solving skills to analyze and debug code.

• Experience with SQL databases and data modeling

• Curiosity and desire to learn about how things work at the deepest levels


Bonus Points

• Cloud Services

• Deployment automation and scalable infrastructure

• Experience writing monitors and alerts

• Knowledge of HTTP / REST security concepts, including common vulnerabilities


Perks

• 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage

• Flexible PTO

• Annual home office stipend and WeWork access

• Mental & physical health wellness programs like Headspace, Lumino, and more!

• Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

 Why Coalition? 
We’re a remote-first, mission-driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk.

Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion. 

We’re always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.
