At Coaction, we’re a unique mix of leaders, achievers, thinkers, and team players with a high-performance mindset and a diverse skillset. We bring our industry expertise together to continually push the boundaries of what insurance can be for our clients.

A Software Developer will build and enable new products and capabilities in the policy administration system. This role will have the responsibility to develop and implement using the Duck Creek Commercial Lines platform. The candidate will work closely with the architects, delivery, business analysts, QA, and support teams to understand business objectives and design and develop optimal solutions. The candidate will work with APIs, .Net, Duck Creek, SQL, XSLT and whatever other technologies necessary to design and implement solutions. The candidate must have a keen sense of autonomy, ambiguity management, adaptability, favors simplicity, a passion for problem solving, and must be highly collaborative.

Responsibilities

• Develop and implement new capabilities, proprietary forms, and related business rules.
• Develop enhancements both small and large, which can include front-end, back-end, and integration layer development all while adhering to established coding, architectural and security practices.
• Partner with and assist in oversight of production support development resources to ensure quality of monthly releases.
• Support new product rollouts and configure system based on the business requirements.
• Build new or configure existing raters, setup tables, and implement rating algorithms.
• Maintain, implement, and utilize APIs (REST, SOAP, XML over HTTP) for various use cases such as system integrations and system customizations.
• Ensure coding standards, procedures, and principles are followed diligently and consistently.
• Monitor the performance of the application to look for opportunities for optimization
• Design, develop, unit test, support, and document changes, adhering to the development standards.
• Employ critical and innovative thinking to design and develop efficient and effective solutions.
• Perform root cause analysis and identify short and long-term solutions for technical and architectural issues.
• Perform unit and system testing to verify complete scenario coverage of code implementation.
• Partner with key stakeholders to ensure that all changes are implemented per the specifications.
• Provide required support during quality assurance and user testing to ensure that the functionality is working as expected.
• Support ongoing monthly releases, platform, and template upgrade efforts as necessary.
• Work with the ETL and Data teams to accurately book policies and report externally.
• Keep abreast of Duck Creek product roadmap and the industry trends.



Qualifications

• Experience with Commercial Lines, ISO circulars and forms systems configuration is preferred.
• Experience with modern P&C Policy Administration System (PAS), specifically Duck Creek (Commercial Lines) is preferred.
• Experience related to Author, Field View and Forms Mapper is preferred.
• Experience implementing static, dynamic, pencil edit, and iterative forms is desired.
• Knowledge of Duck Creek Server API, and additional knowledge of various industry known tools, such as searching tools such as Agent Ransack, diffing tools such as Beyond Compare or GIT Diff, and decompilers such as dotPeek.
• Strong technical skills in Microsoft.Net framework and other technologies including proficiency in C#, SQL Server, Web services/APIs, XSLT, Regex, JavaScript, ExtJS.
• Deep understanding of data exchange formats and web technologies, including: XML, SOAP, JSON, HTML, CSS, REST, etc.
• Proficiency in object-oriented programming, database, data structures, algorithms, and Web technologies.
• Working knowledge of source code control, debugging, performance monitoring, benchmarking, logging and testing tools.
• Experience with SDLC tracking tools such as JIRA, Azure DevOps.
• Strong debugging & troubleshooting skills. A propensity for clean and efficient code that is reusable when applicable.
• Highly analytical and structured thinking, with the innate curiosity and creativity to innovate unorthodox solutions to problems.
• Strong customer orientation, communication, and interpersonal skills, to help negotiate priorities. 
• Ability to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner.
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field.
• 0-3 Years experience in software development



Candidates will be required to work on a hybrid schedule out of our Morristown, NJ office 3 days a week.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Coaction is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Coaction’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coaction also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.

TITLE: MANAGER – IT DEVOPS – SRE STATUS: EXEMPT

REPORT TO: DIRECTOR – IT INFRASTRUCTURE

DEPARTMENT: IT – INFRASTRUCTURE DEVOPS

JOB CODE: 11629

 PAY RANGE: $141,400.00 - $160,000.00 ANNUALLY

General Description

The Manager – IT DevOps plays a pivotal role in leading and guiding our DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams. This position involves collaborating across business lines and technology groups, ensuring smooth project execution, and maintaining critical production activities that mitigate downtime risks. They will also oversee software release management, builds, and deployments. As the subject matter expert, the manager drives excellence through the application of ever evolving DevOps and SRE best practices.

Tasks, Duties, Functions

• Personnel Management: 
• Attracts, coaches, and retains top-tier resources specializing in DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering. 
• Fosters a positive and engaging work environment for each team member by promoting skill development, coaching for improvement and growth, inspiring others through their words and actions, ensuring positive employee morale throughout Golden 1, and embracing our mission, vision, and core values. 
• Prioritizes, assigns, and directs all work assignments on systems issues and assigned projects to support day-to-day operations and future implementations objectives. 
• Conducts regular performance evaluations and provides constructive feedback. 
• Technology Management 
• Designs, implements, and maintains scalable, secure, and highly available infrastructure using modern DevOps tools and practices. 
• Ensures infrastructure reliability, resilience, and performance through proactive monitoring and optimization. 
• Applies DevOps and SRE methodologies for Infrastructure as Code with automation and including best practice telemetry where possible. 
• Provides leadership and direction through technical subject matter expertise to staff responsible for integration of software and hardware applications in a hybrid environment, on premise and Azure cloud. 
• Ensures all on premise and cloud systems software and hardware versions, maintenance levels, registration and inventory and provides upgrades as necessary to ensure appropriate security and patch levels are maintained. 
• Directs all project management for the large computing projects that cross multiple technologies, platforms, and administrative boundaries. 
• Vendor Management: 
• Collaborates with hardware and software vendors for procurement, licensing, and support. 
• Evaluates new technologies and recommends upgrades. 
• Documentation and Training: 
• Maintains comprehensive documentation for server configurations, processes, and procedures. 
• Conducts training sessions for team members and end-users. 
• Security and Compliance: 
• Ensures all system and related security standards are adhered to by staff. 
• Reviews standards periodically with information security and risk departments and other IT Managers and implement changes as required. 
• Implements security protocols, access controls, and encryption mechanisms. 
• Collaboration: 
• Fosters strong relationships with other department managers and supervisors to coordinate support activities and project related tasks. 
• Builds strong relationships with senior business stakeholders. 
• Reporting and Communication: 
• Prepares regular reports for all levels of management, service providers, and staff. 
• Communicates effectively with stakeholders, providing actionable insights and recommendations. 
• Compliance 
• Maintains a thorough understanding of state and federal laws and regulations related to credit union compliance including bank secrecy and anti-money laundering laws appropriate to the position. 
• Develops and maintains an understanding of the pertinent regulatory requirements and risks inherent to job responsibilities, establish, and maintain control activities that mitigate those risks consistent with the Credit Union’s risk appetite, and ensure operational integrity and compliance with applicable regulations. 
• Participate in the “Management On-Call” rotation. 
• Performs other job-related duties, as necessary.


PHYSICAL SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND EXERTION UTILIZED IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THESE TASKS:

• Effective oral and written communication skills required to interpret, resolve, and document networking problems. 
• Strong organizational and time management skills; ability to articulate system methodologies and concepts; communicate effectively in providing technical guidance and expertise to other staff. 
• Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate applicable computer hardware, a variety of hand tools and standard office equipment.


Organizational Contacts & Relationships

• INTERNAL: All levels of staff and management 
• EXTERNAL: Vendors


Qualifications

• EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or comparable discipline or equivalent work experience. 
• EXPERIENCE: 
• 
• Minimum of seven years’ experience in Information Technology in a senior level administrator role 
• Minimum of three years’ experience in project management and personnel supervision is required. 
• Demonstrates strong aptitude to work with business owners for planning of enterprise-wide technologies. 
• Demonstrates strong aptitude to work effectively and support others in an environment of continuous change. 
• Subject matter expert with DevOps Automation and Site Reliability methodologies 
• Proficiency in deployment/configuration management tools such as Jenkins, Kubernetes, Puppet, or Ansible. 
• Experience with version control tools like GIT, Bitbucket, SVN, or CVS. 
• Strong understanding of network infrastructure, databases, cloud services, data centers, and security protocols. 
• Knowledge of Linux and/or Windows OS. 
• Familiarity with Azure and other cloud services. 
• Programming and scripting skills (Python, Perl, Bash, PHP, Java, SQL, or C++). Subject matter expert with PowerShell and other Automated scripting processes 
• Working experience with Linux Red Hat 
• Working experience with Microsoft SQL on premise and Azure Cloud 
• Working experience with Storage Systems


Physical Requirements

• Prolonged sitting throughout the workday to accomplish tasks. 
• Availability for emergency and on call duty 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed. 
• Occasional travel may be required. 
• Lift and carry communications equipment and computer hardware weighing up to fifty pounds. 
• Corrected vision in the normal range required to configure, test, and troubleshoot network server hardware and data. 
• Hearing within normal range. 
• Must possess sufficient manual dexterity to skillfully operate applicable computer hardware, a variety of hand tools and standard office equipment. 
• May work additional work hours to accomplish tasks.


Licenses/Certifications

• Possession of a valid California Driver’s License is required. 
• DevOps or Site Reliability Certifications (Desired) 
• At least one or more technical certifications 
• Microsoft Windows and Azure Certification (Desired) 
• VMware Certified Advance Professional (Desired) 
• Citrix Certification (Desired) 
• Linux Certification (Desired) 
• Project Management Professional or Agile Certification (Desired)


THIS JOB DESCRIPTION IN NO WAY STATES OR IMPLIES THAT THESE ARE THE ONLY DUTIES TO BE PERFORMED BY THIS EMPLOYEE. HE OR SHE WILL BE REQUIRED TO FOLLOW OTHER INSTRUCTIONS AND TO PERFORM OTHER DUTIES REQUESTED BY HIS OR HER SUPERVISOR THAT ARE WITHIN HIS / HER KNOWLEDGE, SKILL AND ABILITY AS WELL AS HIS / HER MENTAL AND PHYSICAL ABILITIES.

REV. 11/19/2024

Kuvare is a growth-oriented insurance platform that delivers diversified annuities, life insurance, and supplemental products to the middle-income and mass-affluent consumer segments through its acquisition-led growth strategy. Kuvare provides proven capabilities, strategic support, substantial resources, and patient capital to help insurance companies pursue and achieve sustainable growth opportunities. With its patient capital, Kuvare targets differentiated annuity and life insurance companies to bring into its family of brands.

Summary/Objective

The Test Automation Engineer will hold a key role on our QA and Testing team. They will be responsible for identifying opportunities for automation within the software development life cycle and implementing them with the necessary code, tools, and frameworks.

Duties & Responsibilities

• Designing and executing QA tests with scripts that test functionality periodically without the need for human intervention.
• Performing tests on all parts of the product’s infrastructure, such as databases, networks, applications, systems, software, firmware, and hardware.
• Finding places within the team’s software development process where automation could be executed.
• Analyzing and Understanding testing procedures and requirements.
• Locating bugs and identifying quality issues within various processes, whether on a business, development, or service level.
• Working with other departments, including non-technical team members to understand how automation can improve their processes and identify areas of improvement. Working with developers and the IT staff to align test automation with code releases, combining an understanding of both engineering and coding. (CI/CD).
• Obtaining requirements from stakeholders and end-users to find automation solutions that align with development goals.
• Ensuring product quality & processes.
• Installing the necessary tools and frameworks that make better automation possible


Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, management information systems, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Five or more (5+ years) of test automation experience.
• Working knowledge of Web and Mobile testing.
• Strong knowledge of automation frameworks.
• Experience with Azure DevOps.
• Proficiency with database usage and SQL, SQL Server.
• Proficiency in multiple programming languages.
• Proficiency with low-code automation solutions.
• Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
• Experience with Waterfall and Agile development methodology and concepts.
• Five or more (5+ years) of Life and/or Annuity Insurance experience is preferred
• Experience with PowerShell and / or Windows Commands preferred.


Skills/Competencies

• Excellent written and oral communication skills.
• Excellent listening and interpersonal skills.
• Strong attention to detail.
• Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language.
• Analytical and creative problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
• Ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
• Strong customer service orientation.


Physical Demands

• Normal office working environment
• Occasional evening and weekend hours to meet deadlines
• Ability to sit for extended periods of time
• Ability to type / perform data entry
• Ability to read from a computer screen and paper reports
• Express ideas and otherwise communicate with the spoken word
• Limited travel (5-10%) may be required


Upon request, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

We are dedicated to a policy of nondiscrimination in employment on any basis including age, sex, color, race, creed, national origin, religious persuasion, marital status, political belief, or disability that does not prohibit performance of essential job functions. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Description

Reserv is an incubating cutting-edge AI and automation technology focused on bringing efficiency and simplicity to insurance claims by redefining claims adjusting. Founded by insurtech veterans with deep experience in SaaS and digital claims – and venture-backed by Bain Capital and Altai Ventures – Reserv began operations in May 2022 and has rapidly expanded.

About the role

As a Recruiter at Reserv, you will play a pivotal role in our organization's recruiting function. Your responsibilities will encompass various recruiting activities, from sourcing to managing external recruiting agencies to creating a source of truth in our ATS. We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Recruiter to join our team. The ideal candidate should possess strong relationship management and communication skills.

What we need

• Source and recruit high-quality candidates for insurance adjuster roles.
• Establish and maintain strong relationships with hiring managers, recruiting agencies, and candidates.
• Develop and execute recruitment strategies and tactics to source and attract top talent.
• Conduct phone/video interviews to assess candidates' skills, experience, and fit for the role.
• Work with hiring managers and recruiting agencies to review resumes, provide feedback, and coordinate candidate interviews and feedback.
• Ensure efficient and fast scheduling, facilitate communication among all parties, and ensure hiring is within budget.
• Manage the applicant tracking system to ensure it is the single source of truth for tracking.
• Create reports on the recruiting process to provide clear insight into the hiring pipeline and actionable insights to improve the pipeline.
• Design and iterate on recruiting strategies to balance different objectives ranging from speed to preserving interviewer bandwidth to different specific requirements for different recommendations.
• Stay updated with industry trends, recruitment and talent acquisition best practices.


Requirements

Who you are

• 2+ years of experience as a full life-cycle recruiter, exclusively recruiting for insurance adjuster roles with knowledge of specialized adjuster roles.
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
• Proven track record of building and maintaining strong relationships with hiring managers and candidates.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Strong sourcing and recruitment skills, with experience using various sourcing techniques.
• Ability to manage multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
• Knowledge of recruitment metrics and reporting.
• Proficiency with applicant tracking systems (we use GreenHouse).
• Proficiency with tech tools: Apple Computer, Google Suite, and Slack.
• Ready to hit the ground running!


Benefits

• Generous health-insurance package with nationwide coverage, vision, & dental
• 401(k) retirement plan with employer matching
• Competitive PTO policy – we want our employees fresh, healthy, happy, and energized!
• Generous family leave policy
• Work from anywhere to facilitate your work-life balance paired with frequent, regular corporate retreats to build team cohesion, reinforce culture, and have fun
• You may want an Apple laptop, large second monitor, and other quality-of-life equipment. Technology is something that should make your life easier, not harder!


At Reserv, we value diversity and believe that a variety of perspectives leads to innovation and success. We are actively seeking candidates who will bring unique perspectives and experiences to our team and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you believe you are a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you!

About The Role.

The AVP, Underwriting Practice Strategy role is responsible for leading key line of business underwriting initiatives to deliver value across the Field Underwriting organization. You will leverage operational and performance insights and partner with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Claims, Risk Management, Sales, etc.) to inform underwriting strategies, approach, guidelines, best practices, etc. Candidates should demonstrate comfort with leveraging data to identify root causes, building and executing on strategies to address business opportunities, leading through change, and influencing key stakeholders.

This individual will lead initiatives that drive new business premium growth, create internal efficiency, reduce friction for the PURE membership, brokers, and staff, and increase employee engagement. Strong candidates will demonstrate prior success in a strategic, analytical, metrics-driven role. Candidates should be capable communicators with the ability to influence business outcomes through partnership and collaboration. This role reports to the SVP, Head of Underwriting Excellence, and will work closely with the Underwriting leadership team.

Underwriting Excellence is responsible for the delivery of the strategies, tools, and processes to enable confident underwriting, profitable growth, and thoughtful book management.

What You’ll Do.

• Lead key growth and profitability initiatives to improve Underwriting outcomes and enable thoughtful member solutions.
• Execute on target Underwriting and cross-functional priorities, ensuring portfolio alignment, and process solution definition, design, and implementation.
• Deliver insights and recommendations to shape strategic priorities and key initiatives, and bring about desired results, including operating in a strategic capacity to represent Field Underwriting on enterprise strategic initiatives.



What We’re Looking For.

Education and Experience Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree and 10+ years of experience.
• Exceptional strategic, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with strong attention to detail.
• Excellent communication, collaboration. and influence abilities.
• Strong project management skills and a proven ability to balance multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
• Experience using software to extract, analyze, organize, and communicate data to support decision-making.



Essential Qualifications and Competencies:

• Excellent oral and written communication skills: demonstrated ability to clearly communicate thoughts and ideas, and adjust communication based on audience.
• Strategic thinker – with experience successfully solving complex problems, planning for the future, and leading through change. 
• Excellent organizational and planning skills: able to conduct analyses, address challenges, and collaborate effectively with multiple teams and functions.
• Demonstrates ability to establish clear priorities, execute on objectives, and manage time and competing priorities; effectively communicates risks, and issues and escalates issues as appropriate.
• Demonstrates analytical and influence skills; is able to articulate analytical results as well as the “so what.”
• Strong project management skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently and handle competing priorities.
• Exceptional interpersonal, listening, and engagement skills.
• Highest level of integrity and honesty.
• Confident, self-motivated, and self-directed.
• Eagerness to develop new skills and enhance expertise.
• Strong analytical capabilities with a curiosity for finding answers to questions.
• Proactive task and issue management, with the awareness of when to escalate issues as appropriate.



The base salary for this role can range from $140K - $170K, based on a full-time work schedule. An individual’s ultimate compensation will vary depending on job-related skills and experience, geographic location, alignment with market data, and equity among other team members with comparable experience.

Since our founding in 1996, we have been at the vanguard of financial technology, providing groundbreaking expertise, quantitative analytics and software that redefine pricing and risk management in the financial markets. With the strategic acquisitions of FINCAD, PolyPaths and Kynex, Numerix has further strengthened its leadership position empowering financial institutions worldwide, to transform risk into opportunities with confidence.

Numerix empowers Capital Market participants to solve derivative analytics problems with innovative simplicity. The key to our success for over 30 years is our unique combination of innovative engineering and a highly dedicated team committed to going above and beyond to help customers and partners achieve their goals.

As a Professional Services Engineer - Quant, you will contribute to the successful delivery of customer onboarding and solution implementation services for both our SaaS and on-premises clients. You will work hands-on with both our clients and the product team, always striving to meet our business objectives. The financial markets in which our customers operate are dynamic and fast paced. Thus, requiring the Customer Services and Product teams to be continuously adapting to work on innovative solutions that serve our customers.

What You'll Do

• Help design complex valuation and risk solutions through customer implementation projects that include but not limited to;
• Capturing and translating customer business requirements into solution specifications and designs.
• Front-to-Risk systems configuration.
• Systems integration/interfaces.
• Workflow automation. 
• First line troubleshooting during QA and customer testing.
• Contribute to the full lifecycle of product development working with a team of Financial Engineers, Quantitative Analysts, Solution Architects / Developers and Project Managers.
• Partner closely with product engineering, product management, sales, pre-sales and support to deliver analytics solutions that meet our clients’ expectations. 
• Be an active contributor to change management, and to a positive, collaborative, and high performing team environment across Numerix as a whole.
• Drive change management and lead, coach and mentor other team members.

Measures Of Success

• Contribute to the optimisation of Professional services revenue adopting best practice throughout project implementations. 
• Continuous training and knowledge exchange across technical resources in PS. 
• Support operational efficiency in PS by logging time in NetSuite diligently.


What We're Looking For

• At least 3 – 5 years experience in financial derivatives, risk analytics and capital markets with strong understanding of quantitative finance and technology.
• Some experience with risk analytics including but not limited to Historical, Monte Carlo & Scenario VaR, XVA, PFE etc., as well as In-depth familiarity with Product Structures, Curve Building, Pricing Models, Risk and Market Reference Data.  
• Strong demonstration, communication, and interpersonal skills are a must. 
• Strong understanding of the Software Development Life-Cycle (SDLC) and best practices of the same (preferably Agile) and development tools like JIRA. 
• Strong hands-on experience with python and/or other programming languages.
• Experience with cloud-based native services and SaaS offerings.


Extra Credit

• Graduated with an advanced degree (Masters) in a technical discipline, such as quantitative finance, financial engineering, mathematics, or physics. 
• Worked as a consultant and/or other professional/client services teams on software implementation projects or some experience in product management.


Where You’ll Work

This is a hybrid role that includes work from home and 3 days in the Singapore Office.

An Important Note On Salary

The annual pay range for this position is based on the preferred primary location of the role which is listed above. If you are applying to this role at a location that is not the preferred primary location, please keep in mind the salary range will vary and may fall outside of what is listed. Base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Also note that unsolicited contact from third-party recruiters or agencies will not be considered at this time. We respectfully request no outreach from agencies.

When, Millennial Specialty Insurance (“MSI”) partnered with Baldwin Risk Partners in 2019, we were a single-product tech-enabled renters insurance platform with only 18 colleagues. Today, MSI has grown to over 900 colleagues with more than 10 insurance products thru a combination of rapid organic growth and strategic, tech-enabled partnerships. Our goal is to produce proprietary products to our customers that are fast, easy to use, and customizable with a deep focus on the customer experience. We believe that through our scalable, tech-enabled, proprietary platform and products, we will fundamentally change the insurance industry. Internally, we are dedicated to a culture that has innovation at its core and providing a world class colleague experience. Since 2021, we have tripled our colleague headcount to support the growth of the business. MSI is looking for top talent to join our journey as we continue to grow. Come join us at Millennial Specialty Insurance, the MGA of the Future!

The Director of Engineering for the Personal Insurance Lines division is a strategic management position, responsible for driving quality, stability, and operational excellence across MSI’s software engineering teams within the Personal Insurance Lines business unit. The director will oversee engineering managers who cover renters, homeowners, flood, and other consumer insurance products. In addition, the director will manage engineering teams who support consumer-facing portals, APIs for distribution partners, and other mission-critical solutions within MSI’s technology portfolio. The Director of Engineering will ensure a high standard of technical and operational excellence, advocate for a “run what you what build” mentality, and hold teams accountable for the stability, security, maintainability, adaptability, and customer experience of their respective products and the broader platform. This role is for a technical leader who brings a customer-centric mindset, a commitment to quality, and an adeptness at managing line-of-business engineering teams.

Responsibilities

Technical Leadership & Strategy

• Refine and execute the engineering strategy for high-volume, mission-critical insurance products within the Personal Insurance Lines division.
• Drive adoption of best practices in monitoring and observability, and advocate for a “run what you build” culture, where engineers are accountable for the end-to-end performance of their applications.
• Manage and report on system stability, software quality, and customer experience, ensuring the success of MSI’s proprietary software solutions.
• Work closely with the Product function to lead the creation, negotiation, management, and execution of both product and technology roadmaps.



Team Management & Development

• Recruit, hire, and develop exceptional engineering talent, with an emphasis on senior and staff-level software engineers and high-performing engineering managers.
• Manage and mentor senior software development managers responsible for renters, homeowners, flood, and other consumer-facing insurance products and services.
• Bring the needs of users, customers, and stakeholders to bear on team deliverables; simultaneously, advocate for a high-quality and productive developer experience (DevEx) through tooling, process improvement, etc.
• Promote a culture of innovation, encouraging bottom-up ideation and creativity to solve complex technical challenges.
• Foster collaboration between teams of US-based FTEs and offshore teams, ensuring cohesion and high productivity across all engineering functions.



Operational Excellence

• Set and uphold standards for code quality, system reliability, and operational excellence across the Personal Insurance Lines division.
• Lead teams in adopting effective practices in monitoring and observability to ensure system stability and resilience.
• Ensure that all software engineering teams adhere to MSI’s best practices for security, scalability, and performance.



Qualifications

Required Experience

• 10+ years in software organizations, with at least 3 years as a manager-of-managers.
• Experience in leading technical strategy for high-volume, mission-critical systems.
• Success in building and scaling technical teams, with a track record of hiring and developing top talent.
• Expertise in designing and operating resilient, reliable systems with robust monitoring and observability practices.



Valued Experience

• Background in high-growth, consumer-facing, transactional services.
• Experience in insurance/InsurTech, finance/FinTech, or other regulated environments.
• 5-10 years of hands-on experience in software development or infrastructure engineering.
• Experience with large-scale workloads in Azure; background in .NET.



Click here for some insight into our culture!

description:
About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper-connected world.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real - and happening daily.
About the role
In this role you will be instrumental to the success of Coalition’s EEA expansion strategy and form an integral part of a small and growing team based in Germany. You will oversee the daily operations of our European entity, create strong relationships with our carrier partners and across Coalition, oversee product enhancements, input into future expansion strategy, including planning, and monitor the underwriting and claims performance. You will be versed in improving efficiency by enhancing operational policies and procedures and ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations and industry standards. 

We are looking for someone who has a strong background in operations. The role suits those comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, all while effectively managing and prioritising a wide array of tactical and strategic projects. You will need to connect diverse workstreams to solve complex problems critical to Coalition’s strategy and growth in the EEA and be adept at managing key stakeholders, including carrier partners, brokers, regulators, vendors, and internal clients.

Proficiency in English and German is mandatory, as cross-functional collaboration between European and North American teams will be frequent. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on variety and seeks to make a tangible impact across all facets of business operations.

The role will report to the UK Special Projects lead and offers a fantastic opportunity to make a tangible impact.

Responsibilities

• Lead and drive the implementation of Coalition’s EEA expansion strategy; responsible for the analysis, composition, and delivery of detailed solutions

• Ensure alignment of business development activities and processes across European regions and countries

• Support identifying and exploring key broker initiatives and how best to utilise these to our advantage

• Drive collaboration and communicate results with cross-functional teams, particularly in areas such as regulatory compliance, tax, and product

• Identify new strategic initiatives that will enable Coalition to achieve strategic goals, working with both internal and external stakeholders

• Maintain a current view of market developments, including regulatory changes in Germany

• Help diligence, negotiate, and implement transactions (e.g., vendors, partners, M&A)


Skills and Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree

• 3+ years of relevant work experience with in the insurance industry

• Fluent proficiency in German and English

• Demonstrated critical thinking and project management experience combined with impeccable business judgement

• Experience implementing strategic and operational initiatives

• Experience developing intricate presentations to facilitate effective communication with senior stakeholders, illustrating sound financial and technical capabilities

• Self-directed and self-motivated; excellent communicator and collaborator


Bonus Points 

• Proficiency in additional languages, especially French 

• Experience working in a high-growth environment

• European regulatory awareness


Perks

• 100% public healthcare coverage

• 30+ paid holidays

• Annual home office stipend

• Statutory pension

• Mental & physical health wellness programs

• Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

 Why Coalition? 
We’re a remote-first, mission-driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk.

Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion. 

We’re always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.

Visit our Newsroom > 



Privacy Notice
Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. We collect, use, and store personal information as necessary for the recruitment process and in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations in all regions where we operate. We want you to understand what personal information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding access, correction, and deletion of your data where applicable. Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy. For further details, please review our full Privacy Policy or contact us with any questions regarding how your information is handled.

Our Privacy Policy > 



Anti-Discrimination Notice

Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, without discrimination or harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable laws in each country where we operate. This commitment includes, but is not limited to, ensuring equal treatment in recruitment, selection, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, and all other aspects of employment. Coalition does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace.



Accommodations
Coalition is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in each country where we operate. Our policy is to support equal opportunity in the hiring process by considering qualified applicants regardless of disability or other protected characteristics, unless providing accommodation would impose an undue hardship or disproportionate burden. If you require accommodation to complete an application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participate in the selection process, please contact us at candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com. We also consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in line with applicable laws and regulations in each jurisdiction.



To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Who we are seeking: We are seeking a high-performance Business Partner for healthcare services third party administrator, Wellcove by CHCS Services, Inc (Wellcove). The Business Partner is a critical player in our organizational success equation. The right talent should be highly organized with an intense drive to build and retain the right workforce driving the digital transformation of the enterprise to provide best in class services to clients and their policyholders. Talent should be analytical and performance focused, self-motivated, adaptive and collaborative.

Who we are: We are an established and rapidly expanding comprehensive, vertically integrated healthcare services third party administrator. Our transaction volume, complexity, growth and strategic objectives are quickly elevating our demand and need for an exceptional, experienced, driven, high-performance Business Partner to collaborate with our department leaders and people managers in our mission to succeed.

At Wellcove you will find diverse colleagues who are not afraid to be a part of a technological transformation unique in the market. For our associates joining us from our top competitors, the ability to take on challenges and succeed keeps them here. Our portfolio consists of Fortune 100 and 50 companies who trust us to custody their brand. What is the role: As the HR Business Partner you will be a key partner in aligning business objectives with the right workforce, maintaining a support structure that ensures a high level of performance while ensuring compliance. This role will serve as a strategic business partner to company leaders, anticipating needs for change, recommending data-driven solutions, and influencing sustainable resolutions and change. Will work with all departments to define tactical plans and department competencies required to achieve great company outcomes. Responsible for partnering with department managers to source the right talent through external and internal recruiting as well as development that supports the digital transformation of Wellcove. Support of performance management and associate relations will be a primary focus. The role also includes a heavy focus on administration, including benefits and training as well as data management and reporting for continuous improvement. Delivers communications and training initiatives during onboarding and an ongoing basis. The role is instrumental in maintaining the required talent while ensuring compliance with client, legal, local, federal, other regulatory bodies.

What are the responsibilities: For more information request the job description

What Skills, Experience And Education Are Required

Excellent interpersonal skills

• Strong logical, analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and ability to work through complex situations
• Demonstrated organization, facilitation, clear communication, i.e. prepare concise detailed written reports, and presentation skills to interface with senior management, enterprise leaders, and peers
• Excellent computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office applications
• Experience developing, measuring and reporting performance of programs, including project management skills
• Experience working with a team, preferably international teams, including making plans, monitoring and measuring the effectiveness of the activities of direct or indirect reports
• Exhibits emotional intelligence and professional demeanor, working with integrity, inspiring confidence and creating trust
• Minimum of 8 years of experience resolving complex associate relations issues
• Working knowledge of multiple human resource disciplines, including associate relations, talent planning & acquisition, HRIS - maintaining associate data, HR analytics & reporting, compensation & succession planning, performance management, LMS- Learning and Development, Benefits Administration, FMLA & ADA Leave Management, Payroll assistance, Strategy, and federal and state respective employment laws.
• BBA Human Resources Management or HRD preferred.
• SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP) or HRCI-PHR or SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) or HRCI-SPHR credential required


What will the experience be: You will be challenged daily to improve yourself while making continuous improvements within the enterprise through active management. You will be rewarded by working in a performance-based environment for growth and personal development. Our organization and existing high-performance leadership encourage people to live up to their true potential.

How to respond: To demonstrate your interest in the above opportunity please respond with your Resume and a brief cover letter written specifically addressing why you feel you should be considered a successful candidate, where you are located and your willingness to relocate, date of availability and compensation requirements must also be provided to be considered

JOB CODE: 1000201

The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply button at the top or bottom of this page. You'll be required to create an account or sign in to an existing one.

If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to Accessibility (accommodation requests only; other inquiries won't receive a response).

Regular Or Temporary

Regular

Language Fluency: English (Required)

Work Shift

1st Shift (United States of America)

Please Review The Following Job Description

Serve as top-level technical authority on leading edge, complex, state-of-the art technologies and/or techniques. This position is a senior leader of the organization who serves as leader, collaborator, innovator, role model, champion and subject matter expert.

The ideal candidate will be a problem solver with the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical senior leadership and can be a hands-on developer when necessary.

This role reports into the CRC Group, a subsidiary of TIH.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties maybe performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

• Function as top-level subject matter expert on assigned technology stack(s).
• Research and maintain knowledge of emerging technologies and their application to the business and existing solutions.
• Actively participate in architectural planning, cost modeling, resource and project planning to support the strategic needs of the company.
• Lead existing and emerging technology and development processes, ensuring alignment with business goals and strategies.
• Identify and develop sound application architecture patterns, frameworks, and standards for use across IT to drive application architecture consistency.
• Apply in-depth knowledge of programming languages and designing, coding, and testing to deliver highly innovative solutions, including developing technology standards and procedures as required.
• Build and maintain strong partnerships with all levels of management to drive improvements to the company’s entire application portfolio.
• Be a resource for teammates at all levels, including overseeing the work of others and provide coaching and training for a small team.
• Act as an Agile champion and leverages continuous engineering practices to deliver business value.


Qualifications

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Required Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent education and related training.
• Minimum seven years’ experience in leading edge, complex technologies and techniques with additional experience within software development. Must have experience in Microsoft Azure.
• Strong experience with programming technologies such as Python, Microsoft .NET, VB.Net, C#, C++, ASP.Net and SQL Server, Azure IaaS and PaaS cloud services, Azure Data Services, and Azure OpenAI.
• Working knowledge of automation technologies such as Microsoft Power Automate, UiPath or Automation Anywhere.
• Proven experience integrating with proprietary and COTS applications, using API best practices for architecture and development.
• Recognized in the industry for experience and knowledge, with in-depth knowledge and experience in information systems and ability to identify, apply, and implement best practices.
• Understanding of multiple disciplines and processes related to the position, and experience applying and utilizing enterprise architectural standards and design principles.
• Solid experience working knowledge of UML and design tools.
• Ability to plan and manage projects independently through a culture of trust and accountability, and to drive change across the IT organization with strong business and financial acumen and effective communication skills.
• Ability to establish strong relationships within the technical community.
• Ability to unify activities within the technology community, coordinating with other businesses and engineering organizations.
• Working experience in an agile environment, including agile development and release practices.
• Ability to contribute effectively as a visionary for future technological capabilities and operational scenarios.
• Ability to work within a demanding environment and manage time/priorities across multiple different projects.


Preferred Qualifications

• Twelve years of experience in technology. 
• Proficiency working with Microsoft cloud technologies and related tooling.
• Experience with Azure DevOps, such as CICD, templating and integrations.
• Experience working with infrastructure as code, either Terraform or Bicep.
• Experience with AI/ML technologies; Microsoft OpenAI highly preferred.
• Five years’ experience in the commercial P&C industry, or equivalent insurance industry experience.
• Wholesale brokerage experience.


General Description of Available Benefits for Eligible Employees of TIH Insurance: All regular teammates (not temporary or contingent workers) working 20 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits, though eligibility for specific benefits may be determined by the division of TIH Insurance offering the position. TIH offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, accidental death and dismemberment, tax-preferred savings accounts, and a 401k plan to teammates. Teammates also receive no less than 10 days of vacation (prorated based on date of hire and by full-time or part-time status) during their first year of employment, along with 10 sick days (also prorated), and paid holidays. For more details on TIH's generous benefit plans, please visit our site. Depending on the position and division, this job may also be eligible for TIH’s defined benefit pension plan, restricted stock units, and/or a deferred compensation plan. As you advance through the hiring process, you will also learn more about the specific benefits available for any non-temporary position for which you apply, based on full-time or part-time status, position, and division of work.

TIH supports a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, citizenship or national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status or other classification protected by law. Crump Life Insurance is a Drug Free Workplace.

McGohan Brabender

Position: Junior Software Developer-Hybrid-Dayton Office

About Us

McGohan Brabender is renowned for recruiting top-tier talent within the employee benefits industry. As one of the nation's largest employee-owned (ESOP) benefit firms, we are true entrepreneurial disruptors in the field. Our team embodies agility, serving as advisors, financial strategists, and innovative problem solvers.

Our culture is infectious, grounded in our unwavering commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where every individual is accorded the utmost dignity and respect. At the core of all our values, whether in life or business, lies our dedication to people. We wholeheartedly encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every single day.

About The Role

As a Jr Software Developer at McGohan Brabender, you will design, develop and maintain software applications, automation scripts, services and other process automation tools. The ideal candidate will be a proactive and detail-oriented individual, focused on collaboration with other IT and non-IT resources to create the best customer centered solutions.

Key Responsibilities

• Write high quality, semantic, testable, maintainable, and well-documented code.
• Engineer and develop automated processes via C# and the Microsoft .NET framework.
• Development will include moving of various data between APIs, JSON, SQL and other structures.
• Working with MS SQL from within .NET code.
• Automation of processes from code, low-code and visual-code.
• Work with business teams to create technical requirements and deliver within time and scope.
• Stay up to date with the latest industry technologies and best practices, applying them where appropriate to our projects.
• Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree in a related field (CS, MIS, etc.) preferred, experience may serve as an adequate substitute for a degree.
• Knowledge of and experience with Microsoft .NET, C#, SQL, APIs (REST).
• Experience with the use of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or similar).
• Additional scripting knowledge and web technologies is a plus.
• Experience with CRMs (Salesforce is a plus).
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
• Understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
• Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and project management abilities.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
• Previous experience in insurance industry/brokerage is a plus.

Join SmartFinancial: Empowering Insurance Agents with Cutting-Edge Technology

Welcome to SmartFinancial, where our mission is clear: to drive growth and success for insurance agencies through our industry-leading technology! Voted one of the Best Places to Work for four consecutive years, we are one of the fastest-growing tech companies.

We are a leading insurance marketplace, connecting millions of shoppers to our network of insurance partners.

We are looking for a detail-oriented Marketing Analyst to join our team. As a Marketing Analyst, you will analyze market trends, competitors, and customer behavior to develop effective marketing strategies. You will work closely with the marketing team to measure the success of marketing campaigns, identify areas for improvement, and provide data-driven insights. The ideal candidate has a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and excellent communication skills.

The compensation for this position is $70,000-$115,000 annually.

What You'll Do

• Analyze market trends, customer demographics, and competitors to identify opportunities and develop effective marketing strategies
• Measure the success of marketing campaigns and initiatives using data analytics tools
• Develop and maintain marketing performance reports and dashboards
• Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to optimize marketing efforts
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align marketing strategies with business goals
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in marketing analytics



What We're Looking For

• 2+ years of experience in marketing analytics or related field
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and Google Analytics
• Ability to analyze and interpret complex data sets
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• Detail-oriented and highly organized
• Ability to work independently and in a team



What We Offer

• Comprehensive Health Coverage: Health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents
• Retirement Plans: 401(k) retirement plan with company matching contributions
• Paid Time Off: Generous PTO, holidays, and extensive paid product training
• Professional Development: Opportunities for career growth and advancement within a supportive environment that values employee development
• Flexible Work Options: Hybrid work arrangements, combining in-office and remote work opportunities



Why You'll Love It Here

We'd especially like to highlight our World Class Culture, which our employees say is the best thing about working at SmartFinancial. We have great SLACK channels for work and play, which keep you connected with your fellow employees throughout the day. Not to mention our top notch company events (like our Summer Beach Party with open bar, chili cook-off, annual holiday yacht party, fun office potlucks and more) that will keep you asking when the next event is.

We also have Penny, our company mascot. Like swag themed after a pink pig wearing glasses? Just. You. Wait.

Join SmartFinancial and become a key player in driving growth for insurance agencies. Apply now, and let's achieve success together!

SmartFinancial is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To learn more about our results-focused culture and employee-focused perks, read more on our careers page.

About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper-connected world.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real - and happening daily.
Responsibilities

• Own and maintain robust data models that serve all verticals and areas of Coalition’s business

• Set the standard for fidelity and metrics consistency across all data models, ensuring all team members have access to the latest and most accurate data, via query or our business intelligence platform

• Collaborate with Product, Analytics, Engineering, and Business team members to help report on KPIs, OKR performance monitoring, and metrics anomalies

• Improve our analytics data stack’s efficiency and deliver timely data even as the business scales

• Make new data sources available and query-able via a ETL pipeline or other data processing jobs


Skills and Qualifications

• A Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or related technical field

• 1-2 years of experience in related analytical, data science or consulting background

• SQL proficiency with proven competencies in designing well-architected data models, optimizing for query performance, and clearly documenting code

• Strong communication skills and ability to convey complex topics to non-technical audiences

• Passion, drive, and a deep sense of responsibility. We build the systems that keep us and our customers safe!


Bonus Points

• Work in Tableau, Looker, or similar visualization / business intelligence platform

• Experience with dbt, Airflow, dagster, Prefect, or similar analytics engineering tools

• Experience with Python, R, or similar programming language

• Understanding of and experience with experimental design, statistical methods and machine learning

• Experience in insurance, insurtech and fintech industries

• Experience using data science tools like scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, XGBoost, TensorFlow

• Exposure to causal inference and other advanced statistical methods


Compensation
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The US base salary for this position ranges from $88,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $134,300/year in our highest geographic market. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors, which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location. Your recruiter can share more on target salary for your location during the interview process. Coalition, Inc. reserves the right to modify this range as needed.

Perks

• 100% medical, dental and vision coverage

• Flexible PTO policy

• Annual home office stipend and WeWork access

• Mental & physical health wellness programs (One Medical, Headspace, Wellhub, and more)!

• Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

 Why Coalition? 
We’re a remote-first, mission-driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk.

Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion. 

We’re always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.

Visit our Newsroom > 



Privacy Notice
Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. We collect, use, and store personal information as necessary for the recruitment process and in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations in all regions where we operate. We want you to understand what personal information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding access, correction, and deletion of your data where applicable. Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy. For further details, please review our full Privacy Policy or contact us with any questions regarding how your information is handled.

Our Privacy Policy > 



Anti-Discrimination Notice

Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, without discrimination or harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable laws in each country where we operate. This commitment includes, but is not limited to, ensuring equal treatment in recruitment, selection, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, and all other aspects of employment. Coalition does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace.



Accommodations
Coalition is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in each country where we operate. Our policy is to support equal opportunity in the hiring process by considering qualified applicants regardless of disability or other protected characteristics, unless providing accommodation would impose an undue hardship or disproportionate burden. If you require accommodation to complete an application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participate in the selection process, please contact us at candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com. We also consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in line with applicable laws and regulations in each jurisdiction.



To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About us
Bolt is looking for someone to join bolt, an exciting Insurtech organization, that is transforming insurance digital distribution.


Key Responsibilities
• Generate new business by making high-volume outbound calls (100+ per day) utilizing Dial technology
• Identify and qualify new prospects across Multiple Verticals and Personas
• Work in close partnership with Sales (AE), Marketing, and BDR Management to deliver a world-class customer experience for prospective customers
• Participate in ongoing professional development and advance professionally within Bolt
• Keep detailed account records in the bolt CRM tool.
• Develop new and creative ways to obtain additional new business opportunities for your efforts in prospecting, working campaigns, and follow-up.
• Build and manage a robust sales pipeline and achieve sales quotas.
• Work cold outbound leads and qualify inbound leads.
• Research emerging technologies, trends, and competitive landscape






Requirements
• 1 - 2 years experience in outbound sales, preferably in the SaaS or Insurance industry
• Bachelor's or Associate degree preferred (will consider sales experience in lieu of degree)
• Understanding or an Interest in SaaS-based solutions
• Experience utilizing technology tools (MS Office Suite: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Teams)
• Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
• Self-motivated and goal-oriented with a track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
• Exceptional organizational skills
• Ability to handle objections effectively
• Competitive, driven, and passionate about sales
• Being bilingual in Spanish is a plus


What you'll get
• Different medical plans to suit you and your family
• Dental and vision insurance
• Short & Long Term Disability
• Life Insurance
• Accident & Critical Illness
• HSA (with annual employer stipend) & FSA
• 401k Program & match
• Paid family leave; we believe in fully supporting new parents
• A clear career path with opportunities for development, both personally and professionally

About Wealth Enhancement Group

Wealth Enhancement is an independent wealth management firm with an endless passion for enriching the lives of our clients. We continually seek to perfect our craft of personalized financial planning with our team-based Roundtable and UniFi processes that go far beyond the standard approach. We proudly provide unique financial plans and investment management services to over 61,000 households from our over 100 offices - and growing - nationwide.

Since 1997, Wealth Enhancement has tirelessly raised the standard of wealth management with specialized knowledge and more attentive service that helps every client craft their future. For more information, please visit www.wealthenhancement.com.

We have a great opportunity for a Senior Cloud Architect, AWS who will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud solutions within our organization. This role involves working closely with both technical and business teams to assess their use cases, understand the desired outcomes, and propose appropriate architectural solutions while considering cost, stability, performance, security, scalability, and supportability. This role will also require close engineering engagement to assist Wealth Enhancement's engineering teams in implementing and supporting the cloud solutions and platforms.

The salary target for this role is $145,000 - $165,000 depending on experience. This role is also eligible for an annual corporate bonus.

We select our initial compensation target using national compensation survey data. When we make an offer, we then factor in things like tenure, performance, and geographic location to come up with the most accurate numbers. We encourage you to apply and provide us with your compensation expectations when you do. We’re big on open conversations, so, let’s have one.

Primary Job Functions

Cloud Architect (AWS)

• Direct and lead Wealth Enhancement's public cloud strategy, cloud infrastructure, migrations, and cloud-first initiatives
• Design, develop, and assist the implementation of Wealth Enhancement's cloud strategies and architectures
• Lead and manage cloud infrastructure and automation initiatives
• Collaborate with cross-functional and interdepartmental teams to design, build, and deploy cloud-based solutions
• Stay up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and industry trends to drive innovation and improve processes
• Identify and troubleshoot any issues related to cloud infrastructure and provide timely resolutions
• Conduct regular performance and security assessments of cloud systems and make necessary improvements
• Create and maintain documentation for all cloud-related processes and procedures
• Train and mentor team members on cloud technologies and best practices
• Communicate with stakeholders to understand business needs and provide recommendations for cloud solutions
• Work closely with project managers to ensure timely delivery of cloud projects
• Collaborate with external vendors and partners to optimize cloud services and costs
• Identify opportunities for cost savings and efficiency improvements in cloud operations
• Ensure compliance with regulatory and security requirements in all cloud-related activities
• Continuously evaluate and improve cloud processes to increase efficiency and performance


Cloud Engineer

• Assist with project, daily activities, support and maintenance of Wealth Enhancement's cloud environments, platforms, and systems
• Collaborate with cloud engineering staff and development teams in implementing and supporting cloud initiatives and projects


Infrastructure Architect

• Assist Infrastructure Architecture in designing and supporting server, storage, network architectures across Wealth Enhancement's hybrid datacenters and environments.


Education/ Qualifications

• Minimum of a bachelor's degree in a Computer Science or Engineering field
• Minimum of 8 years of experience in designing and implementing cloud infrastructure, platforms, and services
• Proven experience in leading complex public cloud architectures and designs from concept through implementation and support. 
• Proven expertise designing, implementing, and securing full scale AWS IaaS environments and virtual datacenters (including infrastructure, networking, storage services)
• Proven experience designing, implementing, securing, and supporting AWS data platforms and integration services (including RedShift, Data Zone, Lake Formation, Athena, Glue, Macie, etc.)
• Experience evaluating and supporting cybersecurity design principles. 
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. 
• Self-motivated with a passion for problem-solving. 
• Strong proficiency in creating and improving system and product requirements. 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
• Strong interpersonal skills, including problem resolution.


Preferred Qualifications

• MS/PhD in Computer or Engineering field. 
• 10+ years of experience in a formal Cloud Architecture and Cloud Engineering roles. 
• Experience in the Financial Services or Financial Technologies industry, focusing on outcome driven strategies, user needs, use case models, system requirements, and infrastructure and platform design. 
• Proven project leadership experience, leading teams on high-visibility and high-priority organizational initiatives. 
• Experience engaging, reporting, and interacting with senior and executive leadership


IND123

Comprehensive Benefits Offerings

Our benefits aim to balance four key elements that make life and work meaningful: health and wellness, financial well-being, professional development, and work/life harmony. You may participate in the following benefits & development opportunities:

• Training and professional development
• Medical, dental and vision coverage
• 401k – with match and profit sharing
• Health care spending and savings accounts
• Dependent care and transit spending accounts
• Wellness programs and resources
• Life and AD&D insurance – employer paid and voluntary options
• Short-term and long-term disability – employer paid
• Employee assistance plan
• Accident and critical illness
• Pet insurance
• Identity theft
• Paid Time Off
• 12 paid holidays each year
• Paid parental leave and paid caregiver leave
• Tuition reimbursement


Should you need reasonable accommodation when completing the application form or during the selection process, contact the Human Resources Department at 763-417-1700

Information provided on this application will be kept confidential and only be shared with those involved in the selection process.

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disabled and veterans. This organization participates in E-Verify.

Click the following link to view Federal and E-Verify posters: Link

OSHA Requirements: This position requires the ability to stand or sit for long periods of time, file documents in high or low cabinets, to use the telephone and to use the computer systems.
