Lemonade is not your everyday company… and same goes for our Product team.
We’re a group of product geeks, who like thinking outside the box to deliver an amazing user experience. We love talking about pixels, we’re obsessed about data, and we’re all about getting stuff done.


We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager who’s experienced in planning, designing, and scaling products. If you thrive in solving complex problems, are driven by the potential of AI, and are dedicated to delivering outstanding customer experiences at scale, we want to hear from you.


In this role you will
• Lead the product strategy and development efforts in one of Lemonade’s main business domains, focusing on optimizing user experiences and driving product scalability.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including design, engineering, data analysis, and other stakeholders to define product goals and priorities.
• Identify opportunities for improvement and innovation, and translate them into actionable plans and prototypes.
• Drive the execution of product initiatives, ensuring alignment across other product teams within the organization
• Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives and make data-driven decisions to optimize them


What you’ll need
• At least 5 years experience working as a product manager in a successful startup / fast-growing company - a must
• Excellent leadership and personal skills
• Self-organized, process-driven
• Superior attention to detail, coupled with a keen eye for the big picture
• Capable of understanding complex processes, and identifying areas calling for improvement
• Data-driven and analytical thinker
• Outstanding communication skills, including the ability to present findings and recommendations clearly and effectively to stakeholders
• Demonstrated experience managing third-party integrations and strategic partnerships
• A passion for accumulating knowledge of your domain and sharing it with others
• Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
• Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture

TheGuarantors is a cutting edge fintech company setting the standard in rent coverage with unrivaled insurance products. With a deep understanding of owner, operator, and renter needs, we believe renters deserve better access to the home of their dreams and operators deserve greater protection and growth opportunities. That’s why we’re leveraging our expertise in real estate and using AI-based technology to help operators qualify renters faster while mitigating the risk of rental income loss. With $4B+ in rent and deposits guaranteed, we work with 9 of the country’s top 10 operators and have been named one of Inc. 5000’s fastest-growing companies, one of Forbes’ Best Startup Employers, and one of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500.

The Opportunity

The Customer Success Operations Director is a key role in the success of TheGuarantors. To be successful, you’ll need to have a customer success or revenue operations background with advanced knowledge of HubSpot and Zendesk. Reporting to the SVP of Underwriting and Customer Success, you’ll be in charge of managing the department’s tech stack to enable users and create efficiencies. If you’re a creative, yet meticulous, individual who has a proven record of implementing and managing SaaS tools to improve both customer and user experience, we would love to talk with you.

What you'll do

• Own the tech stack for Customer Success and Underwriting teams, primarily focusing on CRM and Customer Success tools: HubSpot, Zendesk, Ada, Aircall, Zapier, and Twilio 
• Build and refine automation, ticket funnels, reporting/analytics, and other system configuration
• Use technology to support internal users ability to provide an excellent customer experience, while continuously seeking to increase efficiency
• Understand end-to-end business processes and the flow of data between the various teams, and use that knowledge to inform system and processes improvements
• Scope out requirements and manage projects and timelines for each systems initiative 
• Ensure successful launches and adoption of new technology, features, and processes
• Represent the Customer Success and Underwriting teams in company-wide CRM and related systems initiatives


What You Bring

• Highly ambitious and goal-oriented
• Minimum of 4 years of experience with HubSpot, expertise in building CRM workflows required
• Proficiency in REST API design and development, JSON data handling, JavaScript programming, and integration development
• HubSpot Administrator Developer or willingness to obtain certification upon hire
• Experience working with GenAI bots strongly preferred
• Ability to build for long term, but also able to find efficient short-term means
• Analytical and data-driven 
• Ability and interest to work cross-functionally across product, engineering, finance and marketing teams


Benefits

• Opportunities to make an impact within a fast growing company
• Medical, dental, & vision insurance, beginning day one
• Health savings account with employer contribution
• Generous PTO and paid holidays
• Flexible working hours
• 401(k)
• Paid parental leave
• Company sponsored short and long term disability
• Flexible spending accounts (healthcare, dependent care, commuter)
• Competitive salary


Base Salary

The base salary range is between $160,000 - $165,000 annually.

Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, location and current market data and may vary from the range above.

Stay in Touch

Does this role not quite match your skills, but you’re still interested in what we're doing? Stay In Touch and apply to our Dream Job to be one of the first to hear about future opportunities!

TheGuarantors is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive environment for all.

We’re searching for an outstanding Director of Media Partnerships to manage our Media Partnerships channels, including price comparison sites, lead gen aggregators, content and reviews sites, and online affiliates. In this role, you’ll work closely with our Revenue organization leadership in driving our growth strategy and plans.


If you’re a seasoned performance marketing leader with experience growing B2C businesses, and you’re passionate about building strategic partnerships, this role is for you.


In this role you’ll:
• Lead a decentralized, global team of growth leads and specialists to acquire new partnerships and manage/grow existing channels, managing a P&L of over $50M+ in revenue
• Manage quarterly growth budgets and activities, working closely with your team and other Revenue growth squad leads, to achieve company growth targets
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Revenue, Product, Data Analytics, and other stakeholders to define partnership goals and priorities
• Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives and make data-driven decisions
• Spearhead new media channels and partnerships, and develop sophisticated growth strategies, owning both strategy and execution
• Build and foster strong relationships with our partners, acting as the face of the company and working with executive-level stakeholders to represent Lemonade


What you’ll need:
• 10+ years of hands-on experience in media partnership channels, preferably within a large-scale B2C operation
• At least 3 years experience managing highly efficient teams who consistent outperform expectations
• Comfortable managing a multi-million dollar P&L, and a track record of delivering results and achieving sales and budget targets
• Strong problem-solving skills; you use data to build and constantly improve your strategy
• Ability to manage complex partnerships and initiatives from conception to delivery
• Solid understanding of performance marketing strategies, business development
• Fluent in English
• Familiarity with Agile/cross-functional environments
• Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
• Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture

Job description


Accelerant is seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to derive meaningful insights from complex datasets. As a Data Analyst at Accelerant, you will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making and contribute to the success of our organization.


How will you spend your time


• Create and maintain robust data pipelines to unlock new analytical opportunities.
• Create clear and compelling visualizations (charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
• Partner with internal and external stakeholders, including actuaries, program managers, and data scientists and data engineers to identify challenges and provide data-driven insights.
• Create reports and dashboards to communicate key findings and regular monitoring of key performance indicators.
• Address data-related issues and propose solutions to improve data quality and efficiency.


Core Capabilities


Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
• 5+ years of P&C experience in a data-focused role
• Preferably experience in or supporting Actuarial roles
• Preferably experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Qlik Sense)


Skills
• Strong proficiency in programming languages such as SQL or Python.

About the role


We are looking for a Junior Analytics Engineer, who will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. You will be working closely with both our Data Analysts/Scientists and Data Engineers in order to build strong data foundations and a best-in-class platform, and will be experienced in implementing and expanding modern data workflows. Projects you might work in include:


• Contributing to build out our data model using dbt (Data Build Tool) to increase the velocity of our Analytics Team creating new core data objects and data transformations to make it easier for our Data Analysts/Scientists to query, work and understand our data.
• Implementing a data quality validation process to ensure our data platform delivers accurate insights to our business stakeholders.
• Participating in the definition and development of our ETL/ELT workflows by partnering with our Data Engineering team.


A typical day


• Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand problems-to-be-solved with our current data platform, identify solutions, and deliver high-quality data foundations to data stakeholders across the business.
• Create and own efficient and scalable core data objects and transformations that unify key data assets and streamline analytical workflows.
• Evolve our data platform using a modern data engineering stack, including data warehousing, data workflow platforms, data validation products, and other necessary technologies.
• Work with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Operations, Finance) to curate, define, and document company-wide sources of (data) truth.


What you need to succeed


• 1 - 2 years of experience in data-related positions using data to drive product growth and operational efficiency.
• Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or similar. 
• Good knowledge in SQL.
• Commitment to applying software engineering best practices in an analytics environment.
• Experience working in Agile environments with tools such as Jira or Asana.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to work with technical and non-technical partners from many teams, especially in exploring decisions and trade-offs.
• Deep interest in learning about and keeping up with quickly evolving industry trends around the modern data stack and data best practices.
• Advanced level of English


Nice to Have


• Experience with DBT (Data Build Tool)
• General knowledge of Python and Git
• General knowledge of Jinja templating in Python
• Experience with analytics and BI tools such as Looker
• Experience in data warehousing (Redshift, Snowflake)


About the recruitment process


• Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
• Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your first tech Interview! You will meet two of ours colleague from our amazing Data Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your previous experience in data as well as your knowledge of SQL and our core technological environments.
• If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... time to move on to the second technical interview! In this new interview you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your expertise in a data challenge with one of our colleagues.
• If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.


Why CoverWallet


At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure…


• 💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
• ⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our hybrid-remote work model.
• 🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
• 📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
• 🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
• 🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
• 🍏 Great office in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

About the role

As part of the Security Engineering Backend team, you will work on APIs that serve Coalition Control, our user-facing product enabling business owners to detect and mitigate cyber risk.  You will be working across multiple software development projects that can range from APIs serving the frontend and internal tools, to scraping and ETL workflows.

Responsibilities

• Be part of a remote team

• Design, develop and test backend implementations of new and existing product features, including features powered by AI

Are you a seasoned leader with a passion for delivering high-impact software solutions? If you thrive in a dynamic environment, where innovation meets collaboration, this role is for you. • We know you care about benefits and perks, so feel free to scroll down to that section, and then scroll back up to learn more about this role.




What You'll Do

• Drive Results: Oversee software implementation projects to ensure delivery on time, within scope, and on budget—meeting quality and margin targets.
• Lead Client Engagement: Build strong, long-term relationships with stakeholders by managing expectations and fostering trust.
• Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work with NLS department leaders to align projects with business goals, ensuring resource availability and allocation.
• Strategize for Success: Conduct regular executive-level checkpoints to drive satisfaction, mitigate risks, and manage escalations.
• Innovate & Improve: Champion a culture of continuous improvement by driving process enhancements and staying ahead of industry trends.
• Expand Partnerships: Partner with Sales and Solutioning teams to develop pricing and staffing models and identify opportunities for growth within existing client relationships.


What You'll Bring

• Technical Expertise: Advanced knowledge of MSP, JIRA, ADO, Microsoft Office 365, and other PM tools.
• Proven Leadership: 8+ years in project leadership within technology, with a track record of successfully managing complex software projects and schedules.
• Strategic Vision: PMP, ACP, or SAFe RTE certifications preferred, with an ability to drive change and mentor teams.
• Exceptional Communication: Strong interpersonal and client-facing skills, even under pressure.
• Adaptability & Initiative: Thrive in dynamic environments and take proactive steps to achieve goals.
• Education: Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s preferred, in Business, Computer Information Systems, Insurance and Risk Management, or related fields.




Why join NLS?

Bring your authentic self to the Next Level Solutions team! Go-getter. Learner. Team Oriented.

If this sounds like you, consider joining our team! Our culture is what makes us who we are. We work hard, but we have fun doing it! We believe that knowledge should be shared. Shared knowledge fosters our collaborative workplace culture, where our people work together towards achieving company goals. This environment promotes continuous learning and professional development.

At NLS, our mission is to “Do Good Work” for our clients, our employees, and our communities. We have experienced incredible growth and will continue this trend by investing in our most important resource: our people. If you are looking to join a fun and friendly company with a great team environment, room for advancement, and the opportunity to make a difference, we’re hiring!

The Benefits & Perks

• Competitive salary package with an annual bonus
• Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
• Flexible working arrangements
• Opportunities for internal advancement and career development
• Relaxed office environment with casual dress code
• Company sponsored activities and team building events 
• PTO & paid company holidays 
• Traditional & Roth 401k with a 5% company match
• Physical and mental wellness program


Our Awards

• 2021 SBJ Dynamic Dozen #1 Company
• 2022 SBJ Dynamic Dozen #1 Company
• 2023 SBJ Dynamic Dozen #2 Company
• 2021 417 Best Place to Work
• 2022 417 Best Place to Work
• 2023 417 Best Place to Work 
• 2022 Top COO 
• 2023 SBJ 40 Under 40 Honoree
• 2024 SBJ 40 Under 40 Honoree
• 2024 SBJ Man of the Year Honoree
• 2023 Puerto Rico Employer of Choice


Next Level Solutions is a trusted partner in digital transformation and IT services, specializing exclusively in the property and casualty (P&C) insurance market. With unparalleled agility and cost-effective scaling, we offer cutting-edge expertise to address the industry's unique challenges and opportunities. Our finely tuned solutions, from system integration to delivering new digital capabilities, leverage both onshore and nearshore capabilities for flexible, efficient, and responsive support. This ensures seamless collaboration, improved communication, and faster turnaround times, all while maintaining high quality and cost-effectiveness, setting us apart in a world teeming with generic solutions.

Who are we?

A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.

We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?

Learn more about our unique culture and history .

Job Opportunity

Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI) has an exciting opportunity for a Technical Architect who possesses extensive technical and delivery skill to support our Boston based Claims IT team. The role will aid in defining the future of our technical architecture and be integral to the solutioning and design for critical automation efforts.

Duties & Responsibilities

• Research, analyze, and provide problem resolution and coordination with other subject matter experts across the enterprise. 
• Lead the solution design and development of business requirements and technical solutions. 
• Provide feedback, coaching, mentoring for globally distributed engineers.
• Make sustainable technical and architectural decisions for your team(s) and products while ensuring high levels of quality.
• Evaluate and select appropriate software, tools and integration methods.
• Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering Leadership on the product roadmap while owning the technical portion of it.
• Navigate the ambiguity that is inherent in iterative product development.
• Actively seek ways to improve business software processes and interactions.
• Design Microservices that communicate via well-defined API’s.
• Define best coding practices, review of development team deliverables, and ensure application stays on the Upgrade Path.
• Help resolve technical problems as and when they arise.


Qualifications, Skills And Experience

• Minimum 4 to 6 years’ experience with implementation of Duck Creek Claims Product.
• Strong understanding of the Duck Creek platform application architecture.
• Experience applying software design patterns to solve real world problems.
• Object – oriented design, .NET development.
• XML/XSLT document design, JavaScript development, HTML5 & CSS.
• Hands on experience building applications in Azure, AWS or GCP.
• Architectural knowledge in building and scaling microservices base applications.
• Strong knowledge of datastores (RDBMS) and ability to make choice among available technologies based on requirements.
• Hands on experience in software development and system administration.
• Understanding of the Property & Casualty Insurance Industry is desirable.
• Ability to prioritize and handle work to critical project timelines in a dynamic environment and develop new approaches to complex design problems.


BHSI Offers

• A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammates
• A dynamic, action oriented, and thoughtful environment centered on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates and our other stakeholders
• A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasizes individual excellence in a team framework


NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization

Data Scientist with emphasis on business intelligence tools

Pay Range- $79,300.00 - $124,500.00 Salary is commensurate to experience, location, etc.

Overall Objective: To drive actionable insights and inform corporate strategies through the use of advanced modeling, data mining, analytics, and market intelligence.

Key Skills

Strong Communication: Demonstrates strong communication skills with a basic understanding of project management principles.

Data Visualization: Ability to visualize data effectively on both simple and complex levels.

Data Analysis and Machine Learning: Proficiency in leveraging data, machine learning techniques, and statistical model frameworks to identify and create business opportunities.

Technical Proficiency: Ability to work with data using query languages such as SQL, DAX, R, or Python, and understanding of relational data.

Coding Skills: Demonstrates the ability to write production-ready code in Python or R. Knowledge of generative AI for coding is a plus.

BI Tools: Familiarity with BI tools such as PowerBI is desirable.

Inquisitive Mindset: Possesses an inquisitive mindset and a desire to delve into the details.

Collaboration: Capable of both independent work and collaboration within projects.

Job Requirements

• Master’s degree or higher in data science related areas (statistics, applied economics, data science)
• 2+ years of professional analytical experience preferred
• 2+ years of P&C or Life/Retirement experience preferred


#VIZI

Horace Mann was founded in 1945 by two Springfield, Illinois, teachers who saw a need for quality, affordable auto insurance for teachers. Since then, we’ve broadened our mission to helping all educators protect what they have today and prepare for a successful tomorrow. And with our broadened mission has come corporate growth: We serve more than 4,100 school districts nationwide, we’re publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange (symbol: HMN) and we have more than $12 billion in assets.

We’re motivated by the fact that educators take care of our children’s future, and we believe they deserve someone to look after theirs. We help educators identify their financial goals and develop plans to achieve them. This includes insurance to protect what they have today and financial products to help them prepare for their future. Our tailored offerings include special rates and benefits for educators.

EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status

For applicants that are California residents, please review our California Consumer Privacy Notice

All applicants should review our Horace Mann Privacy Policy

description:
Kinsale Insurance is seeking a dynamic Solutions Architect to join our Technology team. This role will focus on interpreting complex business problems and crafting innovative technology solutions that align with our overall technology strategy. As a Solutions Architect, you will provide technical leadership across the IT department, guiding both new developments and integration of legacy systems to new solutions. You'll work closely with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., underwriting, claims) to deliver scalable and cost-effective solutions that drive our business forward.


Responsibilities:
• Assess, select, and recommend the optimal set of technologies to develop robust, business-aligned solutions. Guide teams in applying best practices and making strategic technology decisions.
• Create clear architectural artifacts that outline key decisions, design patterns, and technologies in proposed solutions. Communicate effectively with stakeholders (technical and non-technical) to articulate trade-offs, constraints, and benefits of architectural decisions.
• Lead the integration of IT systems to meet business goals, while evaluating current system architectures and collaborating with development teams to transition legacy systems to modern, cloud-native architectures.
• Develop application and platform strategies informed by business trends, technical debt, and non-functional requirements such as security, scalability, and performance. Balance new developments with legacy modernization efforts.
• Work with cross-functional teams, including product managers, business stakeholders, and developers, to translate business and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint that achieves business objectives.
• Provide technical guidance to the development teams and the Developer Community of Practice (CoP), fostering a collaborative and innovative environment. Mentor and coach other technical staff, contributing to their growth.
• Review and approve technical designs, ensuring they align with Kinsale standards, proven design patterns, and industry best practices.
• Stay current on emerging technologies, driving innovation through Proof of Concepts (POCs) and reference architectures to guide design decisions. Propose relevant changes to existing architecture to ensure continuous improvement.
• Play a key role in advancing DevOps culture, ensuring effective CI/CD practices, and helping teams automate deployments and improve operational efficiency through continuous integration and monitoring tools (e.g., CloudTrail, CloudWatch).
• Develop, document, and enforce non-functional requirements (security, scalability, usability, reliability, and performance) to ensure that solutions are secure and comply with industry standards and regulatory requirements.


Minimum Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, technology or related field preferred
• A minimum of 5 years of experience in solutions development, including significant experience with cloud-based platforms and distributed applications. Involvement in at least two successful enterprise-wide implementations is required.
• AWS Certified Developer or Solutions Architect preferred or similar certifications in other Cloud stack like Azure and GCP.
• Experience mentoring development teams and driving architecture initiatives within cross-functional teams.
• Expertise in developing solutions that leverage APIs, microservices, and cloud-native technologies. Strong understanding of container orchestration and event-driven architectures (e.g., Kafka, CQRS, event sourcing).
• Proficiency in technologies such as Java (Spring, Spring Boot, Hibernate), Angular 12+, NodeJS, JSON, AWS Cloud Technologies (EKS, ECS, S3, EC2), API Gateway (like Kong), Event driven stack using Kafka, and CICD pipelines.
• Tools: GitLab, VS Code, IntelliJ.
• Experience in the insurance, bank, financial services, or other highly regulated sectors is desired.


At Kinsale we offer the following great benefits:
• Competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunities
• Single and family health, dental, and vision insurance plans with a generous percentage of maximum HSA funds contributed by the company
• Short-term and long-term disability
• Life insurance
• Matching 401(k), fully vested from first day of contribution
• Generous paid time off and holidays
• Yearly reimbursement for educational training and development opportunities
• Promotion from within the company with clear goals and developed career paths

Where You’ll Work

Our flexible, hybrid work model offers the option to work remotely or in the office.

How You’ll Contribute

As an IT Solution Coordinator, Finance, the role will be a blend of a solution owner, production support lead and a business analyst. You will be responsible for Financial Services applications (such as SAP AP, SAP Concur, Blackline, Wdesk and SOVOS Statutory reporting, etc.), business process enhancements, incident management and reporting. This role will ensure requirements, maintenance and change requests are delivered on-time and on budget. In this role, you will be responsible for vendor management and partner management, escalating tickets with vendor for resolution, and partnering with internal partners such as the BSA team, testing team, technical teams, production support teams and architecture.

In This Role, You’ll Get To

• Maintain close partnerships with architecture, finance business partners, testing, BSA teams and production support teams
• Demonstrate a working knowledge of the technologies supported and how they map to business capabilities and processes
• Partner with applications managed support teams on any critical production tickets. Determine and documents program and project scope and deliverables based on documentation and requirements supplied by business partners
• Communicate with assigned resources to ensure on-time completion of planned tasks
• Resolve production issues through direct action or escalation when appropriate
• Provide regular status report deliverables
• Review release notes for SaaS applications and determine appropriate actions to be taken


We’re Looking For People Who Have

• 7 plus years of combined IT Project Management and Business Systems Analyst experience 
• Excellent communications skills, ability to resolve conflicts and solve problems
• Self-driven motivation to understand, identify, resolve and recommend options to solve complex business issues with technology solutions
• General knowledge of ServiceNOW, JIRA, SAP FSCD, SAP AP, SAP Concur, Blackline, Statestreet, Webi Reporting, Business Process Tracking/Documentation, and Data Governance is a plus
• Software development methodology experience (agile and/or waterfall)
• Advanced management of requirement development, testing approach and planning skill and tool set to support SaaS based solution execution
• Developed understanding of enterprise technical landscape
• Passion for innovation and dedication to enterprise technology development and maintenance objectives
• Proven track record driving and delivering successful technology solutions, while being flexible team player


Research shows some people may not apply for a role if they don’t check all the boxes of a job description. If you don’t check every box listed, that’s okay. We would love to hear from you.

What You’ll Receive

• Compensation – Base salary ranging from $100,000 - $115,000 plus competitive performance-based incentives determined by company and individual results.
• Flexible Work Environment – Work remotely or in the office to better thrive in all areas of life.
• Paid Time Off – Recharge with a minimum of 20 days of paid time off and 16 paid company holidays per calendar year plus paid volunteer time and paid study time.
• Financial Health – Work toward achieving your financial goals through our 401(k) savings plan with company match (up to 6%) and annual company nondiscretionary contribution (3%), 15% employee stock purchase plan discount, and financial counseling services.
• Health and Wellness – Enjoy competitive medical, vision, and dental plans plus tax-free health savings accounts with potential company contributions up to $1,000 per family.
• Family Support – Care for loved ones with up to 16 weeks of paid leave for new parents, back-up dependent care, dependent care flexible spending account, and up to a $25,000 lifetime maximum during your adoption, infertility, or surrogacy journey.
• Life and Disability Support – Gain access to company-paid basic life insurance and short-term disability insurance.


The company and your department may occasionally gather in person throughout the year to foster a culture of belonging and promote team building. We’d love for you to join us during those company-wide and department-wide events to help you strengthen connections across the company.

Why join us?

Brighthouse Financial is on a mission to help people achieve financial security. Our company is one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the U.S.,* and we specialize in products designed to help people protect what they’ve earned and ensure it lasts.

We empower employees to collaborate, bring their passion to work, and make an impact. Our inclusive work environment fosters a culture that celebrates diverse backgrounds and experiences. You can find out more about our company culture by visiting brighthousefinancial.com/about-us/careers/.

We’re proud to be one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the U.S.* and recognized as one of the Healthiest Employers of Greater Charlotte by the Charlotte Business Journal. We’re also honored to be named to Newsweek’s list of Most Trustworthy Companies in America.

• Ranked by 2022 admitted assets. Best’s Review®: Top 200 U.S. Life/Health Insurers. AM Best, 2023.

description:
What We Look For

Our exceptional and motivated employees are our greatest strength. Our employees provide the highest level of customer service and help maintain our position as a leader in the global marketplace.

Markel Style

The Markel Style is what makes us stand out from our competitors. It's our core value which should underpin how we do business, while influencing our behavior and performance. We are looking for people who have potential and share our passion to live the Markel Style, which is described in more detail below.

If you think you have these core attributes we want to hear from you.

Job Summary

The Infrastructure Engineer provides expertise in supporting one or more products or services while pro-actively monitoring, controlling and supporting service operations; working to achieve service levels. Maintains the organization's IT infrastructure, which may include hardware, software, servers, storage solutions, networks, or physical facilities.

Essential Functions

• At least 5 years of system or network administration in a production 24x7 environment.
• Responsible for monitoring and administering a multi-server UNIX/Informix Dynamic Server database environment.
• Assist in administering a heavily virtualized multi-server Windows and UNIX network, including VPN connectivity, Internet/Web connectivity, Exchange email, back-ups, security, and user administration.
• Monitor and regularly report status of network components and performance.
• Assist in the analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of network expansion, configuration, and performance issues.
• Assist in the planning, evaluation, configuration, and installation of servers and related equipment and software.
• Responsible for the configuration and monitoring of all networking equipment in the Home office and DR facilities.


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

• Good interpersonal and written/verbal communications skills
• Strong attention to detail
• Conscientious
• Ability to take responsibility for action and outcomes
• Ability to stay informed of current industry trends and learn new concepts
• Good problem solving skills
• Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher level knowledge and skills
• Builds knowledge of the organization, processes and customers
• Solves a range of straightforward problems
• Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures
• Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction


Education/Experience

• College degree preferred, high school diploma required.
• Strong Understanding of HP UNIX and SUSE LINUX server configuration and tuning.
• Good Understanding of IBM’s Informix Dynamic Server configuration and tuning.
• Working knowledge and training in networking, computer hardware, Internet, Client/Server and computer operating systems
• Cisco router, Cisco switch configuration and management
• Internet / Intranet /Extranet security
• Web application management and user access control
• TCP/IP, VPN, and routing principles
• At least 5 years of experience administering Unix Networks and hardware (preferably HP Unix)
• Experience with Azure Stack HCI Clusters and Windows Admin Center a plus
• Experience with SCCM, SCOM, CommVault, or PaloAlto a plus.
• Experience opening priority incidents with external vendors and driving to resolution required.
• Experience working with Cloud technologies, including Azure a plus.
• Familiarity with PowerShell or scripting technologies and automation capabilities.
• Good Working knowledge of IBM Informix Dynamic Server.
• Some MCSE certifications preferred (Windows, MS Exchange, and SQL Server)
• Other certifications preferred


Please note:  Markel's phased approach for re-entry into our buildings is designed to balance the ongoing health, safety, and well-being of our employees with operational considerations and regulatory/governmental requirements and recommendations. As a result, we implemented a hybrid return to work strategy that allows for three days in the office every week.

The base salary offered for the successful candidate will be based on compensable factors such as job-relevant education, job-relevant experience, training, licensure, demonstrated competencies, geographic location, and other factors.

Choose Markel

Innovative hybrid work model * A diversity and inclusion focused employer * Exceptional base salary and bonus structure * Comprehensive benefits which include PTO, medical, dental, vision, 401K and more * Growth opportunities to advance your career* Ongoing coaching and career development * Fast paced, dedication environment *Profitable Fortune 300 company in business since 1930.

Must be authorized to work in the U.S., and not require sponsorship now or in the future

“Why work for us?”

Diversity and inclusion

Markel is truly a global and diverse company. We believe that diversity makes us better business partners and that embracing people’s differences can bring amazing results and fuel innovation. We have a portfolio of businesses and product lines that operate around the world.

Community involvement

Markel has a rich heritage of supporting communities across the world where our customers and employees live and work. Giving back is part of our history and our future. Our employees share in this philosophy through volunteering, mentoring and fundraising.

Commitment to open doors

Markel is committed to creating the best work environment. Our open-door policy is essential in recognizing business issues as they rise and to address the changing needs of our diverse and global workforce. Challenging management is a component of the Markel Style—some of our best ideas start from a conversation between a manager and an employee.

Entrepreneurial spirit

As the Markel Style states, we pursue excellence, strive for a better way, and share the success of others. Markel associates proactively seek new business opportunities, bringing further success to Markel.

MSIG North America continues to grow!

The Domain Architect will be providing strategy and solution guidance and expertise to the programs and projects supporting Underwriting business domain, while paying attention to how these initiatives interact with those of other areas of the business. The Domain lead will also oversee the delivery of new operational capabilities for business functions within the underwriting business domain to ensure the proposed value of the capability is achieved.

Essential Functions

• Understand the current state across all legal entities and the future growth prospects to capture critical views of the full enterprise required to define business operation patterns and capability maps.
• Create and maintain a business architecture strategy that incorporates multiple business scenarios and potential focus areas that can be used to inform multi-year capability roadmaps across IT, digital, data and business teams.
• Capture and refine business goals and key objectives to develop and map key results and metrics to tactical and strategic initiatives
• Develop value stream playbooks for large functions that entail strategy, planning and execution of projects at scale.
• Develop financials models and execution roadmap, accounting for all moving parts in the organization for new and enhanced business functions and capabilities.
• Understand the current operating models and relationships (functions, roles, capabilities, processes, data) within and between business units
• Develop actionable design, patterns and strategy documents in partnership with business and IT stakeholders.
• Evaluate existing processes using interviews, workshops, document analysis, surveys, user scenarios, process maps, task and workflow analysis.
• Analyze data for trends and recommend possible improvements/solutions.
• Perform competitive analysis to understand opportunities within the marketplace and advise business stakeholders and strategy teams on potential areas of investment
• Identify strengths and areas for process improvement, establishing links between business strategies and improvement initiatives.
• Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional teams and external vendors.
• Provide leadership and expertise throughout the design and improvement of processes and operating models.
• Meet with business and technical leaders to identify and scope opportunities, outline potential value and ROI, and identify risks and constraints.
• Act as mentor or coach to business stakeholders by providing training and guidance.
• Work closely with product management and product owners (IT, digital, and data); direct the work of cross-functional teams; and collaborate with assigned solution architects and project managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, and timing for new initiatives.
• Participate and provide guidance in project execution and process improvement projects and ensure solutions are achieved on time, on budget and within scope with the expected value to the business.
• Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Experience And Education Required

• Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, information system, systems analysis or related field preferred.
• Prefer 10+ years of experience in underwriting; documenting and defining value streams, business capabilities, master data, personas, applications, and key data flows.
• Prefer 6+ years of experience in business analyst, business architecture, or solution architecture roles for property and casualty insurance or a similar domain.
• Strong knowledge of business process modeling, workflow automation, integration patterns, and data transformation techniques.
• Strong technical skills around vendor product selection, software and technology analysis, business analytics, and convergence of cross-business functions.
• Prefer Expertise in one or more of the TOGAF (or equivalent framework) architectural domains in business, application, data, technology.
• Experience in architectural support of Agile delivery framework and digital product lifecycle.
• Experience using various tools and techniques (e.g. UML) for modeling business processes
• Excellent communication, collaboration, problem-solving, and analytical skills.


It's an exciting time for our company and a great opportunity to join a financially sound and growing global insurance group!

It is the policy of MSIG-NA to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, MSIG-NA will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

About The Job

• Renegade is disrupting the $1.3tn insurance industry by fundamentally reimagining insurance distribution. We are a Series B start-up backed by Insight, Left Lane, NFX and HSCM and the founders of Tinder, Betterment, Acorns, Thumbtack.
• As we continue to grow, we need a keen, proactive individual to join the Founder's Office with the ability to manage multiple cross-functional projects from end to end.
• Are you a results-driven marketer with a passion for scaling lead generation campaigns? Do you have a proven track record of running high-impact Facebook and Google Ads tailored to US audiences?


What We're Looking For

• 2+ years of performance marketing experience In founder Office, with a proven ability to deliver results.
• Expertise in Facebook and Meta Ads, specifically targeting US audiences.
• Strong knowledge of Google Ads and SEO optimization.
• A creative and data-driven approach to lead generation and campaign optimization.
• Ability to analyze performance metrics and translate insights into actionable strategies.


 Why Join Renegade Insurance?

• Fully remote, work-from-home opportunity.
• Flexible hours: 1:00 PM to 11:00 PM IST.
• Be part of a fast-paced, high-growth environment where your work has a real impact.
• Collaborate with a team of ambitious professionals reimagining the insurance industry.


If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, driving results and learning new skills, we'd love to hear from you!

(ref:updazz.com)

At American Equity Investment Life Holding Company®we offer leading annuity products that help empower our clients to fulfill their needs and wants in retirement. Our success comes from hiring high-energy individuals who embody the beliefs that drive our unique culture. We currently fund over half a million retirements nationwide, and have been headquartered in West Des Moines, Iowa, for over twenty-five years with satellite offices in Charlotte, NC and New York, NY.

General Purpose Of The Job

The Data Engineer I designs, develops, tests, implements, troubleshoots, optimizes and maintains enterprise level data pipelines that implement complex processes, which reference a targeted centralized data warehouse and source systems. The incumbent analyzes data transformation requirements leveraged to build, refine, deploy and/or configure data pipeline architecture patterns that maximize reuse and minimize change impact. The data engineer I utilizes SQL, tools, and/or technology to implement robust, maintainable solutions that meet business and technical requirements.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

• Obtains knowledge around the Amazon Web Service (AWS) tooling, mapping design, architectural design, coding, implementation, performance tuning and debugging.
• Develops data extracts, applications and ad-hoc queries using tools\languages deemed necessary.
• Obtains a strong understanding of data pipeline design principles required in building an enterprise data warehouse environment and/or app-to-app pipelining.
• Creates SQL queries required to access tabular structures in a Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS).
• Transforms functional specifications into data pipeline technical specifications and source to target mappings.
• Communicates effectively with Business Analysts, Data Modelers and Solution Architects to convert the pipeline design into specific development activities.
• Documents data pipeline processes thoroughly, including steps needed to migrate pipeline and/or database objects between various environments including Development, UAT, and Production.
• Performs unit and integration testing activities and assists in user acceptance testing as needed.
• Works with a mentor to further knowledge of data management and pipelining principles.
• Performs other related work as assigned.


Supervisory Responsibilities

Direct Reports: None

General Description of Indirect Reports (2 and 3-downs): None

Education And/Or Experience

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Mathematics, Information Management, or related field of study; or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

• General knowledge of ETL and data movement.
• Knowledge of basic data transformations and how to implement them in a hybrid cloud environment.
• Basic understanding of SQL Scripting and/or another programming language.
• Base knowledge of RDBMS and data warehouse tools including SQL Server and Snowflake.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to work with various data frameworks.
• Strong customer service orientation.
• Effective verbal and written communication skills.
• Mathematical skills and strong attention to detail.
• Ability to work cooperatively and successfully with employees, customers, and other outside third parties.
• Strong organizational and planning skills.
• Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
• Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions.
• Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
• Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
• Ability to successfully handle pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.

Kin is on a mission to change home insurance from what it is to what it should be. Whether we’re leveraging data to create customizable coverage or providing claims service that goes above and beyond expectations, our members are at the heart of everything we do. In the face of ever-growing climate risk, they deserve an insurance company that cares about them. We aim to stick with our members through thick and thin.

We Use Efficient Technology That Lets Homeowners Buy Directly From Us To Keep Costs Down. This Is The Essence Of Kin. Our Approach Has Fostered Amazing Growth, Attracted Marquee Investors, And Earned Us Accolades, Including Being Named To

• Built In Chicago's Best Places to Work, Midsize Companies (2021-2024).
• Forbes' America's Best Startup Employers (2021- 2023).
• Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies.
• Forbes’ Fintech 50.


Simply put, our people are what make us great – we need forward-thinking, inspired game-changers like you to join us in our mission.

So, what’s the role?

We are looking for an Insurance Systems Administrator to join Kin’s Insurance Operations team. In this role, you will be the primary system administrator for our Claims Management System. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with other cross-functional teams that support our Claims Organization, making our operations more efficient. This includes mapping out procedures to identify areas of improvement, building reports for leadership, and responding to ad hoc research requests. You’ll advocate for end-users by effectively communicating system needs and gaps with vendors to drive prioritized feature enhancements.

Here, you will get to be part of a dynamic, data-driven team while bringing your problem-solving skills to the table. Additionally, you will have the chance to collaborate with internal stakeholders to help improve our processes moving forward and be a crucial part of the team. To be successful in this role, it is crucial that you are a fast learner willing to work hard to understand a variety of systems and departments.

A Day In The Life Could Include

• Assist the Insurance Operations Leads with strategic initiatives
• Administer the Claims Management System-build workflows and create business rules to align with claims best practices and regulatory requirements
• System monitoring and troubleshooting by identifying, diagnosing, and resolving technical issues
• Manage and escalate system issues with internal and external partners
• Map out a current process to see what needs to change when we enter a new market
• Dig into data to investigate a worrying or exciting trend in adjuster performance
• Build and maintain reports used by management
• Write, interpret, and translate business requirements into actionable system specifications, ensuring alignment between technical solutions and business objectives
• Complete discovery and provide analysis on new tooling 
• Regularly assess and adjust system configurations to align with and support the evolving needs of the business
• Write recommendations on process improvements and change management and present to senior leadership
• Lead and perform testing of system configurations, updates, and enhancements, ensuring seamless functionality and identifying any issues before implementation


I’ve got the skills… but do I have the necessary ones?

• In-depth knowledge of maintaining and administering core business systems (CRM, CMS, ERP)
• 1-3 years of experience in a related field such as operations, data analysis, or business administration. Experience in insurance or other highly regulated industries is a plus.
• Able to solve basic small business problems on their own, and solve large problems with guidance.
• Participates and initiates strategic planning and documentation with more senior team members.
• Demonstrated ability to understand business processes, analyze data, and identify areas for improvement.
• Proven track record of collaborating across multiple teams and departments to drive business outcomes.
• Ability to manage relationships with various stakeholders (e.g., claims, data, leadership) and balance conflicting priorities.
• Experience leading or participating in cross-functional projects, ensuring clear communication, role alignment, and timely execution.
• Advanced analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with high attention to detail and accuracy.
• Experience using data to identify trends, make recommendations, and influence strategic decisions.
• Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems, develop efficient processes, and create actionable insights from data.
• Proficiency with data tools such as Excel, SQL, or business intelligence software is highly desirable.
• Highly organized and motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Bonus Points

• SQL proficiency 
• Insurance experience


Oh, and don’t worry, we’ve got you covered.

• Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance
• Flexible PTO policy 
• Remote work
• Generous equity package
• 401K with 4% company match
• Parental leave
• Continuing education and professional development
• The excitement of joining a high-growth Insurtech company and seeing your work make an impact


For Sales Agents and Customer Service Agents: These roles sit in any of the following 30 states: AL, AZ, CO, FL, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, NE, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, and WI.

For all other positions, these roles can sit in any of the following 40 states: AL, AR, AZ, CA (exempt only), CO, CT, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, MA, ME, MD, MI, MN, MO, MT, NC, NE, NJ, NM, NV, NY, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, and WI. Please only apply if you are able to live and work full-time in one of the states listed above.

State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.

About Kin

Kin is the only pure-play, direct-to-consumer digital insurer focused on the growing home insurance market. We make policies convenient and affordable through a technology platform that delivers a seamless user experience, customized options for coverage, and fast, high-quality claims service. Kin is a fully licensed carrier that offers coverage through its reciprocal exchanges which are owned by its policyholders. To learn more, visit www.kin.com.

EEOC Statement

Kin is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We don't just accept difference – we honor it, nurture it, and celebrate it. We don’t discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Job Description

We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer who is ready to work with new technologies and architectures in a forward-thinking organization. Here, you will lead a small team and take complete, end-to-end ownership of projects across the entire stack. Our ideal candidate has experience building products across the stack and a firm understanding of web frameworks, APIs, databases, and multiple back end languages. You’ll be joining a small team working at the forefront of new technology, solving the challenges that impact both the front end and back end architecture, and ultimately, deliver amazing global user experiences.

Responsibilities

• Work across the fullstack, building highly scalable distributed solutions that enable positive user experiences and measurable business growth
• Writing reusable, testable,and efficient front-end and back-end code
• Write unit, functional and API test cases
• Develop scalable clientand server-side solutions
• Design and implementeffective API endpoints for data accessand manipulation
• Work with relational databases and schema-less data solutions
• Implementationof security and data protection measures
• Contribute to deployment automation, containerization
• Participate in all aspects of agile softwaredevelopment including design,implementation, and deployment
• Work primarily in SQL, .NET Core, C#, React, and JavaScript
• Support and work with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment


Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science,information technology, or engineering
• 7+ years of experience building large-scale software applications
• Strong understanding of Object-oriented programing
• Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technicalrequirements
• Experience with software development using DevOps
• Experience designing and integrating RESTful APIs
• Experience with developing on AWS or Azure cloud environments
• Familiarity with Docker & Kubernetes
• Familiarity with buildingapplications in an event driven architecture
• Understandingof fundamental designprinciples behind a scalable application
• End to end ownership with excellent analytical and communication skills


#wsp

Equal Opportunity Employer

 Westfield celebrates diversity and is committed to inclusion. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Why you should join our At-Bay Security team:

At-Bay is a fast-growth InsurSec company (Insurance x Cybersecurity) on a mission to bring innovative products to the market that help protect small businesses from digital risks. As an InsurSec provider, we uniquely combine insurance with mission-critical security technologies, threat intelligence, and human expertise, to bridge the critical security capability gap that exists among SMBs in the community. We believe InsurSec is an $80B market opportunity and we are excited to expand our DFIR team in order to help expand our reach and influence in the business and security community, of which we serve 35,000 customers.

With At-Bay, our customers experience 5X fewer ransomware attacks. This is just the tip of the iceberg! Click here to learn more about what we're building.

The Role:

• Cybersecurity Analysts focused on Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) deliver incident investigation and response services to At-Bay insureds via:
• Forensically sound collection, transmission, and storage of digital evidence
• Analysis of digital evidence to identify indicators of compromise and adversary activity
• Development of incident timelines and theories of compromise
• Identification of incident root causes
• Participation in threat actor negotiations as necessary (e.g., ransom negotiations, etc.)
• Participation in incident recovery (e.g., restoration of data from backups, reimaging workstations and servers, rebuilding network infrastructure, etc.) activities as necessary
• Development and delivery of incident reports to document key incident details for engagement stakeholders including executive leaders for insureds, breach coach attorneys, and At-Bay claims management staff as necessary
• Development and delivery of recommendations to mitigate the risk of future incidents for impacted insureds
• Development and delivery of incident response training and simulations for targeted insureds

Key skills:

• Previous digital forensics and incident response experience
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Previous hands-on experience performing digital forensics and incident response, including several of the following:
• Business Email Compromise
• Ransomware
• Digital evidence collection and analysis
• Development and analysis of cyber threat intelligence
• Leadership of or participation in investigations involving digital evidence
• Intrusion detection / cyber threat hunting
• Malware analysis
• Incident recovery activities such as restoration of data from backups, operation of decryptor tools, etc. 
• Previous hands-on experience working in information technology operations (e.g., Network Operations Center, Security Operations Center, Incident Response Team, etc.)


Minimum requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• Minimum of 2 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, incident response, incident recovery, or another security discipline
• Willingness to travel as needed to perform job functions


Preferred requirements:

• Significant undergraduate or graduate coursework in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, or cybersecurity
• Previous background in law enforcement or government/military with experience leading complex technical investigations
• Knowledge of cloud environments, including knowledge of cloud security products and services offered by major cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google)
• Experience in a top-10 cyber consulting firm or leading DFIR provider preferred
• One or more industry cybersecurity certifications (e.g., GCIH, Security+, CISSP, etc.)


Work location:

• USA, Nationwide


Our estimated base pay range for this role is $80,000-$130,000 per year. Base salary is determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to market data, location, internal equitability, domain knowledge, experiences and skills. In general, if the position sparks your interest we encourage you to apply - our team prioritizes talent.

Candidates hired for remote positions must reside in Oregon, Washington, Utah, Idaho, Arizona, Nevada, Texas, Montana, or Wisconsin.

 Job Title

IS Business Intelligence Analyst II

 Exemption Status

Exempt

 Department

Business Intelligence

 Manager Title

IS Business Intelligence Supervisor

 Direct Reports

n/a

 Requisition #

24618

Pay & Benefits

Estimated hiring range $88,430 - $108,080 / year, 5% bonus target, full benefits.

 Posting Notes

This is a fully remote position, but you must reside in one of the listed 9 states.

Summary

  Job Summary 

This position is responsible for curating data and producing data products from health outcomes, quality of care, operational data, financial information analysis, and/or health care utilization studies by designing and creating state of the art enterprise Tableau dashboards and by automating data pipelines and analysis methods. The core function of this position is to build robust data products for analytical consumption to support actionable decision making by end users and reduce the need for ad-hoc analysis requests. The position collaborates closely with subject matter experts to gather requirements from users, design solutions, and use Tableau and automation skills to develop, test, and deploy data products. In addition, the position is a leader when needed to identify new development and analyst tools to self-learn, build governance processes, implement, and then support other analysts on company use and adoption.

Responsibilities

  Essential Responsibilities 

• Collaborate with subject matter experts to identify opportunities for building repeatable data products. 
• Gather requirements and design solutions. 
• Expertly utilize visualization tools such as Tableau to build dashboards compliant with design standards. 
• Build enterprise external facing dashboards with row level security applied. 
• Expertly utilize SQL skills for identifying and shaping data for developing solutions. 
• Utilize automation and general programming skills to automate data pipelines and handsfree operations of data products. 
• Understand and codify algorithms and models developed by Healthcare Analysts. 
• As appropriate, create new algorithms and analysis models and codify them. 
• Prepare reports, graphs, tables, and other summarizations that are complete, thorough, and easily understood by those receiving and/or reviewing the information. 
• Create user and testing documentation for data products. 
• Create and maintain technical documentation such as data dictionaries, business glossaries, metric definitions, and other data resources. 
• Update and maintain legacy reporting assets developed in SQL Server Reporting Server as needed. 
• Provide follow-up support for end users after training. 
• Effectively collaborate with other teams within the organization to develop strong data pipelines and reusable data products. 
• Remain current with technology and the latest analytical methods; continually learn new skills. 
• Contribute and actively participate in community of practice and other related analytic committees and workgroups to improve skills and capabilities of all analysts at CareOregon. 
• Participate in code reviews and other activities to ensure the high standard of quality is maintained. 
• Work towards becoming a subject matter expert in CareOregon analytic tools and applications to provide testing and support for our analytic community.


  Organizational Responsibilities 

• Perform work in alignment with the organization’s mission, vision and values. 
• Support the organization’s commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion by fostering a culture of open mindedness, cultural awareness, compassion and respect for all individuals. 
• Strive to meet annual business goals in support of the organization’s strategic goals. 
• Adhere to the organization’s policies, procedures and other relevant compliance needs. 
• Perform other duties as needed.


Required

 Experience and/or Education

• Minimum 3 years’ business intelligence experience that includes some or all of the following: 
• Use of analytical techniques including segmentation and data mining 
• Creating Tableau dashboards 
• SQL object development and automation 
• Creating reports using SSRS and/or Power BI 
• Engaging both technical and non-technical stakeholders


 Note:  Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data analytics, or related technical areas may be acceptable in lieu of 1 year experience

Preferred

• Experience in planning, implementing, and summarizing complex analyses and reporting projects 
• Experience with Snowflake 
• Experience with Databricks 
• Experience with statistical software packages, such as Python, R or SAS 
• Experience in the healthcare or health insurance industry 
• Experience creating Dashboards 
• Experience with Claims 
• Experience with Enrollment


 Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required

Knowledge

• Understanding of data warehousing, reporting automation and data visualization 
• Expert understanding of Tableau Desktop/Creator products and SQL 
• Knowledge of agile development processes 
• Knowledge of Managed Care preferred 
• Knowledge of Medicaid and/or Medicare programs preferred 
• Knowledge of financial matters in the health care industry preferred 
• Knowledge of medical and/or pharmacy claims preferred


Skills And Abilities

• Ability to provide leadership and oversight of research and analytical projects preferred 
• Ability to independently gather, compile and analyze data using statistical methods 
• Skill in developing high quality data visualizations 
• Skill in developing data products 
• Skill in automation of analysis tasks using general purpose programming language such as Python, PowerShell, etc. 
• Skill in shaping data for analysis purposes 
• Ability to follow standards for data architecture and database design 
• Strong spoken, written and listening communication skills 
• Excellent customer service skills 
• Ability to clearly articulate policies and instructions. 
• Ability to convey appropriate level of detail effectively to all levels of the organization including non-technical staff 
• Strong critical thinking skills 
• Possess a high degree of initiative and motivation 
• Ability to manage multiple tasks 
• Ability to effectively collaborate with coworkers, staff, and leaders across all departments 
• Ability to work effectively with diverse individuals and groups 
• Ability to learn, focus, understand, and evaluate information and determine appropriate actions 
• Ability to accept direction and feedback, as well as tolerate and manage stress 
• Ability to see, read, and perform repetitive finger and wrist movement for at least 6 hours/day 
• Ability to hear and speak clearly for at least 3-6 hours/day


 Working Conditions

Work Enviornment(s): ☒ Indoor/Office ☐ Community ☐ Facilities/Security ☐ Outdoor Exposure

Member/Patient Facing: ☒ No ☐ Telephonic ☐ In Person

Hazards: May include, but not limited to, physical and ergonomic hazards.

Equipment: General office equipment

Travel: May include occasional required or optional travel outside of the workplace; the employee’s personal vehicle, local transit or other means of transportation may be used.
