There’s never been a better time to join NJM! With a nationally ranked reputation for outstanding customer service and a history that spans more than a century, NJM is a leading provider of worker’s compensation, automobile and homeowners insurance in New Jersey It is an exciting time to join NJM as we are expanding our Commercial and Personal Lines products into other states.

Become a member of our team and you’ll be part of company who operates for the sole benefit of its policyholders and is committed to maintaining the highest levels of service. Team members are offered a competitive compensation package and benefits including: a 401k plan, health coverage, a generous paid time off plan, and much more!

The Senior Commercial Lines Product Management Analyst (Business Insights Analyst Senior is the official NJM Title ) supports the development and management of NJM’s Commercial Lines products to align with growth and profitability objectives. Assess operational, product and/or customer performance across segments and translate the data into meaningful information and provide insights to management. Individuals require commercial lines P&C insurance company experience and related role knowledge. Will need to effectively manage multiple projects with a high degree of confidence, independence, and sound judgment.

This is a hybrid role requiring the ability to work at home and in the West Trenton office.

Job Responsibilities

• Proactive product monitoring and evaluation of results relative to business objectives, recommending strategies based on findings
• Collection and use of quantitative and qualitative data to develop intelligent product, pricing, marketing, customer, and process-oriented insights in support of department strategies and goals
• Develop clear and concise narrative regarding findings and recommendations
• Scan the market to understand key trends impacting markets, customers, products, services and operational processes
• Evaluate competitive landscape to ensure sustainability of existing products and potential new products
• Maintain awareness of regulatory and compliance issues related to our marketplace
• Leads strategic projects in support of product management and assists in preparing presentations for business leaders
• Review financial results with business leaders, providing insights into results relative to expectations.


Required Qualifications And Experience

• Familiarity in data science tools and available systems (SQL, SAS, PowerBI or similar, Office suite) is a plus.
• Commercial lines product management and Industry related experience is strongly preferred
• Demonstrated commercial lines product knowledge, focusing on Workers Compensation is strongly preferred
• Creative problem-solving ability
• Operates with sense of urgency in addressing assigned requests
• Advanced knowledge of strategic and business key performance indicators (KPIs)
• Strong analytical skills, with proven ability to translate data into meaningful information
• Ability to produce accurate analyses/reports to answer complex questions
• Analytical and problem-solving skills
• Proficient knowledge of business analysis techniques
• Proven ability to distill complex information into concise and impactful messages
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment
• Strong communication and presentation skills (written and verbal)
• Ability to manage multiple projects and address assigned requests in a timely manner
• Thorough knowledge of data collection and the relationship of data elements to each other
• Self-starter and time manager, ability to prioritize workload and meet deadlines
• Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
• Flexible and positive attitude with respect to work assignments and changing priorities
• Integrity in managing confidential and sensitive internal information


The Salary range for this role is $95,518 - $121,687. Compensation is commensurate with experience and credentials.

Legal Disclaimer: NJM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to attracting, retaining and promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is fully representative of the diversity that exists in the communities in which we do business.

metadata.title: Commercial Lines Senior Product Management Analyst

description:
NJM Insurance is hiring a Product Management Analyst (also known as a Business Insights Analyst, Associate) in our Product Management department. This role will work with various levels of management to support the development of a data-driven culture by empowering users through the use of data and analytics to drive business decisions by continuously monitoring and analyzing key performance metrics to ensure targets and goals are being met. The candidate will participate in a range of analytical and data analysis activities which will enhance departmental understanding of profit, growth, retention, and operational results of assigned states, leading to sustained long term profitable growth and maintaining the highest levels of service to our customers.

Job Responsibilities

• Review and report on market share and activities of competitors within assigned states.
• Provide insights and trends in the marketplace.
• Generate regular reporting on key performance indicators.
• Leads strategic projects in support of product management and assists in preparing presentations for business leaders.
• Develop competitive models and analysis utilizing data and analytical skills resulting in dashboard and ad hoc reports.
• Compiles, cleans, organizes, and analyzes complex data to understand and communicate business results.
• Conduct presentations as required.
• Review financial results with business leaders, providing insights into results relative to expectations.
• Performs other duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications And Experience

• Familiarity in data science tools and available systems (SQL, SAS, PowerBi or similar, Office suite) is a plus.
• Bachelor’s degree required in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Business, Economics, or related field.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
• High level of intellectual curiosity
• Ability to drive strategic direction and take initiative.
• Effective communicator (verbal and written)
• Demonstrated innovative thinking.
• Strong attention to detail
• The desire to work collaboratively in a team environment.


Legal Disclaimer: NJM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to attracting, retaining and promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce that is fully representative of the diversity that exists in the communities in which we do business.

Location: Hybrid Work Model - Van Wert, OH or Dublin, OH

At Central, we believe an internship should be more than completing busy work. We invest in our interns to give them the opportunities needed to grow, nurture and develop their whole self. Why? Because we believe excellence is gained from experience.

Central’s internship program is customized to each internship placement. The program provides members with dedicated time to gain first-hand experience while solving unique business problems. It’s strategically designed to provide diverse exposures throughout the organization, to allow you to learn from our experts and collaborate with teams that do incredible work.

Each internship will be different; however, at its core, the program consists of the following opportunities:

• Immersive experiences in challenging and meaningful work with built-in continuous learning opportunities
• Direct impact on work that matters and opportunities to affect successful outcomes and drive corporate objectives
• Gain the skills and knowledge to become a future trailblazer
• Build a lasting professional network through events and activities



Data Science Intern

• Apply statistical and analytics techniques to charter a project from start to finish
• Generate and validate SQL queries to pull together disparate data for hypothesis testing
• Perform exploratory data analysis to unlock patterns and promote discovery
• Move from EDA to modeling with the capability to generate predictions
• Leverage best practices in data visualization to communicate findings and distribute learnings throughout the organization through data story-telling



Ready to dive in? Ideal candidates for this program are:

• Naturally curious and ask a lot of questions
• Interest in learning the ins-and-outs of the insurance industry
• Capable of coding in either R or Python
• Knowledge and experience building standard predictive modeling techniques including: linear and non-linear models, regression analyses, machine learning methods (decision trees, XG Boosted trees, neural networks, cluster analysis (KNN), feature selection, etc.), forecasting, time series analysis, survival analysis, and causal impact analyses
• Capable of writing SQL queries to generate datasets
• M.S. or PhD Students in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or a similarly related field desired



Next Steps

• Accepting Applications through December 2024
• Interviews and Offers Extended through January 2025



Effective Work Dates run from May 2025 through August 2025 (summer break).

Work Authorization

Central will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Central that all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, job classification and assignment, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment and all other terms and conditions of employment shall be maintained in a manner which will not discriminate against any person because of race, color, age, sex, national origin, ancestry, religion, marital status, military status, or disability. The applicant should respond to questions on this application in a way that will not divulge such information.

Location: Hybrid Work Model - Van Wert, OH or Dublin, OH

Central’s internship program is customized to each internship placement. The program provides members with dedicated time to gain first-hand experience while solving unique business problems. It’s strategically designed to provide diverse exposures throughout the organization, to allow you to learn from our experts and collaborate with teams that do incredible work.

Each internship will be different; however, at its core, the program consists of the following opportunities:

• Immersive experiences in challenging and meaningful work with built-in continuous learning opportunities
• Direct impact on work that matters and opportunities to affect successful outcomes and drive corporate objectives
• Gain the skills and knowledge to become a future trailblazer
• Build a lasting professional network through events and activities



Data Science Intern

• Apply statistical and analytics techniques to charter a project from start to finish
• Generate and validate SQL queries to pull together disparate data for hypothesis testing
• Perform exploratory data analysis to unlock patterns and promote discovery
• Move from EDA to modeling with the capability to generate predictions
• Leverage best practices in data visualization to communicate findings and distribute learnings throughout the organization through data story-telling



Ready to dive in? Ideal candidates for this program are:

• Naturally curious and ask a lot of questions
• Interest in learning the ins-and-outs of the insurance industry
• Capable of coding in either R or Python
• Knowledge and experience building standard predictive modeling techniques including: linear and non-linear models, regression analyses, machine learning methods (decision trees, XG Boosted trees, neural networks, cluster analysis (KNN), feature selection, etc.), forecasting, time series analysis, survival analysis, and causal impact analyses
• Capable of writing SQL queries to generate datasets
• M.S. or PhD Students in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or a similarly related field desired



Next Steps

• Accepting Applications through December 2024
• Interviews and Offers Extended through January 2025



Effective Work Dates run from May 2025 through August 2025 (summer break).

Work Authorization

Central will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Central that all recruiting, hiring, training, compensation, overtime, job classification and assignment, facilities, promotions, transfers, employee treatment and all other terms and conditions of employment shall be maintained in a manner which will not discriminate against any person because of race, color, age, sex, national origin, ancestry, religion, marital status, military status, or disability. The applicant should respond to questions on this application in a way that will not divulge such information.

Recruiting Manager

Position Summary

The Manager, Recruiting is responsible for leading talent acquisition efforts, overseeing the recruitment team, and ensuring the organization attracts top talent to meet current and future staffing needs. The Manager will be responsible for developing recruitment strategies, managing the recruitment process, and building strong relationships with hiring managers and candidates. The Manager plays a critical role in shaping the employer brand and ensuring an exceptional candidate experience.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

• Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates across all positions. 
• Supervise, mentor, and develop a team of recruiters. Ensure team goals are aligned with the organization’s hiring needs and overall business objectives. 
• Oversee full-cycle recruitment processes including job postings, sourcing, screening, interviewing, and extending offers. Ensure timely and efficient hiring practices. 
• Utilize various sourcing methods including job boards, social media, employee referrals, and networking to build a pipeline of talent. 
• Collaborate with the marketing team to promote the company as an employer of choice. Ensure job postings reflect the company's values and attract the right talent. 
• Work closely with department heads and hiring managers to understand staffing needs and align recruiting efforts. Foster positive candidate relationships and manage the candidate experience from initial contact to onboarding. 
• Manage relationships with staffing agencies and consulting firms to ensure compliance. 
• Ensure all recruiting practices comply with legal requirements and company policies. Maintain accurate records and ensure adherence to hiring protocols. 
• Track and report key recruitment metrics, such as time-to-hire, cost-per-hire, and quality of hire. Use data to make informed decisions and optimize recruitment processes. 
• Develop relationship with job positing sites to effectively utilize job boards. 
• Manage open position report, work with department leaders on headcount budgets, full understanding of metrics associated with recruiting. 
• Stay current with industry trends and best practices in recruiting. Identify opportunities to improve recruitment processes and candidate experience. 
• Lead, coach, motivate and develop. Responsible for one-on-one meetings, performance appraisals, growth opportunities and attracting new talent. 
• Clearly communicate expectations, provide employees with the training, resources, and information needed to succeed. 
• Actively engage, coach, counsel and provide timely, and constructive performance feedback. 
• Other duties as assigned.


EDUCATION

• Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent work experience.


Experience And Skills

• 5 years of experience in recruiting in a Corporate environment, with at least 3 years in a supervisory role. 
• Must demonstrate successful leadership competencies. 
• Strong understanding of recruiting techniques and best practices. 
• Ability to create innovative recruiting strategies. 
• Proficiency in using applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other recruiting software. 
• Excellent interpersonal skills. 
• Strong communication skills required. Must have the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization. 
• Ability to manage multiple priorities and work in a fast-paced environment. 
• Strong organizational and time-management skills. 
• Knowledge of employment laws and hiring regulations. 
• Excellent Microsoft skills- Outlook, Word, Excel; ATS database experience


POSITION COMPETENCIES

• Accountability
• Communication
• Action Oriented
• Timely Decision Making
• Building Relationships/Shaping Culture
• Customer Focus


PHYSICAL DEMANDS

This is a standard desk position requiring extended sitting and computer work

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Remote

The company has reviewed this job description to ensure that essential functions and basic duties have been included. It is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all functions, responsibilities, skills, and abilities. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate.

Stop searching. Start growing. It’s time to build a meaningful career where you can grow, your ideas can thrive, and you are recognized and valued. Join a team committed to your excellence, and apply to Safety National today!

Ready for a rewarding career? Follow this link to view all of our available careers and apply: https://www.safetynational.com/careers-page/

This opportunity is in the Information Technology Department.

As the company’s largest department, I.T. is responsible for supporting both ongoing operations and our next innovative project. At Safety National, information technology is instrumental to our success, allowing us to partner with colleagues to securely enable and support new capabilities every day. Utilizing a diverse set of technologies, like Guidewire, Salesforce, Java, C#/.NET, Mule, and Azure, the available career opportunities continue to grow rapidly. Our department consists of agile teams who employ the Scaled Agile Framework for enterprises (SAFe) to effectively deliver solutions and add value. I.T. is also a team where individual contributions are recognized, and career advancement is nurtured.

Role Description:

In the role of Security Architect, you will be part of a dynamic team that lives Safety National’s Core Values of Relationships, Integrity, Teamwork, Balance and Stability. You will work closely with Vice President & Chief Information Security Officer. Your contributions of planning and designing activities, assurance and collaboration across the organization and aligned with the organizations’ strategic goals will be felt throughout Safety National.

Along with your day-to-day responsibilities as a Security Architect, this role is fully remote to Safety National. Some of your duties will include planning and designing activities, assurance and collaboration across the organization and aligning with the organizations’ strategic goals. You will play an integral role in defining and assessing the organization’s security strategy, architecture and practices. You will be required to effectively translate business objectives and risk management strategies into specific security processes enabled by security technologies and services. Ensuring confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of data including cloud, network and endpoint security, strengthening a safe and secure culture in collaboration with IT teams and the business.

There are three distinct roles this person will play in this position: Planning and Design Activities, Assurance Activities and Collaboration. For Planning and Design, you will develop, maintain and educate on privacy and security architecture process that enables the company to develop and implement secure solutions and capability’s that clearly aligned with business, technology and threat drivers. Additionally, you will develop and maintain privacy and security architecture artifacts that can be used to leverage security capabilities in projects and operations.

Assurance Activities will conduct of tracking developments and changes in digital business and identifying threats to ensure they are adequately addressed in security strategy plans and architecture artifacts. Other assurance activities will be coordinating validation of security configurations and access to security infrastructure tools including firewalls, IPA’s WAF’s and anti-malware/endpoint protection systems.

Lastly you will collaborate. Collaboration with IT, Business, and security teams to ensure that security architecture supports the needs of the business. Provides guidance on information security topics, advising and collaborating on privacy and security matters with other organizational units. You will be acting as a liaison with the business continuity management team to validate security practices for business continuity testing and operations when a fail over occurs.

The ideal candidate is someone who has a strong working knowledge of vulnerability management tools and hands-on experience of managing security infrastructure. Some of the essentials skills required of you in this role are, experience reviewing application code for security vulnerability and securing CI/CD pipelines, experience designing the deployment of applications and infrastructure into public cloud services, full-stack knowledge of IT infrastructure and strong working knowledge of IT service management. Prior experience with Sarbanes-Oxley, Privacy Practices, NIST Cybersecurity Framework is preferred.

If this role describes you, don’t delay. Apply today!

Qualifications:

Education:

• A Bachelor’s degree in IT related field preferred (Computer Science, Information Systems, Cyber Security)



Required Qualifications:

• Minimum of 8 years’ experience in IT with a focus on Security
• Possess 2 or more approved certifications within job area
• Direct, hands-on experience or a strong working knowledge of managing security infrastructure – firewalls, intrusion prevention systems, web application firewalls, endpoint protection, SIEM and log management technology.
• Experience reviewing application code for security vulnerability and securing CI/CD pipelines.
• Strong working knowledge of vulnerability management tools.
• Experience designing the deployment of applications and infrastructure into public cloud services.
• Full-stack knowledge of IT infrastructure.
• Direct experience designing Identity Access Management technologies and services.
• Strong working knowledge of IT service management (ITIL-related disciplines).



Preferred Qualifications:

• Can interface with, and gain the respect of stakeholders at all levels and roles in the company.
• Is a confident, energetic self-starter, with strong interpersonal skills.
• Has good judgment, a sense of urgency, results-oriented and has demonstrated commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service and integrity.



Safety National is a leading specialty insurance and reinsurance provider. Our culture is built upon relationships, which allow us to demonstrate our expertise gained through our rich 80-year history. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tokio Marine, Inc., we appreciate the benefits and support provided by our affiliation with one of the top 10 insurance companies in the world.

A Benefits Structure That Puts Employees First

Safety National’s approach to benefits reaches far beyond competitive fixed compensation. Instead, we construct a total rewards benefits package for each valued member of our team. Highlights include incentive award bonuses, an annual holiday bonus, and profit-sharing contributions. Other exceptional benefits include generous healthcare coverage, a 401(k) match, enhanced paid caregiver leave, and family-forming benefits for adoption, surrogacy, and fertility. We also promote balance by offering a hybrid working environment and several employee appreciation events throughout the year. Apply today to learn more about our total rewards approach.

Safety National is committed to fair, transparent pay and we strive to provide competitive, market-based compensation. In our vision to be First with Co-Workers, compensation is only one piece of the comprehensive total rewards package we offer. The target salary range for this position is $122,000 to $196,000. Compensation for the successful candidate will consider the candidate’s particular combination of knowledge, skills, competencies, experience and geographic location.

Are you an experienced Salesforce Administrator looking to grow your career? Do you thrive in a dynamic, innovative environment where your skills can make a real impact? If so, Innovative Captive Strategies (ICS) is looking for you!

Innovative Captive Strategies is a leader in providing tailored captive insurance solutions that empower our clients to achieve their financial goals. We are dedicated to excellence, innovation, and building strong, meaningful relationships with our clients. At ICS, we believe in fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture where every team member can grow and succeed.

We are looking to add a Salesforce Administrator to join our Innovative Captive Strategies team in Waukee, IA. Candidates thrive in our environment when they harness their collaborative mindset, strong interpersonal communication skills, and a love of learning.

Duties:

• Handle all aspects of user and license management including new user setup, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules
• End user support including troubleshooting errors
• Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Object and field creation, page layouts and lighting pages, record types, custom settings
• Monitor End user Adoption and propose ideas to further drive Adoption
• Keeping up with new Salesforce features and functionality and providing recommendations for process improvements
• Performs special projects and other duties as requested.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

• Available and responsive to questions
• Excellent relationship building skills and Ability to interact with users at All levels
• A Desire to implement best practice solutions
• A Desire to further learning of the Salesforce Platform
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with data systems teams
• Excellent oral and written communication skills
• Basic knowledge of business practices
• Ability and willingness to pursue relevant designations and/or continuing education, as appropriate.
• Must be knowledgeable of and comply with HMA's Client Privacy Policy, HIPAA regulations and E&O procedures and policies.
• Strong preference for experience with Java in school or work settings.


Qualifications:

• Education: A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field is preferred.
• Programming Languages: Strong preference for experience with Java in school or work settings.
• Experience: Minimum 0-2 years’ Salesforce experience. Work towards your Salesforce Administrator Certification


Benefits: In addition to core benefits like health, dental and vision, also enjoy benefits such as:

• Paid Parental Leave and supportive New Parent Benefits — We know being a working parent is hard, and we want to support our employees in this journey!
• Company paid continuing Education & Tuition Reimbursement — We support those who want to develop and grow.
• 401k Profit Sharing — Each year, Holmes Murphy makes a lump sum contribution to every full-time employee’s 401k. This means, even if you’re not in a position to set money aside for the future at any point in time, Holmes Murphy will do it on your behalf! We are forward-thinking and want to be sure your future is cared for.
• Generous time off practices in addition to paid holidays — Yes, we actually encourage employees to use their time off, and they do. After all, you can’t be at your best for our clients if you’re not at your best for yourself first.
• Supportive of community efforts with paid Volunteer time off and employee matching gifts to charities that are important to you — Through our Holmes Murphy Foundation, we offer several vehicles where you can make an impact and care for those around you.
• DE&I programs — Holmes Murphy is committed to celebrating every employee’s unique diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) experience with us. Not only do we offer all employees a paid Diversity Day time off option, but we also have a Chief Diversity Officer on hand, as well as a DE&I project team, committee, and interest group. You will have the opportunity to take part in those if you wish!
• Consistent merit increase and promotion opportunities — Annually, employees are reviewed for merit increases and promotion opportunities because we believe growth is important — not only with your financial wellbeing, but also your career wellbeing.
• Discretionary bonus opportunity — Yes, there is an annual opportunity to make more money. Who doesn’t love that?!


Holmes Murphy & Associates is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Join SmartFinancial: Empowering Insurance Agents with Cutting-Edge Technology

Welcome to SmartFinancial, where our mission is clear: to drive growth and success for insurance agencies through our industry-leading technology! Voted one of the Best Places to Work for four consecutive years, we are one of the fastest-growing tech companies.

We are a leading insurance marketplace, connecting millions of shoppers to our network of insurance partners.

The compensation for this position is $80,000-$125,000 annually.

What You'll Do

• Develop and Execute Marketing Strategy:
• Lead the development and implementation of comprehensive marketing strategies to attract and retain Insurance Agency/Carrier clients
• Define target audiences, positioning, messaging, and channel selection
• Content Creation and Distribution:
• Create compelling content tailored to B2B audiences, including whitepapers, case studies, blog posts, webinars, client success stories, and more
• Distribute content through appropriate channels to drive engagement, with a focus on LinkedIn and Facebook
• Collaboration with Sales Teams:
• Work closely with the sales and account management teams to align marketing efforts with sales objectives
• Provide sales enablement materials and support to drive revenue growth
• Brand Management:
• Ensure consistent messaging and branding across all marketing channels and materials
• Uphold brand standards and guidelines in all communications
• Performance Measurement and Reporting:
• Track key performance metrics and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns
• Prepare regular reports to communicate results and insights to stakeholders


What We're Looking For

• Proven experience in video production, including basic editing and producing podcasts or similar media projects
• Strong storytelling skills, with an ability to weave complex ideas into engaging narratives
• Excellent organizational and project management skills, capable of meeting tight deadlines and managing multiple tasks simultaneously
• Proficient with modern production & distribution software and social media platforms, with an emphasis on YouTube and LinkedIn
• Proven experience in B2B marketing
• Strong understanding of marketing principles, tactics, and best practices
• Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Proficiency in marketing automation tools, CRM systems, and analytics platforms
• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Team player with the ability to collaborate effectively across departments



What We Offer

• Comprehensive Health Coverage: Health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents
• Retirement Plans: 401(k) retirement plan with company matching contributions
• Paid Time Off: Generous PTO, holidays, and extensive paid product training
• Professional Development: Opportunities for career growth and advancement within a supportive environment that values employee development
• Flexible Work Options: Hybrid work arrangements, combining in-office and remote work opportunities



Why You'll Love It Here

We'd especially like to highlight our World Class Culture, which our employees say is the best thing about working at SmartFinancial. We have great SLACK channels for work and play, which keep you connected with your fellow employees throughout the day. Not to mention our top notch company events (like our Summer Beach Party with open bar, chili cook-off, annual holiday yacht party, fun office potlucks and more) that will keep you asking when the next event is.

We also have Penny, our company mascot. Like swag themed after a pink pig wearing glasses? Just. You. Wait.

Join SmartFinancial and become a key player in driving growth for insurance agencies. Apply now, and let's achieve success together!

SmartFinancial is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To learn more about our results-focused culture and employee-focused perks, read more on our careers page.

The Cloud Engineering Lead is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the organization’s cloud infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security of cloud environments. This role involves leading a team of cloud engineers, driving cloud adoption strategies, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver robust cloud solutions that support business objectives. The ideal candidate is a highly skilled technical leader with a deep understanding of cloud technologies, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to drive cloud transformation initiatives.

Key Accountabilities/Deliverables:

• Lead, mentor, and manage a team of cloud engineers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. 
• Design and implement cloud architectures that are secure, scalable, and optimized for performance, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices. 
• Develop and execute cloud strategies, including migration, optimization, and modernization plans, to drive the organization’s cloud adoption and maturity. 
• Oversee the development of automation scripts and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to provision and manage cloud resources efficiently. 
• Monitor cloud usage and optimize costs, implementing governance and cost-control measures to ensure efficient cloud spending. 
• Ensure that cloud environments adhere to security standards and compliance requirements, implementing controls and monitoring solutions to protect data and systems. 
• Lead incident response for cloud-related issues, ensuring quick resolution and continuous improvement of cloud operations. 
• Work closely with DevOps, software development, and security teams to integrate cloud solutions across the technology stack, ensuring smooth deployment and operation of applications. 
• Implement monitoring and logging solutions to track the performance and health of cloud environments, proactively addressing potential issues. 
• Provide regular updates to leadership on cloud performance, incidents, cost management, and strategic initiatives.


Technical Knowledge and Understanding:

• Strong understanding of cloud security best practices, compliance standards, and data protection. 
• Exceptional leadership and team management skills, with the ability to develop and motivate high-performing teams. 
• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with a focus on designing resilient and efficient cloud solutions. 
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
• Proficiency in monitoring and management tools (e.g., CloudWatch, Azure Monitor, Stackdriver) for cloud performance and health monitoring. 
• Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing tasks and ensuring timely delivery.


Experience:

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. 
• Master’s degree preferred. 
• 7+ years of experience in cloud engineering, architecture, or infrastructure roles, with at least 3 years in a leadership position. 
• Extensive experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), including cloud architecture, deployment, and operations. 
• Proven expertise in automation, scripting, and Infrastructure as Code tools (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible). 
• Cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect, Google Cloud Professional Cloud Architect) are highly desirable.


Seeking candidates that can work a hybrid schedule from Cincinnati, OH or Dallas, TX.

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa for this position.

At Core Specialty, you will receive a competitive salary and opportunities for professional development and advancement. We offer medical, dental, vision, and life insurances; short and long-term disability; a Company-match of 100% of a 6% contribution 401(k) plan; an Employee Assistance Plan; Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account, Health Reimbursement Account, and a wellness program

At Core Specialty, you will receive a competitive salary and opportunities for professional development and advancement. We offer medical, dental, vision, and life insurances; short and long-term disability; a Company-match of 100% of a 6% contribution 401(k) plan; an Employee Assistance Plan; Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account, Health Reimbursement Account, and a wellness program

Why you should join our At-Bay Security team:

At-Bay is a fast-growth InsurSec company (Insurance x Cybersecurity) on a mission to bring innovative products to the market that help protect small businesses from digital risks. As an InsurSec provider, we uniquely combine insurance with mission-critical security technologies, threat intelligence, and human expertise, to bridge the critical security capability gap that exists among SMBs in the community. We believe InsurSec is an $80B market opportunity and we are excited to expand our DFIR team in order to help expand our reach and influence in the business and security community, of which we serve 35,000 customers.

With At-Bay, our customers experience 5X fewer ransomware attacks. This is just the tip of the iceberg! Click here to learn more about what we're building.

The Role:

• Cybersecurity Analysts focused on Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) deliver incident investigation and response services to At-Bay insureds via:
• Forensically sound collection, transmission, and storage of digital evidence
• Analysis of digital evidence to identify indicators of compromise and adversary activity
• Development of incident timelines and theories of compromise
• Identification of incident root causes
• Participation in threat actor negotiations as necessary (e.g., ransom negotiations, etc.)
• Participation in incident recovery (e.g., restoration of data from backups, reimaging workstations and servers, rebuilding network infrastructure, etc.) activities as necessary
• Development and delivery of incident reports to document key incident details for engagement stakeholders including executive leaders for insureds, breach coach attorneys, and At-Bay claims management staff as necessary
• Development and delivery of recommendations to mitigate the risk of future incidents for impacted insureds
• Development and delivery of incident response training and simulations for targeted insureds

Key skills:

• Previous digital forensics and incident response experience
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Previous hands-on experience performing digital forensics and incident response, including several of the following:
• Business Email Compromise
• Ransomware
• Digital evidence collection and analysis
• Development and analysis of cyber threat intelligence
• Leadership of or participation in investigations involving digital evidence
• Intrusion detection / cyber threat hunting
• Malware analysis
• Incident recovery activities such as restoration of data from backups, operation of decryptor tools, etc. 
• Previous hands-on experience working in information technology operations (e.g., Network Operations Center, Security Operations Center, Incident Response Team, etc.)


Minimum requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• Minimum of 3 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, incident response, incident recovery, or another security discipline
• Willingness to travel as needed to perform job functions


Preferred requirements:

• Significant undergraduate or graduate coursework in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, or cybersecurity
• Previous background in law enforcement or government/military with experience leading complex technical investigations
• Knowledge of cloud environments, including knowledge of cloud security products and services offered by major cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google)
• Experience in a top-10 cyber consulting firm or leading DFIR provider preferred
• One or more industry cybersecurity certifications (e.g., GCIH, Security+, CISSP, etc.)


Work location:

• USA, nationwide


Our estimated base pay range for this role is $130,000-$150,000 per year. Base salary is determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to market data, location, internal equitability, domain knowledge, experiences and skills. In general, if the position sparks your interest we encourage you to apply - our team prioritizes talent.

description:
Job Details

Description

https://www.ardaninc.com/california-employee-and-job-application-privacy-notice/

Hybrid Opportunity!

Company Overview

Grid151 creates custom products and services that may not fit into the typical mold of insurance or real estate products as we know them, and that is where we can let our creative and consultative minds run wild. Our team knows, loves, and is passionate about the real estate, insurance, and mortgage lending marketplace, and has a great level of respect for the incredible economic engine that this sector represents, while also representing intensely personal, emotional, and memorable experiences for consumers. We love what we do and it shows. Grid151 encompasses an incredibly varied and diverse suite of people, tech products, and services which serve these markets, and we’re growing every day.

Job Summary

The National Account Executive, GridBase manages the sales objectives and strategic sales and business development priorities of the Company within GridBase, with a specific focus on lender accounts. This person will independently represent GridBase products and services to lender accounts to meet and exceed sales revenue expectations, sales profitability and budgetary objectives, and enhance the overall customer experience. Success in this position is demonstrated by meeting and exceeding sales and budget goals, and building our brand with customers whom consider us invaluable partners to their success.

Major Areas Of Responsibility

Includes the following key areas and duties, as defined by Senior Leadership, which may be modified or increased as necessary:

• Executes a sales strategy that drives corporate objectives and revenue growth expectations
• Manages key customer relationships and participates in closing key strategic opportunities. Lead multiple sales calls with various c-suite executives and other senior leadership within enterprise sales opportunities
• Achieves a sales funnel with the ability to forecast and measure performance from lead generation to close
• Works collaboratively with cross-functional organizational teams to develop the necessary tactics and relationships to ensure high client growth, satisfaction and retention.
• Self-source leads and opportunities through industry contacts, networking, conferences, thought leadership, panel participation, social media, etc.
• Manage pipeline of sales opportunities in Salesforce.com
• Manages customer expectations and contributes to a high level of customer satisfaction and to the overall customer experience. Ensures that our customers are successfully transitioned from sales to operations
• All other duties as defined by your supervisor


Education And Experience

This role requires 10+ years of progressively responsible lender sales experience in a fast-paced environment with a proven record of success with business-to-business sales environment in or with the mortgage, fintech, proptech, title insurance, or real estate industry BA/BS degree and/or relevant work experience is required.

• Self-motivated, resourceful, entrepreneurial, and results-oriented
• Strong communication, presentation, and organization skills
• Analytical and creative in approach to identifying opportunities and solving problems
• Proven ability to develop strategic goals, drive company sales, and achieve profit objectives
• Strong negotiation skills
• Thorough knowledge of the real estate, mortgage lending, and title insurance industries, and strong understanding of the competitive landscape in the title insurance industry
• Proficient computer skills necessary – Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce
• Strong presentation skills
• Strong judgment and decision-making skills are essential. Must be able to operate independently with little supervision.


Required Competencies

• Acts/Leads with Human Sensitivity: Demonstrates respect, develops others, enriches team dynamics
• Interacts Effectively: Listens and communicates effectively, actively networks
• Manages Complexity: Reasons from multiple perspectives, makes decisions
• Achieves Results with Integrity: Conveys energy, focuses on results, acts with integrity
• Innovates: Shows curiosity, imagines creative solutions, promotes team creativity
• Demonstrates Entrepreneurship: Takes initiative, focuses on customers, improves business performance, develops a vision


Please Note

We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status.
• Travel: 50%+


Work Environment

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Note: This job description is not intended to be an exhausted list of duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the job.

We Offer Some Great Perks

• Health, dental, and vision benefits
• Employer paid disability and life insurance
• Flexible spending accounts 
• 401K with company match

SWBC is seeking a talented individual to provide technical support for PEO’s Learning Platforms to include logging and tracking all training activities and composing accurate reports of compliance and usage. This position also provides general knowledge and experience of the learning platform to effectively collaborate with outside vendors, SWBC clients, and internal staff.

Why You'll Love This Role

In this role, you will be part of a thriving, positive and enthusiastic team. Your proficiency in MS Excel, attention to detail, and ability to interpret data will help contribute to our team's mission of providing meaningful and innovative development opportunities for our employees and client partners.

Essential Duties Include The Following

• Pulls frequent usage reports from the learning platforms for management and consults with other departments to satisfy their reporting needs. Provides comprehensive quarterly reports on the breakdown of Training and Employee Development’s resources and effectiveness.
• Provides technical support for the learning platform users, including catalog maintenance and technical interface support to all users which include email, phone support, and video sharing.
• Adds and/or removes various training objects to the learning platforms. Collects and/or creates all necessary information from course developers and/or coordinator including course descriptions, durations, tags, audience, deadline for completion, and reconciles classroom rosters to update the system.
• Uploads, tests, and assigns quarterly eLearning compliance requirements for all SWBC Divisions and fields any questions or technical issues that may arise. Provides a monthly compliance report to department Vice President.
• Provides any necessary training to clients and SWBC management and/or teams so they can access employee records, recommend, or assign training to their organizations, pull reports, etc.
• Maintains accurate user records to include adding vendors, contractors, and other users who will not be loaded through the daily feed; and removing users as appropriate. Actively engages with the IT/HRIS Workday Team to ensure congruence between the learning platforms and the Workday infrastructure. 
• Develops and maintains training materials; including presentations, user guides, and troubleshooting materials to support teammates in their use of the learning platform and supporting applications.
• Coordinates with LMS vendor to implement enhancements, troubleshoot errors, identify areas of improvement, increase functionality, and the like. Opens technical help tickets with the vendors.
• Initiates communication with various IT departments to create data import schedules using FTP and/or API. Creates staging tables to be used in data translation. Coordinates communication between internal and external IT and HR departments to ensure successful data transmissions between platforms.
• Performs all other duties as assigned.


Serious Candidates Will Possess The Minimum Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Education, Communication, Human Resources, Training, or related field of sturdy from an accredited four-year college or university.
• Experience with FTP processes and API connections preferred.
• At least two (2) years of customer service, technical systems administration, help desk or similar LMS administration experience.
• Exposure to Learning Management Systems preferred.
• Experience establishing connections between systems using either API or FTP
• Good technical, problem solving, and analytical skills.
• Willingness to work with cutting-edge education tools and techniques.
• Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication (both written and oral), and telephone etiquette skills.
• Able to coordinate multiple tasks concurrently.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, particularly MS Excel and PowerPoint.
• Self-starter who takes initiative in finding solutions to difficult and unique problems/opportunities.
• Able to sit for long periods of time while performing and utilizing training materials and other such duties.
• Required to lift 10-20 lbs. of training materials or other documents.


SWBC offers*:

• Competitive overall compensation package
• Work/Life balance 
• Employee engagement activities and recognition awards 
• Years of Service awards
• Career enhancement and growth opportunities 
• Leadership Academy and Mentor Program
• Continuing education and career certifications 
• Variety of healthcare coverage options
• Traditional and Roth 401(k) retirement plans 
• Lucrative Wellness Program
• Based upon employee eligibility


Additional Information

SWBC is a Substance-Free Workplace and requires pre-employment drug testing.

Please note, SWBC does not hire tobacco users as allowed by law.

To learn more about SWBC, visit our website at www.SWBC.com. If interested, please click the appropriate apply button.

We’re looking for an experienced Product manager who loves tackling complex problems, cherishes delightful UX, and is driven by data who can seamlessly plan, design, and collaborate across teams in order to create amazing product experiences at scale.


In your day-to-day, you’ll be responsible for integrating some of our core services throughout the customer’s journey, while looking to improve user experience, conversion rate, and other key engagement points in our funnel—with strong focus on our payments and checkout processes.


You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders from all of our product lines, and work closely with designers, engineers, and data analysts, to ensure smooth adoption of our core services across our products and maintain our world-class customer experience.


In this role you’ll
• Lead the product specification of some of our core product flows that are shared across all of our product lines, and make sure we optimize customers’ engagement
• Lead cross-functional projects to integrate new core experiences across Lemonade's product lines
• Work closely with designers, engineers, and data analysts to drive fast-paced execution and delivery
• Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of initiatives and make data-driven decisions to optimize them


What you’ll need
• A proven track record of building high-quality products at scale, a must
• 5+ years experience working as a product manager in a successful startup / fast-growing company
• Experience in checkout and payment flows, a big advantage
• Passion for UX and a drive to create delightful experiences
• Proven project management skills while overseeing complex product launches for cross-functional teams
• Outstanding communication skills, including the ability to present findings and recommendations clearly and effectively to stakeholders
• Experience leading small, agile teams
• Superior attention to detail, coupled with an eye for the big picture
• A curious individual who reads constantly and loves to pass on their knowledge to others
• Ability to work in an office environment a minimum of 3 days a week
• Enthusiasm about learning and adapting to the exciting world of AI – a commitment to exploring this field is a fundamental part of our culture

McGohan Brabender

Position: Software Developer-Dayton-Hybrid

About Us

McGohan Brabender is renowned for recruiting top-tier talent within the employee benefits industry. As one of the nation's largest employee-owned (ESOP) benefit firms, we are true entrepreneurial disruptors in the field. Our team embodies agility, serving as advisors, financial strategists, and innovative problem solvers.

Our culture is infectious, grounded in our unwavering commitment to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where every individual is accorded the utmost dignity and respect. At the core of all our values, whether in life or business, lies our dedication to people. We wholeheartedly encourage everyone to bring their authentic selves to work every single day.

About The Role

As a Software Developer at McGohan Brabender, you will design, develop and maintain software applications, automation scripts, services and other process automation tools. The ideal candidate will be a proactive and detail-oriented individual, focused on collaboration with other IT and non-IT resources to create the best customer centered solutions.

Key Responsibilities

• Write high quality, semantic, testable, maintainable, and well-documented code.
• Engineer and develop applications, processes and services within Microsoft .NET framework.
• Web development utilizing PHP, Javascript, AngularJS.
• Utilizing, updating and maintaining related applications SQL back end.
• Automation of processes from code, low-code and visual-code.
• Work with business teams to create technical requirements and deliver within time and scope.
• Stay up to date with the latest industry technologies and best practices, applying them where appropriate to our projects.
• Perform other duties as assigned.


Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree in a related field (CS, MIS, etc.) preferred, experience may serve as an adequate substitute for a degree.
• Knowledge of and experience with Microsoft .NET, C#, SQL, APIs (REST), PHP, JS based frameworks.
• Experience with the use of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or similar).
• Experience with CRMs (Salesforce is a plus).
• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
• Understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
• Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and project management abilities.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
• Previous experience in insurance industry/brokerage is a plus.

About us
Coalition is the world's first Active Insurance provider designed to help prevent digital risk before it strikes. Founded in 2017, Coalition combines broad insurance coverage with a digital risk assessment and continuous security monitoring to help organizations protect themselves in today’s hyper-connected world.

Opportunities to make an impact with bold thinking are real - and happening daily.
About the role
Underwriting Management at Coalition involves leading and guiding a team to help clients solve cyber risk challenges effectively. We seek an experienced cyber and technology E&O underwriting manager to lead a remote team and utilize Coalition's best practices and unique capabilities to profitably expand our business.
 
Voir ce poste en français
Responsibilities

• Lead and mentor a team of underwriters, fostering a collaborative environment and promoting professional growth.

• Oversee the analytical research of policyholders and risks conducted by the team.

• Manage and cultivate relationships with insurance brokers, negotiating pricing, coverages, and other terms to grow our book profitably.

• Attend in-person meetings with Business Development staff and brokers as necessary to facilitate team support.

• Develop, implement, and streamline processes for renewal business to achieve our customer service standards.

• Strategically contribute to policymaking on emerging threats, loss trends, marketplace changes, and other trends in cyber and technology risks.

• Maintain an active understanding of cyber and technology marketplaces and industry trends, imparting knowledge to the team.

• Identify and leverage areas where our unique capabilities provide a competitive advantage and support these through the development of processes.

• Collaborate with Security Engineers and guide the team in reviewing cyber and tech E&O accounts for risk assessment.

• Serve as a subject matter expert and managerial point of contact for coverage matters and endorsement drafting.


Skills and Qualifications

• 5+ years of managerial experience in underwriting cyber and technology E&O.

• Proven track record in leading high-performance underwriting teams.

• Experience handling a high volume of business.

• Self-motivated; entrepreneurial spirit.

• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic, virtual environment.

• Strong interpersonal communication skills (verbal & written).

• Ability to learn and teach technical concepts/terms.

• Proficiency in English.


Bonus Points

• Existing relationships with potential broker partners.

• Management Professional Liability experience.

• Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS is a plus.


Perks

• 70% medical, dental, and vision coverage, including out-patient treatment

• 25+ paid holidays

• Annual home office stipend

• Statutory pension

• Mental & physical health wellness programs

• Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement

 Why Coalition? 
We’re a remote-first, mission-driven team committed to building a more inclusive culture with people of all different backgrounds. We trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership, and put in the work to help us in our pursuit to solve digital risk.

Coalition’s exceptional growth stems from its ability to address real-world problems for organizations of all sizes and remain true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity, and inclusion. 

We’re always looking for collaborative, inquisitive individuals to join #OurCoalition.

Visit our Newsroom > 



Privacy Notice
Coalition is committed to protecting your privacy and handling your personal information responsibly. We collect, use, and store personal information as necessary for the recruitment process and in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations in all regions where we operate. We want you to understand what personal information we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding access, correction, and deletion of your data where applicable. Information submitted, collected, and processed as part of your application is subject to Coalition's Privacy Policy. For further details, please review our full Privacy Policy or contact us with any questions regarding how your information is handled.

Our Privacy Policy > 



Anti-Discrimination Notice

Coalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, without discrimination or harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable laws in each country where we operate. This commitment includes, but is not limited to, ensuring equal treatment in recruitment, selection, training, promotion, transfer, compensation, and all other aspects of employment. Coalition does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace.



Accommodations
Coalition is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities, including applicants and employees, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations in each country where we operate. Our policy is to support equal opportunity in the hiring process by considering qualified applicants regardless of disability or other protected characteristics, unless providing accommodation would impose an undue hardship or disproportionate burden. If you require accommodation to complete an application, interview, pre-employment testing, or participate in the selection process, please contact us at candidateaccommodations@coalitioninc.com. We also consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in line with applicable laws and regulations in each jurisdiction.



To all recruitment agencies: Coalition does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Do not forward resumes to our email alias, employees, or other physical or virtual organization locations. Coalition is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Higginbotham, a privately held, independent insurance and financial services firm that ranks within the top 20 nationwide, has an immediate opening for a Business Systems Specialist.

We are looking for a skilled and experienced Business Systems Specialist to join our team, focusing on Applied EPIC, our agency management system, and other integrated systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for optimizing the use of Applied EPIC, ensuring it meets the needs of our business processes and enhances operational efficiency. This role requires a deep understanding of the system, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments.

Key Responsibilities:

• System Administration: Manage and maintain the Applied EPIC system and other integrated systems, ensuring its smooth operation and functionality.
• Business Process Optimization: Analyze business processes and identify opportunities to leverage Applied EPIC to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
• Configuration and Customization: Configure and customize Applied EPIC to meet the specific needs of the agency, including setting up workflows, templates, and user roles.
• Integration: Work with IT and other departments to integrate Applied EPIC with other systems and applications used by the agency.
• Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve any issues or problems related to Applied EPIC, coordinating with vendor support as needed.
• Documentation: Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures.
• Project Management: Lead or participate in projects related to the enhancement or upgrade of Applied EPIC, ensuring successful implementation and adoption.
• Onboarding: Onboarding new users, including setting up user credentials and providing user security access based on the agency security guidelines.


Qualifications:

• Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience working with agency management system administration, preferably with Applied EPIC.
• Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in configuring and troubleshooting insurance agency management systems. Knowledge of software integration is a plus.
• Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex business processes and develop effective solutions.
• Communication Skills: Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to support users at all levels of the organization.
• Detail-Oriented: High attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in system configuration and data management.
• Team Player: Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
• Project Management: Experience in managing or participating in system-related projects, with the ability to meet deadlines and deliver results.


Location:

• Remote/Work-From-Home


Perks & Benefits:

• Generous employee benefits package which includes a robust wellness program 
• Employee Ownership Opportunities 
• Career progression opportunity – the potential for growth within the company

We're looking to grow our Delivery Team at NLS!

Are you a seasoned leader with a passion for delivering high-impact software solutions? If you thrive in a dynamic environment, where innovation meets collaboration, this role is for you. As a Delivery Lead at Next Level Solutions, you’ll guide our client-focused software implementation projects to success while fostering a culture of excellence and efficiency.


*We know you care about benefits and perks, so feel free to scroll down to that section, and then scroll back up to learn more about this role.


What You'll Do:
• Drive Results: Oversee software implementation projects to ensure delivery on time, within scope, and on budget—meeting quality and margin targets.
• Lead Client Engagement: Build strong, long-term relationships with stakeholders by managing expectations and fostering trust.
• Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work with NLS department leaders to align projects with business goals, ensuring resource availability and allocation.
• Strategize for Success: Conduct regular executive-level checkpoints to drive satisfaction, mitigate risks, and manage escalations.
• Innovate & Improve: Champion a culture of continuous improvement by driving process enhancements and staying ahead of industry trends.
• Expand Partnerships: Partner with Sales and Solutioning teams to develop pricing and staffing models and identify opportunities for growth within existing client relationships.

What You'll Bring:
• Technical Expertise: Advanced knowledge of MSP, JIRA, ADO, Microsoft Office 365, and other PM tools.
• Proven Leadership: 8+ years in project leadership within technology, with a track record of successfully managing complex software projects and schedules.
• Strategic Vision: PMP, ACP, or SAFe RTE certifications preferred, with an ability to drive change and mentor teams.
• Exceptional Communication: Strong interpersonal and client-facing skills, even under pressure.
• Adaptability & Initiative: Thrive in dynamic environments and take proactive steps to achieve goals.
• Education: Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s preferred, in Business, Computer Information Systems, Insurance and Risk Management, or related fields.



Why join NLS?
Bring your authentic self to the Next Level Solutions team!  Go-getter. Learner. Team Oriented.  
If this sounds like you, consider joining our team!  Our culture is what makes us who we are.  We work hard, but we have fun doing it!  We believe that knowledge should be shared.  Shared knowledge fosters our collaborative workplace culture, where our people work together towards achieving company goals.  This environment promotes continuous learning and professional development.   
At NLS, our mission is to “Do Good Work” for our clients, our employees, and our communities.  We have experienced incredible growth and will continue this trend by investing in our most important resource: our people.  If you are looking to join a fun and friendly company with a great team environment, room for advancement, and the opportunity to make a difference, we’re hiring! 
The Benefits & Perks: 
• Competitive salary package with an annual bonus
• Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
• Flexible working arrangements
• Opportunities for internal advancement and career development
• Relaxed office environment with casual dress code
• Company sponsored activities and team building events 
• PTO & paid company holidays 
• Traditional & Roth 401k with a 5% company match
• Physical and mental wellness program

What We're Looking For

Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies, Workers Compensation Division, has an opening in its Walnut Creek office for a Manager of Business Intelligence and Analytics. This individual will report to the Vice President of Analytics and is part of the team responsible for providing Data Engineering, Business Intelligence and Analytics, and Machine Learning and Modeling to the organization. This individual will manage a small team of BI Analysts, designing and executing development and modification of new and existing reports, and delivering custom analysis requested by the business. Additionally, this individual will serve as the outward-facing liaison for the entire team for planning, solution architecture, and project prioritization.

Responsibilities

• STRATEGIC LEADERSHIP: Develop and implement the business intelligence and overall analytics team strategy aligned with organizational goals. Collaborate with Senior Leadership to understand business needs and identify opportunities for data-driven improvements. Create and maintain a roadmap for BI, Analytics, Data Engineering, and Machine Learning initiatives ensuring alignment with business objectives. 
• TEAM MANAGEMENT: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of BI Analysts, providing guidance and support to foster professional growth. Oversee the day-to-day operations of the BI team, ensuring efficient workflow and timely delivery of insights. 
• HANDS-ON DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING: Perform as a player-coach, participating in project work and analytics. Design, develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards, reports, and visualizations to support decision-making processes. Conduct advanced data analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights. Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all BI tools and reports. 
• STAKEHOLDER COLLABORATION: Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions. Maintain list of priorities and coordinate regular meetings with key teams in the business. Communicate findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
• PROJECT MANAGEMENT: Manage BI projects from inception to completion, including scope, timelines/milestones, and resource allocation. Ensure projects are delivered on time and meet defined objectives and quality standards. Serve as a project manager for broader initiatives within the Analytics team.


Required Qualifications

• EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field required. 
• EXPERIENCE: Minimum of 5 years prior experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or related field required, with a demonstratable track record of managing multiple projects and delivering results. Experience in a supervisory or team lead role overseeing BI Analysts or data professionals strongly preferred. Experience working for an insurance company, preferable within workers compensation, strongly preferred. Actuarial experience (or experience working closely with Actuaries) preferred. Experience with programming languages required (e.g., Python or similar). Experience with source control processes required. Demonstrated experience in data modeling, data warehousing, and advanced analytics required. 
• TECHNICAL SKILLS: Strong proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Power BI or similar) and data manipulation languages (e.g., SQL, preferably on a postgres-based platform like Snowflake). Moderate-to-Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel required (VBA, Pivot Tables, Pivot Charts, Power Query, Power Pivot). 
• Ability to communicate complex data insights effectively to stakeholders, executives, and other analysts required. 
• Occasional travel to our corporate offices or offsite meetings required.


What We Offer

• Work-Life Balance
• Work From Home Program (up to 2 days per week upon eligibility)
• Modern Office Setting
• Free On-Site Fitness Facility
• Free downtown shuttle route
• Two-minute walk from Walnut Creek BART Station
• Three-minute car ride from CA-24 and I-680
• Free On-Site Garage Parking
• Paid Time Off
• Paid Holidays
• Retirements Savings Match
• Group Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
• Life and AD&D Insurance
• Long Term Disability Insurance
• Accident and Critical Illness Insurance
• Flexible Savings Accounts
• Paid Community Volunteer Day
• Employee Assistance Program
• Tuition Reimbursement Program
• Employee Referral Program
• Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Program


$133,500 - $180,620 a year

This pay scale is an estimate of the salary range the employer reasonably expects to pay for the position based on potential employee qualifications, operational needs and other considerations consistent with applicable law. The actual salary may be above or below the range. The pay scale applies only to this position and only if it is filled in Walnut Creek, California. The pay scale may be different for other positions or in other locations.

About Us

With more than 50 years in business, BHHC has grown from a regional organization to a national insurance group, offering insurance products from coast to coast. Relationships are the cornerstone of our culture, and we believe in doing the right thing. That means we invest in our business in every way possible to deliver on our mission and demonstrate that people are what powers our success. Our commitment to financial strength and integrity means our customers can rest assured that we will be there when it counts.

At BHHC we embrace diversity and foster an environment where our people can be their authentic selves. Our differences make us stronger and better together, which fosters a harmonious workplace—something we truly value. We’ve created an approachable and collaborative atmosphere. Here you’ll find a welcoming workplace where everyone can feel valued, supported, and inspired to do great work. Together, we raise the bar by being curious, remaining customer-focused, and operating with integrity.
