We are seeking a Staff Software Engineer to join the Sales Application team. The Sales Application business is key for eHealth and critical to the future of the company. Sales Application engineering drives a large part of eHealth’s revenue and will continue to do so in future.

In this role, you will spearhead the architecture, design and development of our Sales Application platform. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll establish best practices for front-end and back-end development, leveraging concepts like the backend-for-frontend pattern and component libraries.

How You Will Make An Impact

You have proven industry experience in software design and development. You are a solution-centric, results-oriented, and experienced Software Engineer. You want to “build what’s right, not what’s easy.” You will work with other engineers in a collaborative environment to improve the overall quality while achieving timely delivery of solutions. You are ambitious, talented, self-starter, and driven to make the team and project successful.

The emergence of technologies like generative AI, natural language processing, and cloud-based contact centers provides an exciting context for a fast-growing company like eHealth. Our proprietary scripted sales and compliance software is the “best in the business” and we are looking to build newer features leveraging these new technologies extending eHealth’s significant competitive advantages. When integrated with the company’s online eCommerce platform and its unmatched capabilities in the industry — eHealth is driving toward an omni-channel opportunity of enormous scale.

Responsibilities

• Develop comprehensive architecture and design documents to translate abstract ideas into tangible software designs utilizing design principles.
• Hands on implementation of end-to-end Sales Application solutions, ensuring seamless experience across various customer touch points and devices.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional engineers to deliver high-quality solutions, including robust unit, integration, and functional tests, surpassing customer and business expectations.
• Engage with leaders and team members across Engineering, Product Management, UX Design, Analytics, and Marketing to provide valuable insights on user-centric and technically feasible solutions.
• Drive the establishment of development standards and assess technology options to ensure optimal performance and scalability.
• Lead and mentor software engineers at varying levels while driving the development of one or more solutions.
• Thrive in a dynamic environment characterized by rapid iterations, continuous learning, and a passion for overcoming obstacles.


Basic Qualifications

• BS in Computer Science or similar field
• 10+ years of hands-on experience in fast-paced full-stack product development environments.


Preferred Qualifications

• Knowledgeable in modern front-end development technologies like JavaScript, Vue.js, React.js, Backbone, Next.js, and Nuxt.js, emphasizing reusable component design and mobile-friendly user interfaces with CSS techniques such as grids, flexbox, and breakpoints and standards such as ES6, ES5 .
• Proficiency in back-end development using technologies like Java, SpringBoot, GraphQL, and Node.js.
• Proficiency in working with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., Oracle, Postgres, MongoDB).
• Advanced understanding of microservices architecture, RESTful services, event-driven architecture, and cloud-native software development, prioritizing automated integration and functional testing.
• Proficiency in working with GIT, Jenkins, AWS/GCP, CI/CD, feature flagging, A/B testing (Adobe, Target, Optimizely), distributed tracing, Server Side Rendering, Performance improvement and testing for full-stack eCommerce application.
• Experienced in modernizing tightly coupled monolithic Java and other technology-based applications into domain-specific, stateless, and event-driven architectures.
• Knowledge of performance optimization and relevant metrics.
• Experience building highly scalable APIs and Microservices preferably in AWS.

Job Summary


Accelerant is looking for an Exposure Data Manager to join our Analytics Team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for data and a strong understanding of various insurance products and risks. As an Exposure Data Manager at Accelerant, you will play a key role in establishing best practices for collecting and organizing exposure information from various internal and external partners.


In this role, you will work with the actuarial, product and tech teams to guide exposure data architecture while being a point person to answer various questions on exposure data issues. 


You will work alongside our operations and actuarial team to establish exposure data standards for various lines of business to be leveraged for analytics and insights.


Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate and communicate with internal teams to understand the various exposure needs for analytics and regulatory compliance.
• Create exposure data requirements for various complex lines of business while working with internal and external stakeholders.
• Work with external partners on the best way to extract and organize exposure information.
• Partner with internal and external stakeholders, including actuaries, program managers, data scientists and data engineers to identify challenges and provide data-architecture strategies.
• Address exposure data-related issues and propose solutions to improve data quality and efficiency.
• Provide guidance during onboarding of MGAs


Core Capabilities


Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
• 8+ years of P&C experience in a data-focused role
• Experience in or supporting Actuarial roles
• Experience working with MGAs


Skills
• Proficiency in Excel
• Strong P&C background and understanding of insurance coverages
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to present complex ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
• Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
• Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment


Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:


Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That’s why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.


Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.


About Accelerant:
Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged – so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai

Acuity is seeking a motivated individual as an Insight and Analytics Analyst to support the advancement of our customer analytics capabilities in our digital channels, including website/mobile, social media, email and more. This position will collaborate with a cross-functional team to develop customer analytics, actionable insights and optimization strategies to maximize ROI of marketing investments. The Analyst will have the ability to work in a constantly evolving environment to continuously improve product development.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

• Analyze performance data by segmentation; interpret and translate data into action to inform business decisions.
• Build strong business partnerships with internal customers by providing timely, accurate, and actionable data.
• Educating internal stakeholders about customer analytics, prioritizing the right KPIs, and methods to optimize business results.
• Produce actionable insights and data-driven recommendations for business and monetization strategies.
• Apply business analytics through ad-hoc reporting and custom scripting to drive optimization of various ad campaigns.
• Design, create, alter, validate, and maintain data solutions, across multiple platforms, and computing environments that meet business needs.
• Present findings in a contextual, visual data story so business users can know within minutes what the business context is, what’s changed, and what’s most relevant at that moment in time.
• Communicate complex quantitative analyses in a clear, precise, and actionable manner to a cross-functional team.
• Reasonably regular, predictable attendance.
• Perform other duties as assigned.



EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in relevant field such as Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Analytics or Computer Science preferred.

EXPERIENCE:

2-5 years of experience with data analysis and insights including: data integration, statistical modeling, digital marketing, customer insights, and data visualization.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:

• Ability to leverage multiple data sets to produce actionable insights related to customer behavior, application performance, and risk management.
• Skilled at partnering with business-owners and IT resources to improve the ability to measure and evaluate audience engagement and more fully understand customer experiences.
• Ability to consult with internal customers to understand analytic needs and help define project scope and provide deliverables.
• Ability to collaborate with developers and testers to implement, validate, and maintain analytics and reporting ensuring data integrity.
• Proven success identifying data gaps or issues and resolving analytics implementation issues, including working directly with vendors as needed.
• Expert knowledge of an analytical tool such as SAS, R, Matlab, STATA, or Python.
• Experience with relational databases and SQL.
• Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools such as Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Hive, etc.



*Acuity does not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization.*

This job is classified as exempt.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Applicants and employees are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to mental or physical disability, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected Federal, State/Province or Local status unrelated to the performance of the work involved.

Position Title: Senior Network Engineer (remote)

Entity: KBRA Holdings

Employment Type: Full-Time

Location: Remote only for those located in the following states: (CA, CO, DC, FL, IL, MD, NJ, MA, NY, PA, SC, TX, VA)

Summary/Overview

KBRA Holdings is seeking a Senior Network Engineer to join our Infrastructure team.

You will be a highly responsive, informative and proactive engineer who will be responsible for supporting KBRA’s global enterprise network. (This position is full-time remote opportunity.)

About The Job

Overall, the candidate will assist in the responsibilities for day-to-day network operational tasks, engage in proactive resource monitoring and contribute to projects across many teams. We also need the candidate to accurately document network incidents, network changes and projects from beginning to end.

It is vital that you are aware of different strategies to understand, assess and resolve network issues while keeping focus on being a team player in a fast-paced environment. This role requires the ability to keep calm during a period of crisis so that the needs of the business are met.

About You

Ability to communicate clearly with business leaders, colleagues and end-users. This is a fast-paced environment and periodic after-hours work may be required.

It is important that you have the strong desire to automate every area of networking.

Demonstrated Experience With The Following Processes And Technologies

• Knowledgeable and proficient with Terraform, Ansible and CI/CD integrations.
• Troubleshoot, configure & monitor firewalls, routers, etc.
• Participate in testing disaster recovery plans
• Working technical knowledge of:
• Bash scripting is a plus
• Python programming is preferred
• Networking vendor equipment: Cisco, Juniper, Arista
• Network protocols and standards: Dynamic/Static Routing, Layer 2 & Layer 4, etc.
• Advanced Linux OS fundamentals
• Designed/Maintained Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS network infrastructure
• Follows network policies, procedures and associated appropriate use.
• Interacts with vendors, contractors, and users.

Successful Candidates Will Possess The Following

• Ten (10) or more years of Network Engineering experience
• Three (3) or more years of experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and distributed systems architecture.
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
• Proactive with an entrepreneurial mindset as well as being documentation oriented
• Five (5) or more years of experience with Linux and the following: Bash, Vim, Nginx or Apache2 web servers, HA Proxy, TCPDump, SystemD, NetworkManager, Git, NMAP, IP tools, other basic commands
• Proficiency in modern software development practices and tools (e.g., Agile, DevOps, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code).
• Willingness to travel - 10-15% annually
• It is preferential that you have held a certification in:
• CCNP
• JNCIA/JNCIS
• JNCIP
• CCIE/JNCIE

Salary Range

The anticipated annual base salary range for this full-time position is $150,000 to $165,000. Offer amounts are determined by factors such as experience, skills, geography, and other job-related factors.

Benefits

• Competitive benefits and paid time off
• Paid family and disability leave
• 401(k) plan, including employer match (100% vested)
• Educational and professional development financial assistance
• Employee referral bonus program


About Us

KBRA is a full-service credit rating agency registered in the U.S., the EU and the UK, and is designated to provide structured finance ratings in Canada. KBRA’s ratings can be used by investors for regulatory capital purposes in multiple jurisdictions.

More Info

KBRA encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

Company Description

Who We Are:

Spring Venture Group is a leading digital direct-to-consumer sales and marketing company with product offerings focused on the senior market. We specialize in distributing Medicare Supplement, Medicare Advantage, and related products via our family of brands and dedicated team of licensed insurance agents. Powered by our unique technologies that combine sophisticated marketing, comparison shopping, sales execution, and customer engagement – we help thousands of seniors across the country navigate the complex world of Medicare every day.

Overview

Job Description

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for defining and championing the vision, strategy, roadmap, and success of one or more SVG products or product areas. You will work closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, and other stakeholders to discover and deliver products that are valuable to our customers, viable to operate, and feasible to build.

This person would be working a flex schedule, working some days in our KC office.

Essential Duties

The essential duties for this role include, but are not limited to:

• Deeply understand customer needs: Conduct user research, analyze customer data, and gather market insights to identify and validate customer problems and unmet needs.
• Understand the business and regulatory environment: Understand the SVG business model, processes, and financial metrics and manage the compliance of products within the regulatory landscape.
• Define product vision and strategy: Develop a clear and compelling product vision and strategy that aligns with the overall company strategy and addresses key customer needs.
• Run product discovery: In collaboration with UI/UX designers, conduct customer interviews, usability testing, and A/B testing to validate hypotheses and inform the product roadmap.
• Manage the product roadmap: Create and maintain a prioritized product roadmap that outlines the key outcomes and features required to achieve the product vision.
• Define product requirements: Work with delivery teams to translate user needs and business requirements into detailed user stories and acceptance criteria. Own the relationship and integration of 3rd party tools related to assigned products.
• Collaborate with cross-functional delivery teams: Work closely with engineering, design, and other stakeholders to ensure that the product is built, designed, and launched effectively through Agile development processes.
• Analyze product performance: Track key product metrics, analyze user behavior, and identify areas for improvement.
• Communicate effectively: Engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship.
• Be a product evangelist: Promote the product internally and externally, and act as a champion for the customer.
• Foster a culture of innovation: The Product Manager understands that consistent innovation is the result of each member of the product team contributing their passion and their ideas and fosters a culture in support of that.
• Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Qualifications

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

The Requirements To Fulfill This Position Are As Follows

• Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline; or relevant work experience
• 5+ years relevant work experience
• Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern product discovery and product delivery.
• Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgment to assess risks, and to lay out your argument in a well-structured, data-informed, written narrative.
• Proficient in understanding a variety of Agile methodologies
• Proficient in using project or product management software
• Strong attention to detail and accuracy with excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills, specifically with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical staff
• Agile certifications preferred, not required
• Salesforce experience preferred, not required



Benefits

Additional Information

The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:

• Competitive Compensation
• Medical, Dental and vision benefits after a short waiting period
• 401(k) matching program
• Life Insurance, and Short-term and Long-term Disability Insurance
• Optional enrollment includes HSA/FSA, AD&D, Spousal/Dependent Life Insurance, Travel Assist and Legal Plan
• Generous paid time off (PTO) program starting off at 15 days your first year
• 15 paid Holidays (includes holiday break between Christmas and New Years)
• 10 days of Paid Parental Leave and 5 days of Paid Birth Recovery Leave
• Annual Volunteer Time Off (VTO) and a donation matching program
• Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - health and well-being on and off the job
• Rewards and Recognition
• Diverse, inclusive and welcoming culture
• Training program and ongoing support throughout your Venture Spring Venture Group career



Security Responsibilities

• Operating in alignment with policies and standards
• Reporting Security Incidents Completing assigned training
• Protecting assigned organizational assets



Spring Venture Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Location: Hybrid Work Model – Van Wert or Dublin, Ohio, Georgia, Massachusetts

We are a team of employees who are passionate to deliver best in-class customer service and innovation in the industry. It’s because we put Integrity, Relationships and Excellence in all aspects of our work.

Our employees have the opportunity to fully utilize their talents and bring their best self. We believe that who you are is just as important as what you do!

As an Insurance Product Manager – Commercial Lines, you will build and communicate your long-term strategy for your product area within Central’s Commercial Lines product suite s . You will work closely with cross-functional teams and will focus on evaluating the market and competitive landscape, defining the value and viability of opportunities and making prioritized decisions regarding your product area. Join the Insurance Product team in this exciting role to help drive innovation of our CL product!

How You’ll Make An Impact

• Conduct market discovery through research relating to the competitive landscape, industry trends, and emerging technology in assigned states affecting your product area. 
• Work closely with business intelligence, pricing, data science and design research to understand the internal book profile of your product area and define your target customer. 
• Partner with underwriting operations, legal, and the security and compliance team to understand the legal and regulatory requirements of your product in assigned states. 
• Own the P&L performance of your product and drive its profitability. Establish, communicate and execute product strategies aligned with corporate objectives that drive profitable growth in your assigned states. 
• Identify, research, evaluate, and prioritize product development and enhancement opportunities. 
• Create and manage a product roadmap and coordinate with cross-functional team including pricing, data science, underwriting operations, ITDS, compliance, underwriting, marketing, claims, customer service, and digital product to understand delivery plans and be able to answer questions on roadmap timing. 
• Ensure underwriting operations, ITDS, and digital product have the necessary information to execute insurance product changes. Set stakeholder expectations on roadmap and explain prioritization decisions. Work with marketing, regional offices, and digital product to rollout insurance product changes. 
• Track progress towards business outcomes. Identify and communicate any objections, delays or potential blockers and adjust roadmap as necessary. 
• Participate as a key member of the durable product team. 
• Track financial and performance metrics to understand progress towards product and business outcomes. Actively monitor KPI metrics and share results with durable team members.



What You’ll Bring

• Master’s degree in business management and 4 years direct Insurance Product Management experience
• Or bachelor’s degree in business management and 6 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Or 8 years direct Insurance Product Management experience 
• Strong research skills to conduct primary and secondary market research 
• Ability to gather and synthesize large quantities of information to find unmet needs and opportunities 
• Strategic thinking skills to translate research and market insights into an actionable product roadmap 
• Basic financial accounting skills to understand product P&L, populate predefined business case templates, and make recommendations based on the results 
• Ability to collaborate and co-lead groups of people in innovation workshops 
• Clear communication style to explain prioritization decisions and articulate product strategy and roadmaps 
• Public speaking and presentation skills 
• Ability to lead through subject matter expertise and influence rather than direct reporting relationships 
• Preferred:
• Experience working in an agile environment 
• Commercial Lines Package expertise 
• Commercial Lines Property expertise 
• Commercial Lines Liability expertise

The applicant should respond to questions on this application in a way that will not divulge such information.

Job Posting Title: Recruiting Specialist

Department: Employee Experience

Reporting to: Recruiting Manager

Location: Topeka, KS - Onsite

Overview

At Advisors Excel, we believe our success starts with the people we surround ourselves with—and finding the right employees is key to making that happen. We’re looking for a driven, experienced Recruiter who’s passionate about matching top-notch candidates with exciting opportunities at our company.

As a Recruiting Specialist, you’ll be leading full cycle recruitment, supporting Advisors Excel and our related entities. You’ll partner with managers to pinpoint staffing needs, build diverse talent pools, and guide candidates through a personalized, high-touch experience every step of the way.

We’re looking for someone who’s not just organized and flexible but who thrives on curiosity, loves to connect with people, and is passionate about promoting the company’s mission. If you’re ready to make a big impact, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do

• Manage recruiting process from beginning to end for multiple openings at a time; including but not limited to development of job descriptions/job postings, resume review, multi-step interviews, scheduling, logistics and extending offers
• Provide an exciting and positive candidate experience; convey core values and promote OneAE Culture to prospective employees
• Build and maintain working relationships with hiring managers; advise on best practices, act as a sounding board on hires, and regularly communicate throughout the process
• Partner with hiring managers to identify target traits, skills, experience levels and other criteria for specific openings
• Source and recruit diverse pool of candidates, including passive candidate recruitment on LinkedIn
• Manage onboarding communication with new employees
• Manage and create proper documentation for internal moves
• Build and maintain knowledge of company divisions to effectively communicate with candidates


Experience You’ll Bring

• Previous experience in recruiting or hiring capacity
• 2-5 years of professional office experience
• Experience conducting interviews over the phone and in person
• Customer-focused attitude and a track record of providing a high-touch customer experience
• Confident, professional, and articulate in written and verbal communication; excellent relationship building skills
• Strong assessment skills, curious minded, and objective
• Organized, versatile, and flexibility; able to manage heavy workload with shifting priorities
• Must possess great initiative, be self-motivated, and dependable


Bonus Points

• 2-5 years of experience in recruiting role
• Experience with passive candidate searches
• Understanding of variety of industries and professional job functions
• Experience with applicant tracking system, passive candidate sourcing tools/techniques like Linked in
• Strong knowledge of MS Office, including Word, Excel, and Outlook


What You’ll Get

• Amazing benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401k (with matching options)
• Generous PTO package from your start date
• Access to an on-site café, gym and even an on-site primary care physician
• Continuous personal and professional development opportunities
• Recognition for hard work & exemplary performance
• Employee Sponsored events…. And so much more!


Who We Are

Advisors Excel is a fast paced, innovative company that seeks to service independent financial advisors in a multitude of areas within their business. From operational functions, to sales and marketing, our end goal is to help continually grow advisors’ businesses nationwide. We thrive on watching them succeed. Not only does AE want to see the success of our advisors, but also our employees. We have high expectations from them to continually move our business forward. We are on the hunt for positive people who thrive on hard work and in a collaborative team environment. If this sounds like you, then what are you waiting for? We want you to join our team!

Advisors Excel is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Everyone is welcome here – as an inclusive workplace, our employees are always comfortable bringing their true selves to our offices daily.

We are looking to add a Risk Marketing Consultant, PC - Insurance  to join our Placement team in Waukee, IA or Minneapolis, MN. Candidates thrive in our environment when they harness their collaborative mindset, strong interpersonal communication skills, and a love of learning.

Duties:

Work closely with Leaders and Business Partners to:

• Develop applications from raw data, such as current policies or specifications and information available on the internet.
• Create and set up loss histories using Excel software from gathered information.
• Run building valuations.
• Order applicable underwriting reports as needed.
• Prepare submissions to include applications and various support documents.
• Set up new clients in the agency management system (AMS) and other appropriate software. Input policy information in AMS for smooth transition to the Client Experience Team.
• Request and monitor process for the loss summary and experience mod forecast report gets completed.
• Complete online rating if necessary.
• Compare exposure schedules to quotes.
• Prepare coverage proposal and premium displays.
• Document required underwriting information.
• Compare requested coverage to the coverage quoted by carriers for further negotiation and discussion with underwriters.
• Schedules and leads client meetings.
• Presents turnover meeting materials to service team.
• Provide answers, solutions, or direction to questions or concerns by sales team, service team, prospects and underwriters in a courteous and timely manner.
• Research information in response to internal requests as needed.
• Develop/maintain effective communication and relationships with company underwriters and client experience team in order to build trust and write business. This includes meeting with underwriters when they visit the office, as well as attending social events before or after work hours.
• Participates in team meetings and initiatives.
• Perform special projects as identified as assigned by the Sr. Placement Consultant and AVP, Placement Consultant.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

• Understanding of Property and Casualty Insurance industry.
• Understanding of various insurance policy types, including but not limited to: GL, Property, Package, Umbrella, Auto, etc.
• Understanding of additional broader insurance policy types, including but not limited to: Management Liability, Cyber, D&O, DIC, Captive, etc.
• Ability to analyze forms to confirm Holmes Murphy minimum standards and identify omitted enhancements.
• Understands agency and carrier operations and relationships with multiple years of handling own accounts.
• Competitive knowledge of competing agencies and brokerages, ability to identify local competition
• Competitive knowledge of carriers and wholesalers and knowledge of underwriters/coverage offerings at key carrier partners.
• Ability to delegate tasks to Placement Specialists and supports Sr. Consultants, AVPs as needed.
• Ability to advise and consult with Account Executives as needed.
• Ability to provide timely responses, both internal and external.
• Detail orientation and problem-solving ability. Accuracy is a major component.
• Strong written, oral communication and negotiation skills.
• Experience with computer data entry required; working familiarity with AMS, Excel and Word and other company software.
• Proficient and knowledgeable on Inputs, updating, creation of proposals, creation of diaries, etc.
• High level of organizational ability; able to handle and prioritize multiple tasks.
• Ability to meet deadlines.
• Ability to work a 7.75 hour workday, and extended hours when necessary.
• Strong analytical skills, with ability to perform simple to complex mathematic computations.
• Ability to maintain confidentiality.

Title: Actuarial Analyst I or II

Location: current schedule is hybrid (40-50% in the Amelia, Ohio office)

Recruiter: Sonya Fischesser

Exempt position

American Modern Insurance Group, Inc., a Munich Re company, is a widely recognized specialty insurance leader that delivers products and services for residential property – such as manufactured homes and specialty dwellings – and the recreational market, including boats, personal watercraft, classic cars, and more. We provide specialty product solutions that cover what the competition often can’t. We write admitted products in all 50 states and have a premium volume of $1.9 billion.

Headquartered in Amelia, Ohio, and with associates located across the United States, we are part of Munich Re’s Global Specialty Insurance division. Our employees receive boundless opportunity to grow their careers and make a difference every day - all in a flexible environment that helps them succeed both at work and at home.

Purpose:

Provide required technical expertise in the appropriate evaluation of risk and profitability based on sound actuarial and statistical principles and techniques.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Because this role is a part of the rotation program within Predictive Analytics and Actuarial Services, initial emphasis will be on building Pricing models using R.

• Prepare and complete actuarial and/or predictive modeling analysis appropriate for the functional area. May include ultimate loss projections, pricing studies, rate filings, risk capital modeling, portfolio analysis, and research projects or claims analytical studies.
• Participate in the development of actuarial presentations and present results/topics to managers or other team members.
• Completion of required data preparation, including data input. Identify data issues requiring specialized actuarial attention.
• Document and communicate results and alternatives to actuarial staff and internal customers.
• Modify existing R based tools and expand knowledge of relevant software, tools and technology such as Databricks, DevOps, Earnix, etc.
• Participate in the development of new methodologies, products, and procedures.
• Complete peer reviews.
• Prepare for and pass actuarial exams. 
• May assist in the training of new actuarial analysts and/or data scientists.



Required Technical Skills:

• Strong analytical abilities including understanding of advanced mathematics and statistical concepts including GLMs, Principal Component Analysis, Clustering techniques, and Regularization techniques.
• Strong background in Statistical programming in R, Python or related software for modeling and other analyses. General programing and data knowledge including SQL.
• Strong command of Excel (including VBA and macros) and other computer and MS Office Suite applications. 
• Proven ability to pass actuarial exams.



Skills / Knowledge / Experience:

Level I

• Basic knowledge and understanding of actuarial and predictive modeling techniques and property/casualty insurance and reinsurance. 
• Still acquiring higher level skills.



Level II

• Strong technical actuarial and statistical skills. 
• Assists in the training of new actuarial analysts. 
• Still acquiring higher level skills. 
• Two or more years of insurance/actuarial experience. 
• A graduate degree in physics, engineering, applied mathematics, or statistics may be substituted for experience.



Education, Certifications & Designations:

Level I: Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar background requiring quantitative analysis. GPA 3.2 or higher. Passed at least 1 exam for CAS designation

Level II: Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar background requiring quantitative analysis. GPA 3.2 or higher. Passed a minimum of 3 exams for CAS designation. A graduate degree in physics, engineering, applied mathematics or statistics may be substituted for 1 actuarial exam.

Job summary:

As a direct report to our Chief Financial Officer, the VP of Business Intelligence & Analytics, will lead indirectly and directly a team responsible for data optimization, visualization and insights to support data-driven decision-making across our organization. Your role will involve leveraging advanced analytics to influence operational strategies, unify disparate data sources, and help develop an analytically minded operational environment. This newly-created position requires a seasoned professional with a proven track record in analytics leadership, technical expertise, and agility, to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Let’s talk job responsibilities:

• Develop and lead a team of analysts to provide robust insights that support decisions that drive meaningful improvements in business strategy and results.

Your experience and skills:

implementation/adoption.

About At-Bay

At-Bay is a fast-growth InsurSec company (Insurance x Cybersecurity) on a mission to bring innovative products to the market that help protect small businesses from digital risks. As an InsurSec provider, we uniquely combine insurance with mission-critical security technologies, threat intelligence, and human expertise, to bridge the critical security capability gap that exists among SMBs in the community. We believe InsurSec is an $80B market opportunity and we are excited to hire our next Senior Product Marketing Manager, Security in order to help expand our reach and influence in the business and security community, of which we serve 40,000 customers.

The Team

At-Bay’s Marketing team is helping grow At-Bay’s business, sharing our vision with the world, building our brand, and communicating the value of our insurance and security products to the market. You’ll be surrounded by a team that loves what they do—marrying the art and science of marketing to deliver value for our customers and the company.

Role Overview

At-Bay is looking for a Senior Product Marketing Manager with experience in the cybersecurity space to lead marketing efforts in a critical focus area for the company. Named a Fortune Cyber 60 company, At-Bay brings a novel approach to cybersecurity by using insurance to better align cybersecurity incentives, to the benefit of our 40K+ policyholders. This role has a unique opportunity to bring cybersecurity solutions at scale to a large and rapidly growing base.

In this role, you’ll work very closely with product management, sales, services and DFIR teams within the security organization to help promote and drive the adoption of At-Bay’s premium security products, specifically Managed Detection and Response (MDR). Your focus will design, plan, execute, and iterate on a marketing strategy to promote and launch cybersecurity solutions, with the goal of making our clients even more secure.

This role will be at the forefront of At-Bay’s push to provide more durable and value-add cybersecurity solutions to our clients. Success in this role will include driving adoption and retention metrics, reducing the frequency and severity of cyber insurance claims, and becoming a catalyst for the company’s growth.

How You’ll Make An Impact

By 3 months:

• You’ll understand our business and have created relationships with key cross-functional partners
• You’ll have gained a deep understanding of our security solutions, and have identified a few key areas for immediate improvement
• You’ll have started to understand our key customers
• You’ll have improved upon the core positioning and messaging for our security solutions


By 6 months:

• You’ll have led one major marketing initiative
• You will be gathering market feedback to refine personas and to influence product and marketing roadmaps
• You will be a SME for our security solutions, will know how our solution compares to competitors’, and will be able to translate new technical details into impactful marketing
• You’ll have identified gaps in our go-to-market motion, and will have proposed focus areas for improvement


What you’ve already accomplished:

• Experience in the field of Cybersecurity, SaaS, or in Managed Services.
• Demonstrated experience as a product marketing leader within a B2B go-to-market motion
• Experience enabling a B2B sales team through effective storytelling, deep customer understanding, and competitive intelligence
• Ability to work and develop marketing collateral like white papers, buyer’s guides, and other pieces of marketing collateral
• Proven track record of developing messaging and positioning strategies that drive behavior change, especially among SMB and Mid-market audiences
• Proven ability to develop and share customer/user insights and create strong and strategic partnerships with key product and technology internal stakeholders.
• Comfort in ambiguity, with a willingness to be scrappy in developing a solution in a fast-paced startup environment
• Strong presentation, writing, public speaking, and project management skills
• Note: No knowledge of insurance is required for this role!


Our estimated base pay range for this role is $170,000-$200,000 per year. Base salary is determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to market data, location, internal equitability, domain knowledge, experiences and skills. In general, if the position sparks your interest we encourage you to apply - our team prioritizes talent.

About Brightway

Established in 2008, Brightway is proud to be one of the fastest-growing insurance agency systems in the United States. With over 350 franchises spanning 35+ states and an impressive $1.3 billion in annual premiums, we rank among the nation’s largest privately owned property and casualty insurance distribution companies. We support our agency owners with comprehensive back-office services, marketing resources, and continuous learning and development.

We are embarking on the next stage of our customer-centric growth, driven by innovation from our talented associates and the application of cutting-edge technologies. This growth has opened doors for creative thinkers who thrive in a diverse and collaborative culture. As a Brightway team member, you'll engage in exciting projects that are reshaping the industry, working alongside a dedicated team committed to delivering exceptional customer service and safeguarding our clients' most valuable assets.

Position Overview:

We are looking for a dynamic Product Manager to help lead this evolution in our Engagement Center, a 300+ person operation that services over 100,000 interactions per month. As a key player in our journey, you will reimagine outdated, inefficient processes and drive the adoption of innovative technologies with AI, conversational AI, CRM platforms, automation, and vendor integrations. This role offers a unique opportunity to reshape how we service our customers, making our operations more efficient, reducing costs, and significantly enhancing the customer experience in the process.

At the heart of this transformation is a deep focus on our customers—both the insurance advisors who rely on our systems and the policyholders they serve. You will take the time to understand their pain points, listen to their needs, and bring empathy into every solution you design. By improving the tools and processes they interact with, you will make their day-to-day lives easier, more efficient, and more enjoyable. This is an exciting opportunity to directly impact customer satisfaction and success, helping people experience the best that technology can offer. If you are passionate about customer-centric innovation and love the challenge of turning problems into meaningful solutions, this role is for you!

You will be responsible for understanding and articulating a roadmap that aligns technical solutions with process and business problems, ultimately driving financial outcomes. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, customer service, engineering, and executives to identify opportunities to apply technology, define product requirements, and communicate the product vision to stakeholders, investors, and the board. Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO), you will be a key driver in our digital transformation journey.

Key Responsibilities

• Product Strategy: Define and communicate a clear product vision and strategy aligned with business goals and market opportunities. 
• Product Roadmap: Develop and maintain a comprehensive product roadmap, prioritizing features based on user feedback, market trends, and business objectives in line with iterative, agile development processes. 
• Agile Development: Lead the product development process in an Agile environment, including defining user stories, prioritizing the backlog, and ensuring timely delivery of product increments from ideation to launch. 
• Customer Focus: Gather, analyze, and incorporate feedback and pain points to inform product decisions and continuously improve the end-to-end experience to maximize impact on the customer and the bottom line. 
• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engagement center leadership, engineering, UX, analytics and finance to ensure aligned business requirements, seamless product development and launch. 
• Performance Metrics: Define and track OKRs to measure product success and iterate based on data-driven insights. 
• Stakeholder Communication: Present product updates, progress, and vision to internal stakeholders and executive leadership. Exceptional leadership and communication skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across teams, including working closely with executives and business leaders is a must. 
• Technology Fluency: Identify opportunities to leverage technology to solve business problems, with an understanding of how the solution is composed end-to-end.


Education And Experience

This position requires a bachelor's degree and at least 5 years of experience in product management or related field.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or a related field. 
• Proven experience as a Product Manager, with a track record of successfully delivering digital products and driving business results. 
• Experience with agile development methodologies and tools. 
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and business and financial concepts. 
• Understanding of the insurance industry is a plus

For this position, the salary range is $95,000 - $112,000+ based on experience, skills, role responsibilities, internal equity, and market data. This range reflects our commitment to fair pay and is intended to provide candidates with a clear understanding of potential earnings before they apply.

Who are we?

A strategic and trusted insurance partner, Berkshire Hathaway Specialty Insurance (BHSI), provides a broad range of commercial property, casualty and specialty insurance coverages and outstanding service to customers and brokers around the world. Part of Berkshire Hathaway’s insurance operations, we bring our solutions to market with our stellar brand name, top-rated balance sheet, and the expertise of our global team of professionals, who exude excellent capabilities and strong character.

We are a values-based organization where respect, integrity, excellence, collaboration, and passion define who we are and how we do business. We value diversity of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives and strive to foster an inclusive environment that enables all our team members to bring their best selves to work. We are one team committed to building a culture where every teammate has the opportunity to contribute and be recognized. Want to be part of the team building the finest property, casualty and specialty lines insurance company in the world?

Learn more about our unique culture and history .

BHSI Offers

• A competitive package and exciting growth opportunities for career-oriented teammate
• A dynamic, action oriented, and thoughtful environment centered on always doing the right thing for our customers, teammates and our other stakeholders
• A purposely non-bureaucratic organization that embraces simplicity over complexity and emphasizes individual excellence in a team framework


NOTE: Compensation will be commensurate with experience. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Team Member may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization

• SITE

Job Details

Job Location

Smithfield, RI - Smithfield, RI

Position Type

Full Time

Education Level

Associates Degree

Travel Percentage

Occasional

Job Shift

Daytime

Job Category

Professional / Experienced

Description

 Position Overview (On-site, Smithfield, RI)

The Configuration Management Analyst is an entry to mid- level position responsible for the analysis, design, build, testing, implementation, and maintenance of system configuration to support business requirements and optimize system functionality. This position is also responsible for identifying areas of automation and enhancement to support and improve internal workflows, review system capabilities, and identify gaps and limitations. In addition, this role is responsible for ensuring adherence to the system development lifecycle and maintenance of all supporting documentation. The role requires strong analytical and problem-solving skills, the ability to work independently and proactively as well as demonstrated skills in providing excellent customer service.

Duties And Responsibilities

The duties for this position include, but are not limited to the following items:

• Serve as a key resource in facilitating the gathering of business and technical requirements in addition to test cases for all configuration changes 
• Work with corporate project collaborators and Business Analyst to formulate and communicate business requirements and scope of project 
• Work with various business areas at different levels within the organization to translate business requirements into technical specifications documents and also act as liaison to translate technical questions and processes into a format the business can understand 
• Analyze business requirements and objectives and perform system configuration analysis, design, coding, and unit testing following established processes, standards and procedures 
• Develop and maintain a library of standard operational procedures for all configuration tasks, including but not limited to creating and configuring benefit plans using best practice 
• Execute the build and implementation of benefit plan adjudication rules 
• Perform all configuration changes within multiple test environments, coordinating with testing and project teams to establish timelines and project planning in an effort to maintain the integrity of the environment in use 
• Responsible for configuration in depth research, review, and creation of claims data to validate configuration output is performing as expected 
• Handle the change control process when configuration results do not match expected outcome, partners with Business Analyst and Testing team to find solutions as needed 
• Develop and execute multiple unit test cases and complete Configuration Control Framework documentation to support configuration audit requests 
• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to validate and translate unit, positive, negative and regression testing results and any remediation necessary 
• Coordinate and document all configuration activity for change control and auditing 
• Responsible for coordination of production turnover of all configuration work upon business owner sign off as well as post production validation 
• Responsible for the Configuration Management Promotion process for HealthRules, Optum CES, and Burgess Source and other systems as needed 
• Serve as subject matter expert for root cause analysis and issue resolution, by providing guidance on system limitations and functionality 
• Develop proof of concepts prototype configuration to support business requirements and develop documented solutions and processes 
• Identify gaps between business expectations and system limitations and suggest configuration improvements or streamlined maintenance processes and techniques 
• Responsible for completing Peer Quality review of configuration updates 
• Coordinate with the Neighborhood Application Support ticket tracking and bringing to resolution any software, configuration, EDI, CES tickets that require updates to the test or production environments 
• Perform business analysis duties for designated corporate projects and maintenance requests 
• Oversee process development and documentation for any new or altered functionality or business process. This will also include facilitating an annual audit of actual business processes versus what is documented 
• Identify potential areas of automation and aid in re-engineering the underlying business processes 
• Recommend and maintain standards for development of business cases and their documentation 
• Coordinate multiple simultaneous projects and initiatives, while maintaining business as usual tasks 
• Other duties as assigned 
• Corporate Compliance Responsibility - As an essential function, responsible for complying with Neighborhood’s Corporate Compliance Program, Standards of Business Conduct, applicable contracts, laws, rules and regulations, policies and procedures as it applies to individual job duties, the department, and the Company. This position must exercise due diligence to prevent, detect and report unlawful and/or unethical conduct by fellow co-workers, professional affiliates and/or agents



 Core Company-Wide Competencies:

• Communicate Effectively 
• Respect Others & Value Diversity 
• Analyze Issues & Solve Problems 
• Drive for Customer Success 
• Manage Performance, Productivity & Results 
• Develop Flexibility & Achieve Change



 Job Specific Competencies:

• Collaborate & Foster Teamwork 
• Attend to Detail & Improve Quality 
• Create & Innovate 
• Plan & Organize



 FDR Oversight:

• n/a



 Travel Expectations:

• Local Business Travel will be required as needed



Neighborhood Health Plan of Rhode Island is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Qualifications

Qualifications

Required:

• Associates degree and/or years of experience and background to equate to the degree 
• Minimum of two years of business analysis and system configuration experience; or similar demonstrated experience working with health care claim processing 
• Prior experience in a Health Care organization or setting 
• Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work across the organization and to interact, influence



and negotiate effectively

• Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a deadline driven environment 
• Proficient in MS Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Word 
• Strong communication skills, both verbal and written



Preferred:

• Experience with the Health Rules Payor transactional system 
• Experience with Acuity software 
• Experience with Optum CES (Claims Editing Software) 
• Experience with SQL queries 
• Experience with Crystal reports/letters



Neighborhood Health Plan of Rhode Island is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

metadata.title: Configuration Management Analyst

description:
Why you should join our At-Bay Security team:

At-Bay is a fast-growth InsurSec company (Insurance x Cybersecurity) on a mission to bring innovative products to the market that help protect small businesses from digital risks. As an InsurSec provider, we uniquely combine insurance with mission-critical security technologies, threat intelligence, and human expertise, to bridge the critical security capability gap that exists among SMBs in the community. We believe InsurSec is an $80B market opportunity and we are excited to expand our DFIR team in order to help expand our reach and influence in the business and security community, of which we serve 35,000 customers.

With At-Bay, our customers experience 5X fewer ransomware attacks. This is just the tip of the iceberg! Click here to learn more about what we're building.

The Role:

• Cybersecurity Analysts focused on Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) deliver incident investigation and response services to At-Bay insureds via:
• Forensically sound collection, transmission, and storage of digital evidence
• Analysis of digital evidence to identify indicators of compromise and adversary activity
• Development of incident timelines and theories of compromise
• Identification of incident root causes
• Participation in threat actor negotiations as necessary (e.g., ransom negotiations, etc.)
• Participation in incident recovery (e.g., restoration of data from backups, reimaging workstations and servers, rebuilding network infrastructure, etc.) activities as necessary
• Development and delivery of incident reports to document key incident details for engagement stakeholders including executive leaders for insureds, breach coach attorneys, and At-Bay claims management staff as necessary
• Development and delivery of recommendations to mitigate the risk of future incidents for impacted insureds
• Development and delivery of incident response training and simulations for targeted insureds

Key skills:

• Previous digital forensics and incident response experience
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Previous hands-on experience performing digital forensics and incident response, including several of the following:
• Business Email Compromise
• Ransomware
• Digital evidence collection and analysis
• Development and analysis of cyber threat intelligence
• Leadership of or participation in investigations involving digital evidence
• Intrusion detection / cyber threat hunting
• Malware analysis
• Incident recovery activities such as restoration of data from backups, operation of decryptor tools, etc. 
• Previous hands-on experience working in information technology operations (e.g., Network Operations Center, Security Operations Center, Incident Response Team, etc.)


Minimum requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
• Minimum of 3 years of experience in cybersecurity operations, incident response, incident recovery, or another security discipline
• Willingness to travel as needed to perform job functions


Preferred requirements:

• Significant undergraduate or graduate coursework in computer science, computer engineering, information systems, or cybersecurity
• Previous background in law enforcement or government/military with experience leading complex technical investigations
• Knowledge of cloud environments, including knowledge of cloud security products and services offered by major cloud service providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google)
• Experience in a top-10 cyber consulting firm or leading DFIR provider preferred
• One or more industry cybersecurity certifications (e.g., GCIH, Security+, CISSP, etc.)


Work location:

• Canada, Remote


Our estimated base pay range for this role is $130,000-$150,000 CAD per year. Base salary is determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to market data, location, internal equitability, domain knowledge, experiences and skills. In general, if the position sparks your interest we encourage you to apply - our team prioritizes talent.

metadata.title: Sr. Cyber Analyst, Digital Forensics Incident Response

description:
An exciting opportunity exists to join the ProAssurance family of companies!

Our mission is powerful and simple: We protect others. Choosing a place to apply your talents is an important decision for anyone. You have plenty of options. Why choose ProAssurance?

At ProAssurance, we sell a pledge, and that pledge is delivered by our team members. We are seeking individuals who value integrity, leadership, relationships, and enthusiasm—and want to build their career with a great company where they can be their authentic self and feel valued, recognized, and rewarded for their contributions. ProAssurance specializes in healthcare professional liability, products liability for medical technology and life sciences, legal professional liability, and workers' compensation insurance. We are an industry-leading specialty insurer operating in all 50 states, with in-office, hybrid, and remote job opportunities around the country.

This position supports the misc medical (senior care, ambulatory, surgical center, hospice, pharmacy, etc) division of our medical professional liability line of business.

This role can be fully remote and located in the Mountain or Pacific Time Zones in order to meet the business of the position.

Candidates should have a minimum 5 years related experience and be located in one of the specified time zones for full consideration. Senior Care or Misc Med claims experience is highly desired.

Job Summary:

The primary responsibility of the Senior Claims Specialist position is to provide direction and guidance throughout the life of the complex claims, both litigated and non-litigated. The Senior Claims Specialist directs the management of complex claims including claims investigation, coverage analysis, monitoring of defense counsel activities, control of legal expenses, reserving, and providing technical expertise throughout the life of the claim file.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• 25% - Investigates and evaluates liability, causation and damages in direct patient and litigated claims. Ensures proper file documentation of assigned files, by complying with company and state requirements. Establishes and continually evaluates case reserves.
• 25% - Responsible for preparing reports for management, by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing claim information. Keeps apprised of changes in the law and court procedures affecting claims in jurisdictions supervised.
• 25% - Collaborates with defense counsel with regard to defense tactics and strategies, per department guidelines. Maintains communication with Director and Counsel. Participates in selection of expert witnesses.
• 15% - Attends trials, settlement conferences, mediations, and insured meetings.
• 5% - Review and approval of reasonable legal expenses and fees associated with the claim file, and negotiation of adjustment of charges when appropriate.
• 3% - Participates in settlement negotiations.


Secondary Responsibilities:

• 2% - Perform special projects as directed by management.


Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree required.
• Advanced degree or certification in the medical, legal or insurance field preferred.
• Minimum five years’ experience managing high exposure claims or at least seven years’ experience in the legal or medical field, with a high degree of specialized and technical competence.
• Professional liability experience preferred.
• Strong background and demonstrated ability in dealing with significant coverage matters.
• Extensive travel may be required.
• Willingness and ability to be available beyond normal business hours.
• Excellent interpersonal communications and negotiation skills.
• Ability to make prompt, intelligent decisions based upon detailed analysis of complex issues
• Strong analytical skills.
• Proven leadership, communication, and writing skills, strong interpersonal, and relationship management expertise.
• Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks effectively.
• Valid driver’s license required.


We are committed to providing a dynamic and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work and grow personally and professionally.

For that reason, we partner with The Predictive Index (PI) – an organization equally committed to improving the working lives of people, to help us hire the best talent by providing additional insight about one’s work style.

The position you applied to requires completion of two assessments prior to being scheduled to interview with a hiring manager. Completion of the assessments is not required in order for your application to be reviewed and to speak with a Talent Acquisition team member. These assessments are Behavioral and Cognitive (internal candidates will only receive the Behavioral assessment), and each assessment takes less than 12 minutes to complete.

After submitting your application, you will receive two emails from The Predictive Index inviting you to complete each of these assessments (please check your SPAM or Junk email folder if you do not see these emails in your inbox).

Position Salary Range

$72,962.00 - $120,400.00

The salary range displayed represents the entirety of the pay grade for this position. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the range. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have, your location and comparison to other team members already in this role.

Build your career with us and enjoy access to a best-in-class benefits program.

Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have, your location and comparison to other team members already in this role.

Build your career with us and enjoy access to a best-in-class benefits program.

metadata.title: Senior Claims Specialist - Medical Professional Liability

description:
An exciting opportunity exists to join the ProAssurance family of companies!

Our mission is powerful and simple: We protect others. Choosing a place to apply your talents is an important decision for anyone. You have plenty of options. Why choose ProAssurance?

At ProAssurance, we sell a pledge, and that pledge is delivered by our team members. We are seeking individuals who value integrity, leadership, relationships, and enthusiasm—and want to build their career with a great company where they can be their authentic self and feel valued, recognized, and rewarded for their contributions. ProAssurance specializes in healthcare professional liability, products liability for medical technology and life sciences, legal professional liability, and workers' compensation insurance. We are an industry-leading specialty insurer operating in all 50 states, with in-office, hybrid, and remote job opportunities around the country.

This position supports the misc medical (senior care, ambulatory, surgical center, hospice, pharmacy, etc) division of our medical professional liability line of business.

This role can be fully remote and located in the Mountain or Pacific Time Zones in order to meet the business of the position.

Candidates should have a minimum 5 years related experience and be located in one of the specified time zones for full consideration. Senior Care or Misc Med claims experience is highly desired.

Job Summary:

The primary responsibility of the Senior Claims Specialist position is to provide direction and guidance throughout the life of the complex claims, both litigated and non-litigated. The Senior Claims Specialist directs the management of complex claims including claims investigation, coverage analysis, monitoring of defense counsel activities, control of legal expenses, reserving, and providing technical expertise throughout the life of the claim file.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

• 25% - Investigates and evaluates liability, causation and damages in direct patient and litigated claims. Ensures proper file documentation of assigned files, by complying with company and state requirements. Establishes and continually evaluates case reserves.
• 25% - Responsible for preparing reports for management, by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing claim information. Keeps apprised of changes in the law and court procedures affecting claims in jurisdictions supervised.
• 25% - Collaborates with defense counsel with regard to defense tactics and strategies, per department guidelines. Maintains communication with Director and Counsel. Participates in selection of expert witnesses.
• 15% - Attends trials, settlement conferences, mediations, and insured meetings.
• 5% - Review and approval of reasonable legal expenses and fees associated with the claim file, and negotiation of adjustment of charges when appropriate.
• 3% - Participates in settlement negotiations.


Secondary Responsibilities:

• 2% - Perform special projects as directed by management.


Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree required.
• Advanced degree or certification in the medical, legal or insurance field preferred.
• Minimum five years’ experience managing high exposure claims or at least seven years’ experience in the legal or medical field, with a high degree of specialized and technical competence.
• Professional liability experience preferred.
• Strong background and demonstrated ability in dealing with significant coverage matters.
• Extensive travel may be required.
• Willingness and ability to be available beyond normal business hours.
• Excellent interpersonal communications and negotiation skills.
• Ability to make prompt, intelligent decisions based upon detailed analysis of complex issues
• Strong analytical skills.
• Proven leadership, communication, and writing skills, strong interpersonal, and relationship management expertise.
• Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks effectively.
• Valid driver’s license required.


We are committed to providing a dynamic and inclusive environment where everyone can do their best work and grow personally and professionally.

For that reason, we partner with The Predictive Index (PI) – an organization equally committed to improving the working lives of people, to help us hire the best talent by providing additional insight about one’s work style.

The position you applied to requires completion of two assessments prior to being scheduled to interview with a hiring manager. Completion of the assessments is not required in order for your application to be reviewed and to speak with a Talent Acquisition team member. These assessments are Behavioral and Cognitive (internal candidates will only receive the Behavioral assessment), and each assessment takes less than 12 minutes to complete.

After submitting your application, you will receive two emails from The Predictive Index inviting you to complete each of these assessments (please check your SPAM or Junk email folder if you do not see these emails in your inbox).

Position Salary Range

$72,962.00 - $120,400.00

The salary range displayed represents the entirety of the pay grade for this position. Most candidates will start in the bottom half of the range. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary include your specific skills, how many years of experience you have, your location and comparison to other team members already in this role.

Build your career with us and enjoy access to a best-in-class benefits program.

description:
About the role: 
People First isn't just something we say, it's in everything we do. At DUAL, we strive to create an inclusive and engaging culture by bringing on team members who are excited to contribute unique ideas and make real impacts on our company and business! Our HR team is at the core of championing this culture.
The Talent & Organizational Development Manager is a strategic role focused on supporting the company's talent and organizational development initiatives. This individual will collaborate with leaders and teams across the organization to identify talent development needs, design impactful learning experiences, and implement organizational change initiatives that drive business success. This role is critical in ensuring that our people have the tools, skills, and resources to reach their full potential, align with business objectives, and support long-term growth. We are looking for someone who can drive strategy and vision, while also jumping in and executing down to the last detail. The individual who comes into this role should be excited about the opportunity to have a big impact in a short amount of time!




Essential Functions:
Learning & Talent Development:
• Collaborate with peers and senior leaders to identify training needs and develop tailored learning solutions across a variety of topics – these will span from technical systems training, to onboarding, to Underwriting 101, to Manager & Leadership Development programs, and more
• Facilitate and deliver learning programs in partnership with HRBPs, both virtually and in-person
• Lead the development and implementation of best in class learning experiences from strategy through value delivery
• Define metrics/KPIs to demonstrate the impact of Talent & OD initiatives
• Make recommendations for continuous improvement
• Ensure that industry leading practices are incorporated into learning programs
• Define and manage the strategy for use of future learning technologies
• Develop & maintain ecosystem partnerships with vendors to advance DUAL’s people development goals
• Administer learning schedules, calendars, and maintain participant records during training as needed
• Partner with Compliance team to support compliance training if/when necessary
Organizational Development:
• Establish a Change Management framework
• Lead change management initiatives for strategic business priorities to drive organizational transformation and continuous improvement; changes could vary between technical systems changes, organizational re-structuring, key HR changes, and more
• Drive employee engagement initiatives, measuring and tracking success through surveys, focus groups, and feedback mechanisms
• Support other Employee Engagement & HR initiatives as needed – we are a small team and often work cross-functionally!




Job Requirements (education, experience, skills):
• Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Communications, Organizational Development, Business or another related degree
• Minimum of 5+ years in a Learning & Development role, including instructional design, curriculum development, implementation, and learning program evaluation; experience leading Manager & Leadership Development programs preferable
• Minimum of 2+ years of experience in Change Management, Comms and/or Organizational Development experience required
• Project Management experience preferred
• Ability to navigate ambiguity and build programs from scratch
• Self-motivated, organized, and excited to have a positive impact


What we offer:
A career that you define. Yes, we offer all the usual rewards and benefits - including medical, dental, vision, a wide variety of wellbeing offers, competitive salary, flexible PTO, 401k with company match, paid volunteer days and more.
We provide an environment where new ideas are encouraged and celebrated, where people who want to have a real hand in our success thrive. We want people who want to make a difference - not just in the workplace, but in the industry and in the wider community.




About DUAL NA:
DUAL is the leading underwriting organization in the US and part of an international insurance organization with operations in 45 countries across the world. DUAL offers commercial property, casualty, financial lines, and personal property insurance products underwritten through several specialized subsidiaries. Since 2013, we have grown to over 500 employees in 14 offices across the US, and we are continuing to grow. DUAL is committed to building a balanced business and contributing to a sustainable world. At DUAL, we believe our people are our greatest assets, espousing entrepreneurialism, and innovation in an environment where new insights are encouraged.




Our culture: People First
Our core values dictate how we live and work. We are a group with independence and people at its heart and we are a home for talent with a unique culture: the biggest small company in the world.
The focus on being a People First business has always been at the very heart of the Group; Our vision was to create an independent business with a unique culture and one that would survive and thrive as a business controlled by the people working for it. And finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people to join the Group has been and will continue to be key.




EEO Statement:
We consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness, and respect. DUAL North America provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. DUAL will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Job Details

Description
