Job Summary

 Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled Director of Financial Planning and Analysis to join our healthcare technology company. This strategic role will work closely with the Enterprise Finance leadership and Divisional President to drive business performance, develop financial strategies, and support decision-making within the business unit. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in financial analysis, a strong understanding of the healthcare technology landscape, and exceptional leadership skills to foster collaboration across teams.

 Setting  : Professional office environment with hybrid and flexible schedule options available.

Compensation

This is an exempt position at a very competitive salary. Our comprehensive benefit package includes health and dental benefits, short-term disability plans, 401k with company matching, paid time off policy and more. We also offer an onsite gym, café, and coffee shop.

Key Responsibilities

• Partner closely with the Divisional President to develop and execute financial strategies that align with business objectives and drive growth. 
• Lead the FP&A function for the business unit, managing budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling processes. 
• Analyze business performance metrics, identifying trends and variances to provide actionable insights and recommendations for improvement. 
• Prepare and present comprehensive financial reports to the Divisional President and key stakeholders, highlighting key performance indicators and strategic implications. 
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess business opportunities, evaluate investment proposals, and support operational initiatives. 
• Implement best practices in financial planning and analysis to enhance accuracy, efficiency, and responsiveness to changing business conditions. 
• Monitor industry trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory changes to inform financial strategies and business planning. 
• Mentor and develop the FP&A team, fostering a culture of analytical rigor and professional growth. 
• Ensure compliance with financial regulations and maintain effective internal controls within the business unit.


Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred. 
• Minimum seven years of experience in financial planning and analysis, with a focus on the healthcare or technology sectors. 
• Proven track record of working closely with senior leadership to drive business performance and strategic decision-making. 
• Strong financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting skills, with proficiency in financial software and ERP systems (e.g., Sage Intacct SAP, Oracle, Hyperion). 
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. 
• Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire collaboration and drive results. 
• Exceptional communication and presentation skills, capable of conveying complex financial information to diverse audiences. 
• Familiarity with healthcare technology trends, reimbursement models, and regulatory requirements is highly desirable.


Our Company

The Rawlings Company LLC is looking for hard-working, talented people who share our commitment to excellence. The Rawlings Company LLChas successfully provided cost containment services to the largest health insurers in the country for more than 40 years and continues to grow as an industry leader.

On September 5, 2024, New Mountain Capital, LLC, a leading growth-oriented investment firm with over $55 billion in assets under management, announced the completion of a merger among The Rawlings Company LLC , Apixio's Payment Integrity (PI) business , and VARIS to form the leading technology-enabled platform focused on lowering the cost of care across the healthcare system.

Our Culture Is Focused On

• The guiding principle of doing the right thing. 
• Caring for our employees and taking pride in the work they do 
• Providing recognition and financially rewarding employees for their success


Our Values Are

• Integrity and Trust 
• Customer Service Excellence 
• Innovation 
• Diversity and Inclusion 
• Honoring our Veterans and Their Service


Physical Requirements

• Frequently remains in sitting position for long periods of time to perform duties. 
• Frequently concentrates for long periods of time, paying close attention to detail. 
• Frequently uses and views the computer using fingers, hands, and vision. 
• Frequently works in a well-lit, tempered environment. 
• Occasionally moves through office to communicate with other employees. 
• Equal Employment Opportunity. It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification.
• The Rawlings Company LLC is an employment at will employer.


#INDHP

metadata.title: Senior Director of Financial Planning & Analysis

description:
Position Summary:

The Senior Developer uses skills as a seasoned and experienced member of the MedCost team. Leveraging industry practices, company policies and best practices, the Senior Developer is responsible for critical collaboration, design and development tasks necessary to securely implement application and data solutions. The individual in this position is accountable for cross-training, mentoring, application design, and application development in alignment with the MedCost Software Development Life Cycle (SDLS). The individual in this position will be an advocate for and champion of MedCost’s Change Control policies and procedures to ensure new and existing application changes are reviewed and approved before implementation. This position has a critical role in support of the Manager, Solutions Development and Support. Reinforcement of design, implementation, project and documentation standards are essential. Key responsibilities include designing and developing programmatic solutions in the appropriate application tier. This includes but is not limited to SQL database tables and procedures, windows form applications, web interfaces, and console applications. Ensuring applications are well documented for continued business growth is essential.

Position Responsibilities:

• Collaboration with IT project managers and Business Units to draft business and technical requirements while reinforcing project standards. 
• Coordination with Infrastructure and Development teams to design and program solutions, ensuring that these are aligned with supported technologies. 
• Application evaluation, improvement and documentation. 
• Planning and mentoring of other application developers. 
• Administrative tasks specific to forms, spreadsheets, calendaring, time entry and structured efficiencies. 
• Assist Manager, Solutions Development and Support in evaluating applications development team and recommend team members for development opportunities.
• Documents and reports on application performance. Recommend changes where appropriate.
• Provides mentoring and assistance to other developers, facilitating cross-training of application support.
• Apply system analysis techniques and procedures to determine functional specifications.
• Keeps Manager, Solutions Development and Support and Director of IT abreast of the state of applications and support systems



Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Position Qualifications:

Required

• BA/BS degree or technical institute training and 3 or more years’ experience, or any combination of education and experience which would provide an equivalent background
• 5 - 8+ years of relevant application development experience in the outlined technologies preferred



Skills, Knowledge And Abilities

• Full stack developer of web/hybrid applications using .NET and .NET Core using C# and VB.net
• Experience in building and maintaining Windows applications such as Windows Forms, console applications, and Windows Services in VB.net and C#.
• Ability to build and maintain SQL queries and stored procedures for application support and reporting
• Experience with X12 EDI particularly Healthcare EDI
• Demonstrable experience with at least one JavaScript framework - Angular (9.0+), React, Vue, Ember, etc.
• Experience building and maintaining RESTful APIs, HTML, Javascript, CSS, JSON, XML transformation
• Experience with SDLC processes, spanning requirements/issue management, root cause assessment, defect tracking, build and test automation, and release management
• Experience working in both Waterfall and Agile environments
• Experience with Visual Studio 2015+ and Team Foundation Server
• Constant self-education in emerging software development technologies and methodologies
• Ability to communicate on a professional level with customers and staff
• Dynamic team player with collaboration skills
• Strong analytical and project management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translating them into application and operational requirements.
• Work independently with users to define concepts and under the direction of project managers.
• Exceptional customer service, and interpersonal skills
• Effective problem-solving and influencing skills
• Strong organizational, self-motivation, and decision-making skills
• Proficiency using Microsoft programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
• Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as needed



Key Competencies

• Service orientation
• Integrity
• Ethical practice and confidentiality
• Advanced understanding and competency of end-to-end programming



MedCost provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

MedCost participates in the Electronic Verification system (E-Verify) to electronically verify the work authorization of newly-hired employees. E-Verify is an internet-based program that compares information from an employee's Form I-9 to data contained in the federal records of the Social Security Administration and the Department of Homeland Security to confirm employment eligibility. MedCost does not use E-Verify to pre-screen job applicants.

Introduction:
The Zebra, named a Best Place to Work in Austin four years running, revolutionizes how connected consumers research and shop for insurance. We intentionally strive to build diverse teams that feel inclusive for all. Our motto is "All Stripes Welcome," we put that into practice by valuing traditional and non-conventional backgrounds and perspectives. Our Zeebs are passionate about learning, growing, & working together to tackle exciting problems.


We are seeking an experienced ​Omnichannel Solutions Specialist to implement, manage, and optimize our Genesys Cloud contact center platform. This individual will be responsible for configuring, administering, and supporting all omnichannel communications (voice, email, chat, SMS, social media) and managing workforce management (WFM), quality management (QM), and gamification features. To be successful in this role, you’ll have a solid technical background with contact center platforms, ACD management, and skilling strategies to drive customer service excellence and operational efficiency.


Location: 
While we are open to remote work across the contingent US, we are still establishing our company to support work in all states! We are set up to support employees who want to be fully remote, in-office only, or a mix of the two.
Please note—we will not be supporting work based out of the following states: CA, NY, MA, and NJ.


What You'll Do:
• Support the integration of Genesys with CRM, analytics, and workforce management tools. Generate detailed performance reports for key stakeholders on agent performance, customer satisfaction, and overall platform utilization.
• WFM (Workforce Management): Administer the Genesys WFM modules, supporting the WFM team in forecasting, scheduling, and tracking agent adherence to ensure service levels are met.
• Develop and optimize skill-based routing and skilling strategies to match customers with the best-suited agents, ensuring an improved customer experience.
• QM (Quality Management): Implement and manage Genesys’ Quality Management tools to monitor and evaluate agent interactions, create evaluation forms, score calls, and deliver feedback for continuous performance improvement.
• Configure and oversee the gamification features in Genesys to enhance agent motivation, drive productivity, and improve overall engagement through real-time feedback and incentives.
• User Training and Development: Train agents, supervisors, and managers on Genesys platform features (WFM, QM, gamification), ensuring they are fully equipped to utilize the platform effectively.
• Collaboration: 
• Work with internal IT & Compliance teams to ensure the platform complies with all relevant security and regulatory requirements to safeguard customer data and maintain system integrity.
• Partner with Genesys Cloud vendors for troubleshooting and technical support alongside The Zebra system administration team.
• Work with internal IT teams and vendors to manage updates, patches, and new feature rollouts for Genesys Cloud, ensuring smooth implementation with minimal disruption to business operations.


What We're Looking For: 
As we evaluate candidates across all roles, we look for folks with a strong sense of ownership, excellent communication and collaboration skills, and a dedication to continuous improvement.
• 3+ years of experience administering omnichannel contact center platforms. Hands-on experience with Genesys Cloud, including WFM and QM.
• Experience in ACD configuration, skilling strategies, and advanced routing techniques.
• Familiarity with system integrations (e.g., CRM, workforce management tools) and data reporting


Experience that will Impress the Heck Out of Us:
• Experience with API integrations and workforce optimization tools.
• Familiarity with contact center KPIs and analytics platforms.
• Basic scripting knowledge (JSON, XML).


Benefits & Perks:
Inclusive and healthy environments are crafted intentionally. All of our employees can join and participate in (or create your own!) Employee Resource Groups. Here are some other wonderful perks of working here:
• Competitive Compensation & Stock Option Offering
• Health, Dental, Vision & Disability Coverages
• HSA offering + employer contribution
• $100 monthly wellness perk
• $300 pet reimbursement program
• 401k with match
• Unlimited PTO (paid time off)+ flexibility to enjoy it
• Paid Parental Leave Program
• Learning & Development Opportunities
• Join a team that truly lives their values (outside of the office. Cliche, we know… but we really mean it)


About The Zebra:
The Zebra is the nation’s leading, independent insurance comparison site. With our dynamic, real-time quote comparison tool, consumers can identify insurance companies with the coverage, service level, and pricing to suit their unique needs. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, The Zebra has sought to bring transparency and simplicity to insurance shopping since 2012 -- it's “insurance in black and white.”
We've garnered the attention and investment of some of the nation’s top venture capitalists. Check out all of our awards & recognition!
Our core mantra is "All Stripes Welcome." As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce, we provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform core job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation!

As the Hagerty Valuation Tools Senior Technical Product Manager, you will define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap that delivers innovation in features, usability and product performance, working directly with in-house design and offshore engineering teams. You must be passionate about identifying consumer-facing problems and building impactful solutions.  As a highly experienced B2C Senior Technical Product Manager, you will be the voice of the customer. This role requires a leader who moves fast, has an entrepreneurial spirit, possesses a natural curiosity, sharp analytical skills, and can break down and solve complex problems. You will be expected to operate both strategically and tactically: thinking big to drive new opportunities, diving deep into the data to uncover customer insights, and working backwards from the customer.

If you know what's needed to make intricate and impactful products and teams successful and can transform a vision with many pieces into an executable, iterative plan that delivers results, then come join us!

Hagerty Valuation Tools is designed to help automotive enthusiasts make smarter buying and selling decisions for the cars they love, and the product is one of many that the Hagerty Customer Experience Technology (CXT) team creates. Our team is made up of motivated, customer-obsessed, forward-thinkers that look at everything in terms of experiences rather than transactions.  The CXT team delivers end-to-end online experiences across a range of products and services, including vehicle insurance quoting, purchasing, and management, as well as Hagerty's online auction marketplace, Driver's Club, and Media/Entertainment offerings.  We design, build and scale automotive experiences. With a focus on strategy, design, user experience, and engineering, we create value at every touchpoint in the customer journey.

Ready to get in the driver’s seat? Join us!

What You’ll Do

• Deliver product experiences that delight our customers and demonstrate meaningful impact and results on growth acceleration by defining success metrics, analyzing data for insights, prioritizing what to build, and coordinating with partner teams to align efforts to business strategies and trade-offs 
• Communicate and collaborate by articulating the “why” and “what” customer problem to solve, working with others, and balancing their point of view with solicited input of others 
• Drive product development from ideation to launch by identifying and addressing customer pain points, defining a compelling product vision, and leveraging innovative technology solutions to create tangible, shippable products that deliver measurable value to customers 
• Inform product strategy by actively gathering and analyzing customer feedback, monitoring competitors, and collaborating with design and engineering to ensure products meet customer needs and stay up to date with industry trends 
• Create well-structured strategy documents and product briefs that effectively communicate customer needs and pain points, align with company goals, evaluate the current state of products or features, present a clear vision for the future direction, and break down the plan into iterative releases with defined next steps, dependencies, and decision points 
• Define and prioritize product requirements and features in collaboration with cross-functional teams 
• Mobilize a team of an in-house designer and contracted engineers to do their best work by providing clear direction, handling dependencies, removing roadblocks and applying effective operating rhythms




This might describe you

• Extensive experience in end-to-end B2C product management, at a combination of large companies and startups, with a proven track record of launching successful digital products 
• Strong experience in delivering end-to-end digital products, from defining product vision and strategy to launching and iterating products, with a proven track record of successfully bringing products to market 
• Strong proficiency in creating comprehensive product strategies, developing detailed roadmaps, and crafting user stories that effectively communicate product requirements to cross-functional teams
• Demonstrated experience building data-rich products or experiences, particularly with analytics dashboards and data visualizations that are easy for customers to interpret and gain insights from, telling a clear story that enhances their decision-making journey. 
• Utilize effective frameworks for resolving trade-offs and prioritizing initiatives, leveraging strong research and analytical skills to make informed decisions. Implements time-boxed deliberation processes to ensure timely decision-making and facilitate structured, productive discussions among team members 
• Demonstrates a keen eye for product design, fluency in data analysis, and technical proficiency, while also possessing a voracious appetite for learning 
• Transforms ambiguity into execution by analyzing trends and determining scalable solutions. Skillfully balance strategic and tactical approaches to solve customer problems and achieve business goals, utilizing appropriate tools and tactics as needed 
• Balances strategic priorities, business goals, customer needs, technical feasibility, and time to market to define impactful product solutions; thinks strategically and executes methodically 
• Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, including precise and effective cross-team communications, the ability to simplify complex topics, and comfort presenting at all levels of the organization and with both technical and non-technical individuals 
• Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive product decisions 
• Organization skills that show you are process-oriented and have high attention to detail 
• Strong owner mentality and experience operating independently  
• Cultivates strong working relationships that drive collaboration across technical, design, and business teams 
• Familiarity of public company requirements, including Sarbanes Oxley and key regulations, if applicable


Other Things To Note

• This role can be worked from any U.S. remote location. 
• Familiarity with public company requirements, including Sarbanes Oxley and key regulations, if applicable. For SOX compliant roles, responsible for designing, executing, and documenting internal controls where they have been identified as owners to prevent errors in financial reporting, processes, and business operations. Including attestation to the completeness, accuracy, and compliance of all financial reporting data, where applicable.


Say hello to Hagerty

Hagerty is an automotive enthusiast brand and the world’s largest membership organization. Along with being a best-in-class provider of specialty insurance for enthusiasts, Hagerty is also home to the Hagerty Drivers Foundation, Garage + Social, Hagerty Drivers Club, Marketplace, and so much more. Committed to saving driving for future generations, each and every thing Hagerty does is dedicated to the love of the automobile.

Hagerty is a rapidly growing company that values a winning culture. We provide meaningful work for and invest in every single team member.

At Hagerty, we share the road. We are an inclusive automotive community where all are welcomed, valued and belong regardless of race, gender, age, or car preference.  We are united by our shared passion for driving, our commitment to preserve car culture for future generations and our desire to make a positive impact in the world.

If you reside in the following jurisdictions: Illinois, Colorado, California, District of Columbia, Hawaii, Maryland, Minnesota, Nevada, New York, or Jersey City, New Jersey, Vermont, Cincinnati or Toledo, Ohio, Rhode Island, Washington, British Columbia, Canada please email recruiting@hagerty.com for compensation, comprehensive benefits and the perks that set us apart.

EEO/AA

US Benefits Overview

Canada Benefits Overview

UK Benefits Overview

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

DEVELOP INSIGHTS TO INFLUENCE AT-BAY’S TRAJECTORY

At-Bay is the world’s first InsurSec provider designed from the ground up to help businesses tackle cyber risk head on. By combining industry-leading insurance with world-class cybersecurity technology, At-Bay offers end-to-end prevention and protection for the digital age. With 98% of cyber insurance claims in the past five years coming from small and mid-size businesses with revenue under $2B, providing an integrated solution to help manage risk is more critical than ever.

At-Bay helps its 40,000+ customers close their security technology and skills gap — all through their cyber insurance policy — making them 5X less likely to be hit with a ransomware attack. As a full-stack insurance company, At-Bay offers multiple lines of specialty insurance, including Cyber, Tech E&O, and Miscellaneous Professional Liability (MPL) policies.

Why you should join our Business Analytics team:

At-Bay’s Business Analytics team ensures that our decision-making is grounded in the facts of our business and the markets we operate in. We support our executive team and business leaders across all revenue-generating activities. Using a comprehensive toolset of advanced analytics skills and models, we identify shifts in market and growth performance and translate these insights into actionable decisions for the company.

Role overview:

You will be part of the Business Analytics team, delivering high-quality output and managing analytics projects independently. As a senior business analyst within the broader analytics community, you will collaborate with other leaders across the enterprise to enhance our ability to deliver insights consistently, quickly, and accurately. Additionally, you will establish processes to ensure our portfolio of analytics products remains consistent and clear.

How you’ll make an impact:

By 3 months you will…

• Understand our business – how our products, services, distribution, technology stack, and partners serve our customers through insurance and security.
• Establish relationships with colleagues and understand the roles and functions of the broader analytics and business teams
• Develop autonomy and familiarity in navigating our data stack and analytics to generate essential insights. 
• You’ll start performing analyses to inform and support strategic decision-making, balancing growth and profitability.


By 6 months you will...

• You’ll have working relationships with key stakeholders and start collaborating to share insights and identify opportunities to drive material impact on the portfolio
• Regularly partner with our go-to-market, technology, insurance, security services, and other teams to improve our products and processes
• Demonstrate your ability to use analytics to generate insights and drive executive conversations on steps we can take to improve business performance
• Propose data-driven improvements to processes or business practices based on your analysis
• Establish yourself as a reliable team member, capable of handling core responsibilities independently and contributing valuable insights


What you’ve accomplished already:

• Bachelor's Degree or higher in Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field
• Led multiple analytics projects from requirements definition to final synthesis. Previous insurance experience not required but is a plus
• Engaged all levels of stakeholders (frontline to senior exec) in presenting findings and problem-solving
• Helped organizations translate ambiguous problem statements into concrete recommendations
• Experience with using SQL to conduct data manipulation, including cleaning/transforming/creating data 
• Experience with using Python for various forms of analyses, including building models, running automated processes, data cleaning 
• Demonstrated the ability to deliver explainable models and analytics products that leverage an analytics tech stack (Snowflake/SQL, Python/R, Tableau/Looker, Excel, etc)


Pay transparency paragraph: Our estimated base pay range for this role is 135,000-$165,000 per year. Base salary is determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to market data, location, internal equitability, domain knowledge, experiences and skills. In general, if the position sparks your interest we encourage you to apply - our team prioritizes talent.
